texts.es: Yovana vive con su hermano, en un cuarto alquilado, tiene 27 años y ha decido progresar, sabe que mejorando su negocio lo podrá lograr, es por eso que esta dispuesta a poner todo de su parte, para conseguir su meta. Gracias a la creciente demanda por ropa de buena calidad, pero de un precio accesible, Yovana a podido cambiar su vida, tiene un pequeño puesto en Juliaca donde vende ropa barata y muy bien confeccionada, ella sola atiende a sus clientes y eso es lo que más le gusta, ya que puede aconsejarles sobre los últimos cambios de la moda, quiere tener un puesto más grande donde venda gran cantidad de ropa, aunque es conciente de que le será difícil conseguir toda la cantidad que necesita. Son 5 años que tiene en este negocio y se siente capaz de afrontar este cambio, con la única finalidad de forjar un futuro adecuado para su hermano y ella. Es su primer préstamo en Microfinanzas PRISMA y ha decidido ser muy cuidadosa en la inversión de ese dinero, además que tiene siempre presente los consejos de los miembros más antiguos de su banco comunal. Yovana planea comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería, ropa que este a la moda, para lo cual invertirá todo el préstamo en ello, ya que espera que este año, su puesto sea uno de los más concurridos.
texts.en:
Yovana lives with her brother, in a rented room, is 27 years old, and has decided to progress, knowing that improving her business is something she can achieve. This is why she is disposed to put everything for her part to achieve her goal. Thanks to the increasing demand for good quality clothes, but at an affordable price, Yovana has been able to change her life, she has a small stand in Juliaca where she sells cheap and very well made clothing. She attends to her customers alone and this is what she likes the most, since she can advise them about the latest changes in fashion. She wants to have a larger stand where she will sell more clothing, even though she knows it will be difficult to get the needed quantity. She has had this business for five years and she feels capable of facing this change, with the the sole goal of forging an adequate future for her brother and her. This is her first loan in Microfinanzas PRISMA and she has decided to be very careful in the investment of this money, also she always has the advice of the older members of the community bank. Yovana plans to buy a larger quantity of merchandise, fashionable clothing, so she will invest all of her loan in that, now that she is hoping that this year, her shop will be one of the most popular.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing clothes

loans.name: Zonia

texts.es: A sus 37 años, Zonia quiere trabajar muy duro para pagar los estudios de sus 2 menores hijos, vive con su esposo en un cuarto alquilado y desea mejorar su negocio para darle a su familia una vida apropiada. Zonia es una madre ejemplar, trata en todo momento de darle lo mejor a sus hijos, aunque su situación económica no siempre lo permite. Todos los días, lana y agujas en mano, teje sus artesanías, para luego salir a venderlas por las calles de Juliaca, ofreciéndolas a todo el que pasa, pero son los turistas que visitan la ciudad los que más adquieren sus hermosos tejidos. Ella se entretiene mucho tejiendo, pues es la labor que aprendió de su madre, pero le es muy cansado recorrer las calles de la ciudad, bajo los calurosos rayos solares. Zonia tiene 9 años en este negocio y anhela tener su tienda de artesanías, donde pueda vender sin necesidad de caminar tanto, su negocio es muy rentable debido a la gran demanda que existe por las artesanías, sobre todo por los turistas. Para mejorar la vida de sus hijos, Zonia ha decidido adquirir su cuarto préstamo y espera pagar todas sus cuotas, como lo ha hecho anteriormente, pues ella siempre se preocupa en cumplir su cronograma de pagos a tiempo, además sabe que tiene un compromiso con su banco comunal. Con el préstamo adquirido en Microfinanzas PRISMA comprará más lana y ampliará su negocio, además desea comprar tejidos ya hechos, para venderlos, todo esto le costará alrededor de 1000 soles.
texts.en:
Zonia, aged 37, wants to work very hard to pay for her two young sons' studies. She lives with her husband in a rented room and wants to improve her business in order to give her family a decent life. Zonia is a model mother, always trying to give the best to her children even though her financial situation does not always allow her to do so. Every day, wool and needles in hand, she weaves her crafts to later go sell them in the streets of Juliaca, offering them to all who pass by, but selling her beautiful fabrics mainly to tourists. She does a lot of weaving as this is what she learnt from her mother, but it is very tiring travelling the roads of the city under the blistering sun. Zonia has been in this business for nine years and longs to have a store for her crafts where she could sell without having to walk so much. Her business is very profitable because of the high demand for handicrafts, especially from tourists. To improve her children's lives, Zonia has decided to ask for this, her fourth loan. She expects to repay her loan as she has done previously: she always takes care to repay on time as she knows she has made a commitment to her community bank. With the loan from Microfinanzas PRISMA, she will buy more wool and expand her business; she also wants to buy weavings ready-made in order to sell them which she estimates will cost her 1000 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials for weaving

loans.name: Maria Hortencia

texts.es: Doña Maria Hortencia tiene 46 años de edad, reside en  villa reconciliación con cuatro hermosos hijos mayores de edad, su esposo vende repuestos de motos en un establecimiento de un mercado de la capital, su negocio es una pulpería y vende también medicamentos, ropa zapatos con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado establecer este negocio con ahorro y ayuda de su esposo desde hace quince años, y créditos que Afodenic le ha brindado para crecer en  su negocio, con esta solicitud es la once la cual va invertir en insumos diarios para ofertar a sus clientes. Sus planes  es aumentar su inventario, así como remodelar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Maria Hortencia is 46 years old, and resides in the village of Reconciliación with 4 beautiful children whom are all of age. Her husband sells motorcycle replacement parts in an establishment in a market in the capital. Her business is a convenience store and she also sells medicines, clothing, and shoes. With much effort she has been able to establish this business with savings, and help from her husband for the last 15 years. Loans from Afodenic have also helped her expand her business. This loan request will be her 11th, which will be invested in daily supplies to offer her clients. Her plan is to increase her inventory, as well as to remodel her home.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase daily supplies to stock her convenience store.

loans.name: Buenaventura Ojetaciano

texts.es:
El señor Buenaventura Ojetaciano C. tiene la edad de 43 años, su estado civil es soltero, Don Buenaventura no tiene hijos, sus propósitos son de mantener siempre activo su negocio por lo que actualmente depende totalmente de este ya que solo así obtiene ganancias para darle la ayuda a su hermano y a sus sobrinos que son su familia, sus deseos son de establecerse en un mejor lugar ya que le gustaría obtener su propio lugar como una pulpería en donde ofrezca sus productos y le gustaría que el establecimiento fuera en su casa de habitación, sus sueños son de remodelar su humilde vivienda por lo que tiene que enseñarles a sus sobrinos los sacrificios que malogrado para conseguir estos propósitos por lo que ya tiene un record crediticio con la Fundación León 2000 por lo que el comportamiento que ha tenido ha sido muy bueno y todo esto lo ha logrado por su empeño en el trabajo ya que es un hombre luchador que le gusta el trabajo y reconoce que solo así se puede lograr lo que se propone.

La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de golosinas y gaseosas, la ubicación de su negocio es en el costado norte de la UNAN por lo que su venta permanece en las afueras de la universidad, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 20 años, Don Buenaventura inicia este negocio por cuenta propia ya que desde muy pequeño le enseñaron a trabajar y dio inicio a este negocio con pocos productos ya que en una pequeña canasta donde introducía cigarrillos y caramelos el método que utilizaba para lograr vender era que recorría las calles mas transitadas de León y en donde se reunían mucho estudiantes ya que estos compraban los cigarrillos y esto era muy agotador ya que su casa de habitación queda a una distancia muy larga por lo que mas tarde decide buscar un en donde establecerse y esto le es posible porque tenia que encontrar un lugar donde transitaran muchas personas por lo que decide quedarse en las afueras de la UNAN en donde ofrece sus productos Don Buenaventura posee 2 créditos con la Fundación y su record ha sido bueno por lo que ahora solicita un financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo por lo que tiene que incrementar sus productos ya que ha tenido demanda de clientes además sus compras las realiza en las diferentes distribuidoras de León para conseguir le producto de manera mas favorable retribuye a Fundación León 2000 y las organizaciones que se interesan en los pequeños empresarios.
texts.en:
Buenaventura Ojetaciano C. is 43 years old and single. His goal is to keep his business going because he totally depends on it as his only source of income and a means to help his brother, nieces and nephews, his only family. He most wants to set the business up in a better place because he would like to have his own shop, preferably in his house, a grocery where he can sell his merchandise. He dreams of remodeling his humble house and teaching his nieces and nephews the importance of hard work in reaching your goals. Buenaventura has borrowed from Fundacion Leon 2000 before and his performance has been very good. He's made a success of the business because he's persistent and because he knows that he can get what he wants if he works hard.

Buenaventura makes a living selling snacks and cold drinks. His business is located on the northern edge of UNAN, just outside the university. He's operated the business for 20 years. He started it on his own, having learned to work hard from the time he was a boy, with only a few products kept in a basket, selling cigarettes and candy to passers-by. He worked as a street vendor around Leon where he met a lot of students who were customers for the cigarettes he sold. The work was exhausting because his house was far away, so he decided to find a spot to set up permanently. He had to find a place with a lot of passers-by so he decided on the street near UNAN. Buenaventura has borrowed from Fundacion twice and has a good payment record. He's now applying for a loan which he will use for working capital. He'll increase the range of products he sells to meet customer demand and buy from different distributors in Leon so that he can get a favorable return for Fundacion Leon 2000 and the organizations that are interested in helping small businessmen.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Bertha Julia

texts.es: Doña Bertha habita en la Concepción de Maria ubicado de donde fue Polanco una cuadra al norte en la ciudad de Managua, tiene  30 años de edad, con tres hijos de 6,8 y 14 años de edad, los cuales cursan la primaria en la escuela del barrio. Su negocio es la venta de productos ferreteros y venta de madera que inicio desde hace siete años, con fondos propios y prestamos que Afodenic otorgo lo cual se ha beneficiado ya que ha podido hacer su inventario mas grande. Con esta solicitud es la quinta la cual va invertir en madera para realizar su trabajo en las ventas, a futuro es poder mejorar el nivel de vida para poder apoyar a sus hijos con los estudios, a si como captar mas clientes para obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Berta lives in Concepción de Maria north of the city of Managua. She is 30 years old, and has three children ages 6, 8, and 14, whom attend the neighborhood elementary school. Her business is the sale of hardware and wood that she began 7 years ago with her own funds and with loans that Afodenic granted which have benefited her greatly given that she has been able to increase her inventory. This loan request is her 5th, which she will invest in wood to accomplish her sales goals. Her future hopes are to improve her standard of living to be able to support her children in their studies, as well as to be able to attract more clients to obtain a better income.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wood to sell in her business.

loans.name: Gema Daly

texts.es:
Gema Daly V. F. tiene la edad de 25 años, su estado civil es casada esta Joven emprendedora no tiene hijos, su compañero de vida labora por cuenta propia, sus propósitos son de mantener su negocio ya que anteriormente había tenido la experiencia de poseer este negocio pero debido a la situación económica su negocio decayó por lo que ahora sus propósitos son de mantenerlo activo realizando promociones en la venta de su ropa, sus deseos son de superarse en la vida ya que recientemente cursa el ultimo año de su carrera por lo cual quiere luchar para conseguir esa meta por que la situación en el país esta difícil y ella desea que cuando logre tener sus hijos estos puedan tener un buen lugar donde estudiar y vivir y una base  económica sólida, sus sueños son ser una gran empresaria que genere trabajo dentro de su país e influya económicamente a nivel nacional ya que es uno de los sueños que le gustaría realizar para  que el país pueda progresar y así los estudiantes tengan la confianza de poder desarrollarse en el ámbito profesional.

La actividad económica de la Joven  Gema es la venta de ropa usada y cosméticos, la ubicación de su negocio es en su casa de habitación, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 4 años, Doña Gema dio inicio a esta actividad económica con le objetivo de financiarse sus estudios universitarios, con la ayuda de su Mama quien realizo un préstamo a Fundación León 2000 ella logro el financiamiento para el comienzo de este negocio, y desde entonces ha tratado de mantenerlo con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio ya que algunas veces su estudio no permitía atenderlo de forma total, al principio fue muy duro ya que no tenia muchos clientes ya que no tenia muchas opciones que ofrecer y además de esto tenia que superar la crisis por la que atravesaba su familia sin embargo algunas veces tenia que salir a vender de manera ambulante pero cuando logro obtener clientes suficientes su negocio empezó a fructificar y es esta la razón por la que decide solicitar un financiamiento propuesto para capital de trabajo ya que tiene que realizar la compra de sus productos por cajas además tiene que viajar hasta Managua y Chinandega por tanto es aquí donde le resulta mas favorable realizar las compras.
texts.en:
Gema Daly V. F. is 25 years old and married. This young entrepreneur has no children. Her life has been spent working for herself, and her intentions are to support her business. Previously, she had the experience to own this business but due to the economic situation her business declined; now her intentions are to keep promoting the sale of her clothes. Her goals are to improve herself in life and she recently studied in the last year of her career, for she wants to fight to achieve that goal, as the situation in the country is difficult and she wants to have children who can have a good place to study and live and a solid economic base. Her dreams are to be a great entrepreneur who generates income inside her country and have an economic influence at the national level. It is one of her dreams that she would like to make the country progress and that students can have the confidence to develop their personal ambition. Young Gema's economic activity is selling used clothes and cosmetics. She has owned her business for four years, and it is located in her house. Gema started this activity with the objective of financing her university studies. With the help of her mother she received a loan from Fundacion Leon in 2000; she achieved the financing to start this business, and has since tried to maintain it, with much effort and sacrifice. Some times her studies would not allow her to give it complete attention; it was very difficult in the beginning and she did not have many clients or many options to offer them, and moreover she had to overcome the crisis facing her family, and some times she had to leave to sell on the street. However, when she obtained enough clients, her business became fruitful and this is the reason she decided to ask for financing for working capital, as she has to buy her products by the box, and moreover she has to travel to Managua and Chinandega, for that is where it is most favorable to make her purchases.

Translated from Spanish by Cara Gutterman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital to buy clothes and cosmetics

loans.name: Maria De La Concepcion

texts.es:
María de la Concepción P. Díaz tiene la edad de 59 años, su estado civil es casada, Doña María tiene 2 hijos su edades son las siguientes su hijo mayor de 15 años cursa el 3 año de secundaria y su hijo menor de 7 años cursa el 3 grado de primaria, su compañero de vida labora por cuenta propia, sus propósitos son de mantener a su clientela ya que ellos representan su principal fuente de ingresos ya que sin ellos su establecimiento no podría funcionar, sus sueños son de que su negocio siempre se encuentre activo por lo que se le presento una enfermedad y esto conllevo a que su negocio decayera por lo que ahora esta luchando por recuperarlo ya que su interés es de trabajar humildemente, sus deseos son de darle mejoras a su vivienda ya que a sus edad es muy difícil volver a trabajar por lo cual  tiene que ahorrar lo suficiente para su vejes ya que tiene que pensar en su fututo.

La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de ropa usada y cosméticos, la ubicación de su negocio en su casa de habitación y de forma ambulante ya que tiene que visitar a sus clientes, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 8 años, Doña María da inicio a su negocio con el objetivo de ayudar a la familia a generar mas ingresos y por cuenta propia decide empezar a vender este tipo de ropa ya que al comienzo no sabia en que podía trabajar ya que anteriormente se dedicaba al destace de cerdo y además poseía una pequeña pulpería pero debido a que no podía mantener ambos negocio ya que se enfermo y no pudo seguir manteniendo ambos negocio por lo que su enfermedad la mantenía en cama pero sabia que tenia que proporcionarle a sus hijos lo necesario por lo que hizo el sacrificio de buscar otro negocio y fue con la venta de ropa usada como: camisas y pantalones ella ofrecía sus productos a los caballeros ya que llegaban en busca de pantalones  por lo que además de ofrecerlos en su casa de habitación decide recorrer ciertas calles de forma ambulante para lograr mas ganancias ya que tenia que buscar la manera de realizar sacrificios, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que necesita invertir en mas mercadería para su negocio para abastecer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maria de la Concepcion P. D. is 59 years old, married, and has 2 children. Her eldest son is 15 years old and is in his third year of high school. Her youngest son is 7 years old and is in the third grade of elementary school. Her husband works for himself now because he has come down with an illness but they still need to retain the customers that provide the family with their main source of income. Now, he is fighting to recover and it is difficult to return to work. Still, he is thinking about the future and hopes to save enough money for retirement and to better provide for his household. Dona Maria has been running a business selling second-hand clothing and cosmetics out of their home for 8 years, and also traveling to visit customers. She first started the business to help generate more income for the family. She specifically decided to sell second-hand clothing since she did not know what type of work she could do after she was previously a pork butcher. They previously owned a small store, but they could not continue running the store while his illness required him to stay in bed. Since she knew they still had to provide for the children, she began searching for other work. She decided to sell second-hand clothing such as shirts and pants. Since men started coming to the house to purchase pants, she decided to expand the business by traveling and selling on certain streets to earn more money. The money she is requesting in the loan will be used to make necessary investments to buy additional merchandise for her business to meet the demand of the customers.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Juan Pedro

texts.es: Don Juan Pedro G. P.  con 24 años de edad, es casado, de oficios Talabartero “elaboración de Zapatos para hombres”, habita junto a sus hijos, cuentan con la ayuda de su esposa para elaborar zapatos para  la misma actividad, lleva 5 años de trabajar  en su residencia que se encuentra ubicada en el Paraje Xepatan, de la Aldea de ChiP., del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala, actualmente la demanda de su clientela ha aumentado y debido  a sus condiciones  económicas en que se encuentra no, son suficientes para que el pueda  aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar material para tejeduria y de esa manera poder sostener a su familia.
texts.en:
Don Juan Pedro G. P. is 24 years old, married, and works producing men's shoes. He lives with his wife and children, and his wife helps him make the shoes at home. He has been working out of his home for 5 years, located in the Xepatan area in the village of ChiP. in the Totonicapan department in Guatemala. The demand from his customers has risen, but due to economic conditions, he is not able to raise enough money to purchase materials to meet this demand. For this reason, he came to the ASDIR association to request a loan in order to purchase weaving materials so he can continue making shoes to support his family.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase weaving materials

loans.name: Julio Nicolas

texts.es: Don Julio Nicolás García B.  es casado, de oficios Albañil , y  lleva 18 años de elaborar en la Construcción de viviendas, su residencia que se encuentra en Paraje Pabulux del Cantón Chotacaj del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala, actualmente la demanda de su clientela a prestar sus servicios ha aumentado pero las condiciones económicas  no son suficientes para arreglar su máquina para mezclar concreto, para que ello acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con el que podrá arreglar su máquina y así aprovechar las ganancias que su trabajo le generara y así poder seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Julio Nicolás García B. has been a construction worker for 18 years. He is married and lives in Totonicapán, Guatemala. Currently his work has seen an increase in demand, but his cement mixer is broken and he has not had money to fix it. Julio is requesting a loan through Kiva partner Asociacion ASDIR to repair the cement mixer, and be able to take on all the construction jobs available to him.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Reparing cement mixer

loans.name: Diego Fidel

texts.es: Don Diego Fidel T. Menchù con 24 años de edad, es casado, de oficios Albañil habita junto a su hijos, y su esposa en el Caserío Paximabaj de la Aldea Nimasac, departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala, actualmente Presta sus servicios de albañil en las comunidades de Totonicapán, pero debido a que  el salario es mínimo y no cubre sus necesidades básicas acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de empezar su negocio propio y con ello mejorar sus condiciones de vida y  la de su familia y así poder salir adelante y tener un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Don Diego Fidel T. Menchù is 24, married and works as a mason. He lives with his wife and children in Caserio Paximabaj at Aldea Nimasac, Totonicapán, Guatemala. He currently works in the villages of Totonicapán but the wage is minimal and does not cover his basic needs. As a result, he contacted Asociación ASDIR so as to get a loan to start his own business, improve his family living and have a better future.


Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Martinez Cairo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Crafts (Working Capital)

loans.name: Pheang

texts.en: Mr. Pheang H. is a villager in Poerk village, Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. He and his wife, Mrs. Khlouk Phal, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate both rice and cassava. They face a problem because they do not have enough money to grow the cassavas. Thus, Mr. Pheang H. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. He hopes to increase his income and improve his family living standard. He is 36 years old and the father of two children who are attending the local school.

loans.use: To grow cassavas.

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en: Mrs. Sophal P. is a farmer in Svay Rak village, Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She owns a plot of land to cultivate rice, but her field is infertile. She does not have enough money to solve the problem, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to make her land more productive. Her husband, Mr. Sok Mol, is a construction worker. Mrs. Sophal P. is 48 years old and the mother of a child who is a laborer. Her husband is to her right in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Say

texts.en: R., 26, lives in the province of Pursat Province, Cambodia, where she owns and farms a plot of land next to her house, growing both rice and vegetables. She plants her crops twice a year. She was taught these farming techniques by her grandfather. She is currently a young mother of two children; both of them are still minor and under her care. She is married to Phoun, age 29, who works with her in the farming business. In the past, R. always hired a cow from a neighbor to help her in plowing farmland. Now, she hopes to purchase her own cow and has applied for a loan as capital in order to buy a cow.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Sam Ol

texts.en: Mr. Sam Ol L. is a villager in Trapaing Trapaing village, Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. His wife, Mrs. Veak Sophorn, is a successful duck and pig breeder. Because the breeding business is going well, Mr. Sam Ol L. decided to ask for a loan to buy more ducklings, piglets, and pig feed. He hopes to increase his income and improve his living conditions with this loan. He is 33 years old and the father of two children who are attending the local school. His wife is shown in the picture to his right.

loans.use: To buy more ducklings, piglets, and pig feed.

loans.name: Hoeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Hoeurn M. is a villager in Tnaut Bak village, Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. She is a 59-year-old widow with two children, one of whom stays at home to do housework while the other is a construction worker. Mrs. Hoeurn M.’s first child wants to start a business by selling sugar juice ; thus, she is requesting a loan to buy glasses and other equipment for her child’s business. She hopes to increase their income and improve their living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To start a sugar juice business.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 40 years old and married to Romeo A.. They are now living in the rural area of Barangay Lapogan Tumauini, Isabela, with their two children: Ricky Jun, 20, an automotive course graduate and Ruby Jane, 18, a high school graduate. Due to a lack of financial resources she never had the chance to send her children to college.  

Violeta is operating a sari-sari store (a community based store), and she believes that through her passion for the business, she will be able to improve their life.  With a loan of PHP 7,000.00, she intends to buy additional stocks such as soft drinks, canned goods and other basic commodities.  She hopes to sustain her village store.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks for her store

loans.name: Srin

texts.en: Mrs. Srin U. lives in Tnaut Bak village, Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is a pig breeder. Since her  business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more piglets and pig feed. Her husband, Mr. Sin Soeun, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Srin U. has three children, one of whom is a polisher while another is employed in a garment factory and the third is a construction worker. Her husband is presented on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To expand a pig breeding business.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is a hog raiser. Her business partner is her husband, Noel. He is also a farmer who manages their rice and corn fields and, at the same time, a fish pond. The couple was blessed with their only child, Norely, who is 13 years old and currently in a public high school situated in the town of Ilagan, Isabela. Fely is 36 years old and came to live in their current residential place since she married Noel. According to her, their current village can best be described as a far rural area that is assisted by PLAN International, which has been a Non-Government Organization for more than a decade now.

Fely maintains a hog raising business in the village, and she hopes to sustain it for the future college education of their only child. She wants a loan amounting to PHP 4,000.00 in order to supply her pigs with feed to eat. She has been maintaining the business for a year now and hopes to someday grow the business. Fely believes that she will be able to achieve this goal slowly. Thus, she works hard and patiently, enduring the bad smell of their waste when cleaning the pigs. Fely is used to that bad smell. She said that she will do what is best for the sake of her family’s progress.

loans.use: To buy feed for her pigs

loans.name: Chenda

texts.en: Mrs. Chenda Y. was born in 1970 and she now lives in Chi Paing village, Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is a widow with three children and her business is selling rubber. One of her children helps in their mother's business while the others are enrolled in the local school. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Chenda Y. decided to ask for a loan to purchase more rubber to sell. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To expand a rubber re-sale business.

loans.name: Jesica

texts.en:
Jesica P. is married to Robin, who cultivates a half-hectare field and does vegetable gardening. They are blessed with three children: Rhea, 18, a high school graduate; Richard, 20, who finished elementary school; and Redento, 22, a high school graduate. Financial problems hindered them in maintaining their children’s educations, causing them to stop studying early. However, Jesica said she and her husband remain contented and thankful that her children understand their poor living situation. Her family is currently residing in Barangay Cabisera 14-16 of Ilagan, Isabela, where there are existing community projects such as building new community centers and a clean and green program. 

Jesica is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 4,000.00 for her rice vending business to assist her husband with their financial and basic needs for their family. She will buy four sacks of rice averaging 50 kilos per sack for the business. She also shared that with a sack of rice, she can earn a net income of PHP150, enough to support their daily immediate needs at home. She hopes to expand the business further in the future. Jesica said despite the hardships of life, they must still go on and must do something in order to overcome life's difficulties.

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Laureta

texts.en:
Laureata T. is 52 years old and has been a vegetable vendor for 19 years. Her husband is a farmer named Jimmy. They have three children: Loujane, 19, currently studying in college; Louie, 17, and Allan, 15, both in high school. Their family is strongly bonded and living a healthy lifestyle. 

She hopes to send all her children to school and to finish college. Laureata and her husband are always willing to sacrifice to achieve their children’s desired education. Thus, Laureata wanted a loan amounting to PHP 6,000.00 that will be used as additional capital for her business. Through the loan, Laureata will purchase more vegetables of different varieties and will sell them to their village. She prays that she will be able to get a loan with her simple business proposal so that she will be able to achieve her goals in life through patience and hard work.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables to sell in the village

loans.name: Mai

texts.en: Mr. Mai M. is a 56-year-old farmer in Tnaut Bak village, Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. He owns a 1.5-hectare field of land to cultivate rice. His wife, Mrs. So Nhor, is a cow breeder. Even though they work hard, they still earn less income than they need to provide a better life for their family. In order to improve their living, Mr. Mai M. decided to ask for a loan to buy four piglets to start a pig-breeding business and to buy a cow for his wife’s business. They have one child, who is a construction worker. His wife is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy four piglets and a cow.

loans.name: Thy

texts.en: Mrs. Thy K. is a 41-year-old widow who now lives in Tnaut Bak village, Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She sells Khmer cakes and owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. She is requesting a loan to buy a cow to start a cow-breeding business to increase her income. Mrs. Thy K. has four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while two are construction workers and the youngest attends the local school.

loans.use: To start a cow-breeding business.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia Capena manages a small village store located at Barangay Casilagan 14-16 in the municipality of Ilagan, Isabela. She is married to Zacharias, 33, who manages their small farm in the village. At 25, Lucia already has two children: Mary Grace, 10; and Jay-R, 8. Both children are in the elementary grades in their village public school. With their simple life, they are thankful that they can afford to eat three times a day. 

She wants financial assistance amounting to PHP 5,000.00 to buy additional stocks for her store.  These items would include coffee, sugar, salt, junk food, etc. Lucia earns around PHP500 gross income a day, and she hopes to increase this by means of additional capital, work organization, patience and fear in God to avoid sins. She prays she will be given the chance to grow her business and earn more income.  She believes that through this all their dreams will come true.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks for sale in her store

loans.name: Sinath

texts.en: Mrs. Sinath T. is a widow and a farmer in Lngeang village, Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She owns a plot of land to cultivate both rice and cassava, but she does not have enough money to hire laborers to work in her field. Thus, Mrs. Sinath T. decided to ask for a loan to hire laborers for this purpose.

loans.use: To hire farm laborers.

loans.name: Sruon

texts.en: Mrs. Sruon T. is a villager in Tnaut village, Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her family. Her husband, Mr. Vuth Vy, is a farmer who owns a one-hectare field to cultivate rice. Mrs. Sruon T. is requesting a loan to buy a cow, piglet, and pig feed for breeding. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions with this loan. She is 34 years old and the mother of five children, three of whom are construction workers while the others are attending the local school. Her husband is presented on her left in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a cow, piglet, and pig feed for breeding.

loans.name: Phan

texts.en: Mrs. Phan S. was born in 1963 and she now lives in Lngeang village, Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is a Khmer noodle seller. Her husband, Mr. Kao Chan, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. He has a problem because he does not have enough money to hire laborers to work his field. In order to deal this problem, Mrs. Phan S. decided to ask for a loan for her husband’s purpose. She has six children, one of whom is a beautician, another is a waiter, and the others are students in the local school. She appears in the photo with her husband and one of her children.

loans.use: To hire farm laborers.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora R. is 37 years old and she has lived in the village of Cabisera 14-16 (Ilagan) since she was born. Her husband and two children happily live there.  Her husband, Orlando, is a corn and rice farmer in their village. Her children are Jessa, 10, who is currently in grade five; and Jhondel, 13, now in the first year of high school. Leonora hopes to support the education of her two children through the assistance of her husband and support coming from her snack-vending business. 

She cooks banana cue and soups for her neighbors. The snacks are sold easily in an hour even when she does not go house to house. She would like to expand this into selling soft drinks and cooking the famous “pansit” (soft noodles in the local language). Thus, Leonora wanted a business loan amounting to PHP 5,000.00 as additional capital for her vending business. “I must strive harder in battling with life’s difficulties,” Leonora added.

loans.use: For additional capital for business expansion

loans.name: Som Ol

texts.en: Mr. Som Ol M. is a villager in Tnaut Bak village, Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. He is a rice miller who is a rice middleman. His wife, Mrs. Heim Neang, owns a small grocery store and also breeds pigs. Since her breeding business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, Mr. Som Ol M. is requesting a loan to buy 12 more piglets and pig feed for breeding. He hopes to increase his income and provide a better life for his family. He is 46 years old and the father of three children who attend the local school. His wife is shown in the photo to his left.

loans.use: To expand a pig-breeding business.

loans.name: Loeb

texts.en:
K., 37, has been farming for more than nine years. She has much experience and grows green beans on her own farmland. This is a skill, she learned from her grandfather. She lives in the rural area of Pursat Province, Cambodia. 

K. is married and the mother of three children. All are teenagers and attend school. Her husband's name is Kanhga, age 37, and he helps his wife with growing green bean. As green bean growing is the main source of income for the family, K. is asking for a loan to buy more bean seeds and a cow to serve on the farm.

loans.use: To buy more bean seeds and a cow to serve for plowing

loans.name: Ke's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Ke C. is a group leader of five members who all live in Srah Pring village, Kampong Cham province. She is a housewife who takes care of her children and cooks food for the family. Her husband, Mr. Prak Sophal, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. On this plot of land, he has a problem. He does not have enough money to buy fertilizer to strengthen the field and make his crops more productive. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Ke C. decided to ask for a loan for her husband. She is 42 years old and the mother of five children, two are farmers who help with their father's farming while another owns a cow which is hired by the people to plow their fields. The remaining two children attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to strengthen the field and make the crops more productive.

loans.name: Chanthul

texts.en: Mrs. Chanthul B. lives in Tang Boeung village in Kampong Cham province. She is a coffee seller. Her husband, Mr. Vin Ny Kou, is a vet. In their businesses, they face different problems so they want to solve those problems. Thus, Mrs. Chanthul B. decided to ask for a loan to buy more coffee and medicines. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living standard. She is 36 years old and the mother of four children who are attending the local school. Her husband is also in the picture.

loans.use: to buy more coffee and medicines

loans.name: Oun

texts.en:
Mrs. Oun S. lives in Trapaing Chork village in Kampong Cham province. She is 47 years old and the mother of two children; one sells firewood and the other is enrolled in the local school. Her husband, Mr. Pun Thol, uses a motorbike to transport the firewood to sell.

Mrs. Oun S. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate both rice and cassavas. In her cassava farming, she faces a problem because she does not have money to hire laborers to help her in the field. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to hire laborers to work in the field.

Mrs. Oun S. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To hire laborers to work in the field.

loans.name: Chun

texts.en:
Mrs. Chun P. lives in Tang Srey village in Kampong Cham province. She and her husband, Mr. Hin Hien, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice. They have some problems: their field is infertile; it has a lot of insects that damage their crops; and their field is far from the irrigation system. In order to deal these problems, Mrs. Chun P. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and fuel in order to water the field to make her crop more productive.

Mrs. Chun P. is 56 years old and the mother of four children: one is employed in a garment factory; one repairs machines; one is a farmer; and the last attends the local school. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticides, and fuel to improve her crop

loans.name: Sambath

texts.en:
Mrs. Sambath N. is 46 years old and lives in Tang Srey village in Kampong Cham province. She has three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the other is enrolled in the local school.

She and her husband, Mr. Nuo Norn, are farmers who own a piece of land to cultivate rice. However, they do not have a pump to water the field. Thus, Mrs. Sambath N. decided to ask for a loan to buy a pump. She will also use part of the loan to purchase fertilizer to make her crop more productive. She is pictured here with her husband.

loans.use: To buy a pump machine and fertilizer to make her field more productive.

loans.name: Nang

texts.en:
Mrs. Nang P. lives in Pong Ror village in Kampong Cham province. She and her husband, Mr. Suon Hong, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate both rice and cassavas. In their cassava farming, they face a problem because they do not have enough money to hire laborers to help them work the field. Thus, Mrs. Nang P. decided to ask for a loan for that purpose.

Mrs. Nang P. is 51 years old and the mother of two children, both farmers who help their parents in their work. Her husband is presented with her in the picture.

loans.use: To hire laborers to help work her field.

loans.name: Oeun

texts.en:
Mrs. OeU. U. is a 55-year-old mother of three who lives in Tol Kandal Choerng village located in Kampong Cham province. She sells Khmer cakes along with one of her children to make a living. Two of her children are attending a local school. Her husband, Mr. Yen Srorn, is a contract worker who has been hired by the villagers to dig wells. Mr. Srorn is encountering problems because he does not have enough supplies to dig the well. Thus, Mrs. OeU. U. is asking for a loan to buy well supplies for her husband’s work. She and her husband hope to increase their income in order to provide a better life for their family.
 
Her husband is shown on the left of picture.

loans.use: To buy supplies in order to dig a well

loans.name: Sokharn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokharn H. is 51 years old and lives in Brasout Kor village located in Kampong Cham province. She is a beautician who does make up applications for people in wedding ceremonies and other functions. Her husband, Mr. Sim Boeun, is a carpenter who earns a small income. They have one child who is currently attending school.

Her husband wants to start a new business by purchasing an electrical generator to rent out for different functions, such as weddings and ceremonies. Thus, Mrs. Sokharn H. is asking for a loan to help her husband start his business.

loans.use: To purchase an electrical generator

loans.name: Thoa

texts.en:
Mr. Thoa B. lives in Chan village in Kampong Cham province. At the age of 55, he is the father of two children. One child is a teacher in the local school while another is attending the local school. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. His wife, Mrs. Heang Noeun, breeds pigs and chickens. Even though they work hard, they still earn very little income and are unable to improve their living standards. Thus, Mr. Thoa B. is asking for a loan to buy a hectare of land to cultivate rice. 

His wife is shown in the picture with him.

loans.use: To buy a hectare of land to cultivate rice

loans.name: Chhunleng

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhunleng Y. is a villager in So Sein village in Kampong Cham province. She is a 45 year old housewife and mother of three. One of her children is a construction worker, while the others are attending a local school. Her husband, Mr. Haur Kheng, is a farmer who owns 1.5 hectare of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Chhunleng Y. is requesting a loan to buy timber in order to build a house for her family. 

Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy timber to build a house

loans.name: Sang

texts.en:
Mr. Sang S. is a 50 year old farmer from Boeung village in Kampong Cham province. He owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. He is facing challenges in his current plantation because his field is infertile. Therefore, he is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer as well as purchase recycled materials to resell in the factory. 

His wife, Mrs. Cheim Pach, works at a rice mill. They have four children of which one is a recycling collector while the rest are enrolled in the local school. 

His wife is presented in the picture with him.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and recycled goods

loans.name: Hiem

texts.en: Mrs. Hiem N. is a farmer from Batheay village in Kampong Cham province. She is a 55 year old widow with two children, one of whom is a sculptor while the other is attending a local school. Mrs. N. owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation, she faces problems because she does not have enough money to: a) buy rice seeds; b) hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the field; and c) buy a pump machine in order to water the field. Therefore, she is asking for a loan to assist her with these tasks. She hopes that she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy services and materials to cultivate rice

loans.name: Ean

texts.en:
Mr. Ean C. is a villager from Thlork village in Kampong Cham province. Mr. C. is 56 years old and the father of four children. Two of his children are farmers working with him, while the others are enrolled in a local school.

He and his wife, Mrs. Khan Num, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. In this plantation, they face problems because their field is infertile and they do not have enough money to hire laborers to work on the field. In order to deal these problems, Mr. Ean C. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and hire laborers to plow the field. He hopes to increase income and improve the living conditions with this loan. 

His wife is presented in the picture with him.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and hire laborers to plow the field

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap M. is a villager from Prey Tom Nub village in Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer who owns land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. She currently faces a problem because she does not have enough money to grow cassava on her field. Therefore, she is asking for a loan to buy cassava seeds to plant on her field. She hopes to increase her income and improve the living conditions of her family.

Mrs. Sopheap M. is 40 years old and the mother of four children. Three of her children are enrolled in a local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband, Mr. Yan Oeun, is a construction worker. 

Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy cassava seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy an electric cow

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Mrs. Seng Y. is a villager from Bos Knol village in Kampong Cham province. She is a 36 year old mother attending to three children. One of her children is a fisherman while the others are attending a local school. Her husband, Mr. Y. Yeth, is a fisherman. Mrs. Seng Y. is requesting a loan to save up and buy a machine to thresh rice for her husband to start a new business. She hopes to increase her family's income and improve their living conditions. 

Her husband is shown on the right of photo.

loans.use: To buy a machine to thresh rice

loans.name: Phat

texts.en:
Mrs. Phat U. is a villager from Chrork Rom Deng village in Kampong Cham province. Mrs. U. is 32 year old mother of three children. All of her children are enrolled in a local school. She works as a farmer on her own plot of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. 

Her husband, Mr. Sous Pheap, is a bed maker. Since his business is going well, he wants to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Phat U. is asking for a loan to buy a timber saw and timber wood to make more beds to sell. She hopes to increase the family's income and improve their living conditions with this loan. 

Her husband is shown on the right of photo.

loans.use: To buy a timber saw and timber wood

loans.name: Lai

texts.en:
Mr. Lai K. is a bed maker from Chroek Rom Deng village in Kampong Cham province. Since his business is going well, he wants to expand it by purchasing a timber saw and timber wood to make more beds. He hopes to increase his income and improve his family's living condition. 

His wife, Mrs. Ouk Ran, is a bed seller. Mr. Lai K. is a 29 year old father of a young child.

His wife is shown on the right of photo.

loans.use: To purchase a timber saw and timber wood to make beds

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru: Рустам Рахимбабаев  женат имеет 2 детей. Он работал водителем в одной из предприятий города, но настал пенсионный возраст и он ушел с работы. Ему предложили работать сторожем, но Рустам отказался так как оклад меньше и работы больше. У него дома есть 2 бычка и 2 овцы, он раньше развивал скот и продавал их. Теперь когда он без работный ему необходимо обеспечивать семью, он решил продолжить  продажей коров. Его жена поддерживает семейное хозяйство, она печет лепешки и в день имеет небольшой заработок, что позволяет им проживать и прикупать для дома продукты. Рустам и его сын ухаживать за скотом, они каждые 5 месяцев продают скот. В настоящий момент Рустаму необходим кредит, что бы расширить свой коровник ему брат посоветовал обратиться в Микроинвест.
texts.en:
Rustam R. is married and has two children. He worked as a driver in one of the companies in the city, but he has retired. He got an offer to work as a night watch, but Rustam has declined because the salary was too small and there was more work. At home he has two calves and two sheep, he used to breed and sell cattle. Now that he is unemployed and has to support his family he decided to keep selling animals. His wife is supporting the family household, makes breads and has a small daily income which helps them survive and buy food. Rustam and his son keep after the cattle and resell them every five months. Currently Rustam needs a loan to expand his cow house, his brother has advised him to come to MicroInvest.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Mehri

texts.ru: Мехри замужем имеет 4 детей, она работает медсестрой, но ее заработная плата не позволяет обеспечивать семью и детей в норме.Для этого она дополнительно разводит скот, в бизнесе помогает ее муж, он отвозит скот  на рынок и продает , а если есть скот подешевле он приобретает несколько маленьких бычков. Сама Мехри  кормит и хорошо ухаживает за скотом. Она кредитуется  не первый раз и вовремя погашает. Она довольна займом и благодарна КИВА.
texts.en:
Mehri B. is married and has 4 children. She works as a nurse but her income is not enough to support her family. Therefore, in addition to her job, she raises cattle. Her husband helps her by selling cattle at the market and by buying bull calves. Mehri is the one to take care of the cattle. This is not the first time Mehri has applied for a loan. She always pays off her loans on time. She is happy to have an opportunity to obtain loans and is grateful to Kiva.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of livestock

loans.name: Ehson

texts.ru: Эхсон очень энергичный молодой человек, он еще не женат , учиться на экономиста.Во время учебы за скотом ухаживает пастух, пастух также и сторожит небольшое стадо Эхсона.  В его стаде есть коровы , овцы и козы.  Эхсон планирует  посадить в своем небольшом саду овощи. Он получает кредит для откорма скота. В Микроинвесте он кредитуется  2 года,  имеет хорошую кредитную историю.
texts.en:
Ehson H. is an energetic young man. He studies Economics and is still single. Ehson owns cows, sheep and goats and a sheppard takes care of them while Ehson is at school. Ehson is planning to plant vegetables in his garden but he is applying for a loan to purchase fodder for his cattle. He has been a Microinvest client for the past two years and has a good credit history.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of livestock

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.en:
Lucrecia is 32 years old. She is married to Nelson Gamolao, who works as house carpenter in their village and sometimes is hired to work on houses in nearby villages. However, her husband’s work is not regular. So, Lucresia needs to grow a small business to assist him in earning a livelihood. At the moment, the couple has two children: Criscel Joy, 10; and Kristine, 8. They are both in the elementary level of education in their village. According to Lucrecia, her current family situation is happy and she strives for a better future in their village at Barangay Cabisera 14-16 Ilagan, Isabela.
 
Lucrecia wants a loan amounting to PHP 5,000.00 for her snack vending business in the village. She cooks cassava cakes, sugar coated banana and other types of cooked snacks. She will use the money that she earns in the said business for the education of her children and family’s daily basic needs. She hopes to maintain the business and someday be able to develop it into a larger vending business. What she will need to do is to strive, "work harder and have faith to God in order to become successful”, she said.

loans.use: For additional capital to grow her snack vending business

loans.name: Melchor

texts.en:
Melchor M. is a supportive husband to his wife, Fely M.. The public primary school building situated in their village, commonly called Barangay Casilagan, is where they put up their school canteen business. The couple is mainly focusing on the business at present since they don’t have any children yet. Melchor is 25 years old while his wife is just 23 years old. The couple chooses to be thankful that their children have not arrived yet. They just enjoy each other’s company while waiting for their baby or babies.

Apart from hoping that they will be good and responsible parents, Melchor also wants his family to be financially stable by means of sustaining the livelihood resource they are managing now. This is the reason why he wants to request a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 as additional financial capital for their school canteen. Being the head of the family, Melchor should perform his task well by being hard-working, responsible and patient towards the development of their small business enterprise in their village. He also adds that through this program, he hopes to have a good start to uplift their livelihood.

loans.use: additional capital for their school canteen

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa V. is running her own village store in Yeban Sur of Benito Soliven, Isabela.  Luisa  is already 36 years old, married to Elmer, who is a farmer. Their children are Kristian – 13 years old, already in high school and Anthonette – 7 years old, already in the elementary grade. They have a common understanding in the family and they have a common goal to become successful with their lives. 

Luisa is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 8,000.00 for her store expansion. She hopes to purchase stocks in bulk in order to increase her daily income and satisfy her family and customers with their daily needs. Through the business, she is also able to provide her children’s daily allowances and even supported their farming needs.

loans.use: store expansion

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merly A., 41, lives in a rural area of Barangay Cabisera 14-16, Ilagan, Isabela. Married to Rodolfo A., who works as the driver of a passenger jeep and maintains their farming business, they are blessed with a happy family life and hope to provide all six of their children, who range in age from 16 to one, with quality educations. 

Merly is requesting a loan for her mini-grocery store to purchase additional supplies of items such as sugar, coffee, milk, detergent and fragrance soap, rice, soft drinks, bottled and canned goods, etc. to satisfy her customers' needs. Her main purpose in seeking to improve the business is to better help her husband sustain the education of their children

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks for her store.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita S. is 42 years old and married to Santi who is a farmer. They are blessed with two children who are Roshellin – 25 years old, commerce graduate, and Caren Joy – 16 years old and currently a high school freshman. With a good relationship in the family, Merlita is really inspired in pursuing the business she started because she wants to finance her youngest daughter's college education. They live in Ilagan municipality. Merlita shared also that the village where they live is a faraway rural place and mountainous.

Merlita wants to request loan assistance for her rice vending business, amounting to PHP 5,000 that will be very helpful to her business. According to her, the loan will be used to purchase sacks of rice and animal feed for her business since they are in demand. The products will be sold at retail prices in order to generate more income for her family and money for school fees for her children. She hopes to upgrade her business through her strong determination, for she believes that with this, she will be able to succeed in all her goals in life.

loans.use: purchase sacks of rice and animal feed to sell

loans.name: Nasriddin

texts.ru: Муродов Насриддин проживает в районе Шахринау. Возраст 33 года, женат и имеет двоих детей. Закончил средне специальное учебное зведение. По специальности водитель. Работает частным таксистом. опыт работы в данной сфере 7 лет. Сейчас он остался без работы , так как его автомобиль требует ремонта. Поэтому он обратился к нам за кредитом . Деньги ему необходимы для покупки запчастей. А ремонтом будет заниматься саммостоятельно. Кредит погасить сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Nasriddin M. lives in Shahrinau. He is 33 years old and is married with two children. He is a driver by training. For the past seven years he has been working as a taxi driver but now he is temporarily out of work because his car is broken and he needs to purchase spare parts. In order to do so, Nasriddin would need a loan. He will fix the car by himself. He plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to fix a car

loans.name: Nov

texts.en:
E., pictured here, is 29 years old and a resident of Pursat Province, Cambodia. He earns a profit by selling fish and pork in the local busy market; he starts his work in the early morning and finishes in the afternoon, and he can earn an average of $5 per day. He currently works very hard at his investment activities in order to manage his one lovely young child. He is married to Chatha, 30, who earns a living raising pigs from home.

To expand the business and to earn more income, E. is requesting a loan as capital to buy additional fish and pork to sell and some piglets to raise.

loans.use: To buy additional fish and pork to sell and some piglets to raise

loans.name: Toshbiby

texts.ru: Боева Тошбиби жительница Шахринау. Возраст 45 лет, замужем и имеет четверых детей. образование среднее. Муж уехал на заработки в Россию. Деньги присылает очень редко , поэтому она одна занимается бизнесом для того, чтобы обеспечит семью. Привозит одежду из города Душанбе. Торгует не на рынке. Она ходит по кишлакам и предлагает товар жителям района. анимается этим видом бизнеса уже 8 лет. Дело приносит доход  и поэтому она хочет получить кредит для того, чтобы закупить весенний товар. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Toshbiby B. lives in Shahrinau. She is a 45-years-old mother of four children. Her husband is a migrant worker in Russia but he rarely sends money home. Toshbiby is a high school graduate and an entrepreneur. She purchases clothes in Dushanbe and sells them in different villages. She has done this for the past eight years. The business is profitable and Tochbiby would like to expand it. She is applying for a loan that would allow her to purchase clothes for the spring season. She would pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase clothes for the spring season

loans.name: Usawa Group

texts.en:
Tatu S., age 46, is married with six children who age between 14 to 27. She also cares for four dependents of different relatives.  She sells concrete at Kisopwa. She started this business in 2000 and works daily from 8am until 5pm. She is able to make a monthly profit of around $45. 

This will be Tatu’s seventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her business by buying more supplies of stones and has repaid the loans successfully. She now hopes for a seventh loan to increase her capital to buy more concrete and pay school fees. 
\t
Tatu will share this loan with her loan group, Usawa, which totals 18 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable for paying back their loans. In the picture, Tatu is 1st on the left, second row..

loans.use: To buy more concrete

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea C. has been growing rice for a long time and she is very skilled at rice farming. She learned these farming  techniques from her grandparents. She is 44 and married with four children. All of her children are single and live in the family home. Her husband, Tin is 47, and earns a living by making traditional cow-carts to sell.  These carts are made from wood. He runs his business very well and a lot of customers recognize the good quality and beauty of his work. In order to become more successful, C. has applied for a loan for her husband to expand his business. C. lives in Pursat Province and she was not available for photographing. Her husband's photo was taken instead.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Arusha Group

texts.en:
Tausi S., age 60, is married with four children ages 30, 26, 24 and 13. She also takes care of an orphan. She has a business of mama rishe (Kiswahili food vendor). She started this business 8 years ago and works daily from 6am until 4pm. She is able to make a monthly profit of around $189. 

This will be Tausi’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase the stock of food and has repaid the loans successfully. She now hopes for a third loan to improve the place where she sells her food. 
	
Tausi will share this loan with her loan group Arusha, which totals 15 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Tausi is right of center, sitting.

loans.use: To improve the place where she sells her food

loans.name: Suon

texts.en:
Suon H., who was born in 1953, is a villager in the rural area of Pursat Province, Cambodia. She is married, and she is the mother of two children; both of her children are single and help with her business activities.

She presently earns an income by growing rice and by raising pigs from home. Meanwhile, her husband is a local fisherman, but he also works with her to grow rice. Because their rice farming operation is an important source of income for their family and because it is such difficult, physical labor to plow a field, Suon is seeking a loan in order to buy water buffalo.

loans.use: To more efficiently plow her rice field by purchasing water buffalo

loans.name: Jiguignouma (Bon Espoir) Group

texts.fr:
Les sept femmes du groupe Jiguignouma sont toutes mariées, elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et 3 enfants vivant dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au quartier Hamdallaye de la ville de Koutiala (région de Sikasso, république du Mali). Elles se sont  connues   à travers des liens   de voisinage.
Elles exercent la même activité de teinture et vente  d’habits (bazin), par ailleurs,  elles font de la coiffure et sont très sollicitées dans cette activité. La coiffure est pratiquée chaque jour à la maison à la demande de la clientèle
Afin  de satisfaire  le besoin de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter, le groupe Jiguignouma a décidé d’intégrer  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son troisième  prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elles  comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter des pièces de bazin en gros à Bamako (la capitale de la république du Mali) des colorants etc. Les bazins ainsi colorés  sont vendus en détail au marché  de koutiala.
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen  de 110 000 FCFA au cours de ce cycle qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt, subvenir aux besoins de la famille élargie et investir le reste dans les activités. Elles ont pour ambition de diversifier leur commerce en embrassant d’autres activités génératrices de revenus  telle que l’ouverture d’un salon de coiffure.
texts.en:
The seven women of the Jiguignouma group are all married; they have an average age of 35 and on average, 3 children. They live in big traditional extended families in the Hamdallaye district of the town of Koutiala (Sikasso region, Republic of Mali). They know each other because they are neighbors. They work in the same trade, dyeing and selling clothing (made out of "bazin" a kind of damask); they also do hairdressing and are very much in demand. Hairdressing is done every morning at home on the request of their clientele.

In order to satisfy the needs of their ever-growing clientele, the Jiguignouma group decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with whom they are on their third solidarity loan (group loan). Both the preceding loans were correctly reimbursed.

They intend to use this loan to buy lengths of "bazin" wholesale in Bamako (the capital of the Republic of Mali) as well as dyes, etc. The dyed "bazin" is sold retail in the market in Koutiala.

They each hope to make an average profit of 110,000 F CFA over the course of this loan cycle, which will be used to repay the loan and cover the expenses of their extended families, investing any remainder in their businesses. Their ambition is to diversify their businesses by taking up other income-generating activities such as opening a beauty salon.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: dyeing, purchase of "bazin" cloth, and coiffure

loans.name: Karibea Group

texts.en:
Happy S., age 35, is single. She has a tailoring business which she started in 2007, and she works daily from 8am until 8:30pm. She is able to earn a monthly profit of around US$ 222.

This will be Happy’s third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to expand and improve the tailoring business and has repaid the loans successfully. She now hopes for a third loan to further expand the business.

Happy will share this loan with her loan group, Karibea, which totals 16 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Happy is second from left, seated, in pink.

loans.use: To expand her sewing business

loans.name: Sabali (La Sagesse) Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq femmes du groupe Sabali sont toutes mariées, elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans et 4 enfants vivant dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au quartier Darsalam 2 de la  ville de Koutiala (région de Sikasso, république du Mali). Elles se sont  connues   à travers des liens   de voisinage.
Elles exercent presque la même activité de vente de céréales  (mil sorgho, haricot  fonio etc.). Par ailleurs,  elles vendent  des habits en plus de leurs activités principales.
 Afin  de satisfaire  le besoin de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter, le groupe Sabali a décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son dixième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elles  comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter des sacs de céréales et des habits. Elles s’approvisionnent en céréales à un prix abordable dans les villages  de Yangasso, Zangasso  et Karangasso. Quant aux habits, ils sont achetés à Bamako (la capitale de la république du Mali) et à Bobo au Burkina Faso un pays voisin. Les céréales sont vendues en détail au marché  de Koutiala et à la maison. Quant aux habits, ils sont vendus de porte  en porte, à la maison et au marché de koutiala.
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 200 000 FCFA au cours de ce cycle qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt, subvenir aux besoins de la famille élargie et investir le reste dans les activités. Elles ont pour ambition de diversifier leur commerce en embrassant d’autres activités génératrices de revenu  telle que la transformation du haricot en beignet.
texts.en:
The five women of the Sabali group are all married; they have an average age of 43 and on average, 4 children. They live in big traditional extended families in the Darsalam 2 district of the town of Koutiala (Sikasso region, Republic of Mali). They know each other because of being neighbors.

They do more or less the same work, selling cereals (millet, sorghum, dried beans, fonio--a kind of native millet, etc.) Moreover, they sell clothing along with their main work.

In order to satisfy the needs of their ever-growing clientele, the Sabali group decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with whom they are on their tenth solidarity loan (group loan). All the preceding loans have been correctly reimbursed.

They expect to use this loan to buy sacks of cereal and clothing. They buy their cereals at a reasonable price in the villages of Yangasso, Zangasso, and Karangasso. As for the clothing, it is bought in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali) and in Bobo in Burkina Faso, a neighboring country. The cereals are retailed in the market in Koutiala and out of their homes. As for the clothing, it is sold door-to-door, out of their homes, and in the market at Koutiala. They each hope to make an average profit of 200,000 F CFA over the course of this loan cycle; the profit will be used to pay the interest on the loan and to cover expenses for their extended families, with any remainder being reinvested in their businesses. Their ambition is to diversify their businesses by taking on other income-generating activities such as making and selling bean fritters.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of cereals and clothing for re-sale

loans.name: Mwawake Na Maendeleo Group

texts.en:
Sophia D., 46, is married with four children ages 22, 18, 9, and 6. She has a charcoal store and "mama rishe" (food vendor) outlet. She started these businesses in 1990 and works daily from 8am until 8:30pm. She is able to earn a monthly profit of about US$ 390.

This will be Sophia’s fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the first three to increase her stock of charcoal, added chicken and fish to her food business, and has paid the loans back successfully. She now hopes for a new loan to expand her charcoal business and try to open another store.

Sophia will share this loan with subgroup A of the "Mwanawake na maebdeleo" group. The subgroup has 6 members who run shops, sell clothes, and fish. These members hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Sophia is in the middle, front row.

loans.use: To expand both her businesses

loans.name: Kung

texts.en: A resident of Pursat Province, Cambodia, Mrs. S. makes a profit by selling palm-sugar, from village to village. She usually collects sugar from a palm-climber and sells it retail to neighbors, and she can earn in income approximately US$ 4 per day to support her family. She is married and has three children, all of whom are teenagers. Her husband is a vegetable grower. S. is requesting a loan of US$ 400 for her husband to pay plowing expenses for re-growing vegetables and also to buy cow to raise for its baby.

loans.use: To pay for plowing expenses and to buy a cow

loans.name: Bakhtiyor

texts.en:
Bakhtiyor Y. is 33 years old. He works with livestock. He buys and sells cattle from different marketplaces and has been in the business for the last 10 years. His main customers are butchers and livestock farmers. He is requesting a second loan after successfully repaying the first one.

With the previous loans, Bakhtiyor has been able to increase the number of cattle that he trades. He is married and a father of three children. With the loan from Kiva, he plans to increase his herd of cattle for trade and, if possible, open up his own butchery. This, he says, will increase his turnover. He plans to see his children go through higher education and unlike himself, be able to get good jobs.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle in order to expand his business

loans.name: Nazirboy

texts.en:
Nazirboy is 39 years old and lives with his wife and their 3 children. He is a man who from an early age was characterized as a hard-worker who is very dedicated to his agricultural work, raising cattle. He saw this as an activity that would enable him to have additional income due to the high demand for these animals in the markets. The challenge is to improve the breed, but in order to do so he has to feed them properly.

Nazirboy has the best intentions for his children, and this allows him to continue improving as a father and farmer. This farmer yearns to expand his business so that he will be able to improve his family's standard of living. In order to do so he is asking for a loan that will allow him to buy animals of a better breed in order to improve the quality of his herd.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle in order to expand his business

loans.name: Sharifjon

texts.en:
Since he was a boy, Sharifjon has loved animals. He has learned to raise them well so that he can market them. Sharifjon is married and has 4 children to provide for. To support his family, he has to invest in his livestock business and, consequently, he's approached IMON International to apply for a loan that will allow him to purchase calves and feed for them, which will, in turn, increase his income from the milk, meat, horns, etc. that cattle provide.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others.
