Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle in order to expand his business

loans.name: In

texts.en: T., 37, sells a little Khmer cake out of her home. She can make around US$ 4 each day to help feed her small family. She is married to Heang, 46, and he makes a living raising sows to sell their piglets. He normally earns around US$ 4 per day at this work and has been running this business since 1990. The couple lives in Pursat Province with their two children; both of them are daughters and are going to school. T. is requesting a loan as capital for her husband to run another business as a bicycle repairer and to buy more sows to raise.

loans.use: To run another business as a bicycle repairer

loans.name: Pan

texts.en:
Pan B. is a 51-year-old resident of the Pursat Province of Cambodia Country. She is married, and she has eight children: five are single, while three are married and do not live in their family's home. To help pay their family's living expenses, her husband is working as a committee district adviser.

Pan, meanwhile, sells charcoal out of her house. Specifically, she buys charcoal from a supplier, and she later sells such charcoal to villagers (via retail or wholesale outlets) for a profit. In addition, she grows rice. Pan hopes to expand her business but she lacks the money to do so; thus, she is seeking a loan to add to her personal savings in order to be able to purchase more charcoal for sale.

loans.use: To expand her business and to increase her inventory by purchasing additional charcoal

loans.name: Ana Corita

texts.en:
Ana Corita B. is 46 years old. She is married to Isidro, who is a farmer in their village, and they have been blessed with four children: Richard, a 25-year-old, high school graduate; Rochie, a 23-year-old, nursing graduate, who is currently working in their Rural Health Center; Ricky, a 20-year-old, high school graduate; and Darel Jay, a 12-year-old, who is currently in elementary school. Her family is living in the hilly part of Yeban Sur, Benito Soliven, Isabela. She is thankful that they have a happy family and that they are all free from sickness.

Ana is engaged in the hog-raising business. Due to her plans for a business expansion (to thereby generate more income), she is requesting a loan in the amount of 6,000 PHP ($150). In turn, she would use the loan proceeds to buy additional piglets as well as feed for her hogs. Ana is hoping that she will be able to improve the business so that she can continue to support the educational needs of her children.

Ana notes that her guiding principle in life is: “in everything you do, put God first." This passage serves as her motivation to become more diligent for the benefit of her family.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional piglets and feed

loans.name: Ganchimeg

texts.en:
Ganchimeg B. lives with her husband, 2 daughters and her mom in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia's capital city. To help her mom, she began to run a grocery store in their yard in 2002. The store was only 15 square meters next to their little house. When she began her business, she had around MNT 300,000 of capital (just under 200 USD). Now it’s increased to MNT 2 million. They have no strong competitor near their store, therefore income is good, with a daily average of MNT 150,000-250,000. During holidays, their sales income increases two or three times. Her husband runs a diner near a big company while helping with his wife’s business. 

When she took her first loan from XacBank in the year 2005, her capital amounted to MNT 800,000. This year, Ganchimeg is taking her fifth loan, with excellent credit history, to expand the grocery store. As a result of her business income, she bought a vehicle, and built a 30 square meter house for her mom. 

Now she needs a loan in the amount of MNT 900,000 to increase her capital as Mongolia's lunar New Year approaches at the end of February. She dreams of her little grocery store one day becoming a big supermarket.

loans.use: To buy extra inventory for lunar New Year sales

loans.name: Nhep

texts.en: S., 29, has owed a plot of farmland in her village since she was single, growing rice as well as vegetables. She is married to Sopheap, age 29, and he makes a living as a domestic ox trader. He usually purchases oxen from the rural people to fatten them a while and re-sell at a higher price, and he has been doing this since 2003. The family lives in Svay Art Commune, Pursat Province. In order to make extra income for the family, S. has requested a loan of US$ 300 to supplement her husband's working capital.

loans.use: To supplement her husband's working capital

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.ru: Садиева Шарофат проживает в районе Шахринау. Возраст 44 года, женат и имеет четверых детей. Работает на рынке шахринау. Выпекает и жарит пирожки для продажи. Опыт в бизнесе уже 16 лет. Работает очень много , так как прокормить такую большую семью не так просто. Кредит планирует получь для того, чтобы сделать запас муки и масла. Таким образом она сможет бесперебойно работать , а так же иметь стабильные цены на производимую продукцию. Погасиь кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Sharofat S. lives in Shakhrinaw region. She is 44, married, and has 4 children. Sharofat has been in business for 16 years. She makes pies and sells them at the local market. Sharofat works hard to provide for her large family. She plans to take this loan to purchase a reserve supply of cooking oil and flour. Sharofat plans to repay this loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil and flour

loans.name: Sayohat

texts.ru: Аминова Саехат живет сосвоей семьей в Шахринау. Замужем и имеет троих детей. Возраст 27 лет. Зарабатывает деньги дома , принимая заказы  для пошива национальной женской одежды.  Занимается бизнесом уже шесть лет. Обратилась за кредитом для того, чтобы купить вышивальную машинку. Это поможет увеличить ассортимент предлагаемых услуг и таким образом привлечь новых клиентов. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Sayohat A. lives with her family in Shakhrinaw. She is 27, married, and has 3 children. Sayohat works at home making national clothing for women. She has been in business for 6 years. Sayohat will use this loan to purchase a sewing machine. Having the new machine will help Sayohat to widen the range of her services and attract new clients. Sayohat will repay this loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Unurtsetseg

texts.en:
Ms. Unurtsetseg L. worked for the “Gobi News” newspaper starting in 1983. After that, she started to rent a place selling fruit and vegetables on the local "black" market, which cost her MNT 20,000 a month (around 15 USD), and she invested MNT 400,000 in capital to buy goods. 

At the time she started her own business, all 8 members of her family lived in a 20-square-meter "ger" (the traditional Mongolian nomadic housing), the smallest size. Her first loan amount of MNT 200,000 was disbursed in 2003 from XacBank. Since then, she has taken 16 more loans, with no problem with a repayment delay in that entire time. 

Unurtsetseg goes to the capital city of Ulaanbaatar every month to buy fruit and vegetables for her business. Her daily income from sales is now MNT 60,000-120,000. Mr. Munhuu, who is Unurtsetseg’s husband, plants several types of vegetables. They built a vegetable storage structure in their yard with 4-5 tons of capacity for their homegrown vegetables. As her business is expanding, her family life is improving year by year. The family was able to buy a big new "ger", and they were also able to buy all-new furniture. She plans to make her garden bigger so she can plant even more vegetables.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables for sale during the Lunar New Year.

loans.name: Nortoji

texts.en:
Nortoji is a very hard-working woman. She tries to make more money for the family by working hard each day. About 15 years ago, she decided to start raising and selling animals. This way she pays for the education of her three children who have high hopes for the future. She raises calves and sheep and later sells them according to her clients' demand at the markets. She prepares them ready to eat for the eating pleasure of the people in her country.

Since Nortoji aspires to a great future, she decided to expand her businesses with the sole purpose of improving her family's living conditions and help pay for her children's education so that they can one day become good citizens in society.

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing calves to expand her business

loans.name: Bibisoleha

texts.ru: Джунайдуллоева Бибисолеха проживает в районе Шахринау. Возрст 31 год.Замужем и имеет четверых детей.Уже семь лет занимается торговлей. Торгует одеждой. Продает товар в кишлаках. Она ходит по кишлакам из дома в дом и таким образом реализует свой товар. Кредит планирует получить для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Это поможет развивать бизнес и получать больший доход. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Bibisoleha J., 31, is married and has 4 children. Bibisoleha lives in Shakhrinaw region. She has been in business for 7 years. Bibisoleha sells clothing. She travels from village to village, house to house selling her goods. Bibisoleha will use this loan to increase sales volume. She plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory to increase sales volume

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Mrs. Rosemarie M. comes from the province of San Jose, Antique. She is married to a contract worker of the municipality and when he has free time, he prefers to drive a three-wheeled vehicle for an extra income.

Rosemarie is engaged in running a variety store with a municipal permit. Because of the savings of her husband she started this business but now her success little by little sees changes. Because her store is very near to the beach, her customers are people, often tourists, going to the beach. She has a refrigerator which is very important for a variety store.

She plans that someday it will be a grocery with a bakery. She knows that a bakery is a good business where she lives because there is no bakery in that place. Through her business, she dreams that she will have a concrete house someday and her children will finish their studies. She is very thankful to Ashi for lending her enough capital, and most of all she develops her personal growth in dealing with people and customers. She has also learned how to save.

loans.use: improving her variety store

loans.name: Djamshed

texts.ru: Джамшед Исломов житель города  Курган-Тюбе. Женат и имеет одного сына. Возраст 28 лет. Занимается торговлей. Торгует на Китайском рынке. Имеет торговую точку , где продает ткани. Кредит планирует использовать для того, чтобы увличить товарооборот. Это даст возможность привлечь новых клиентов и развивать свой бизнес.Погасить кредит планирует в течение 7 месяцев.
texts.en:
Djamshed I. lives in the city of Qurgan-Tube. He is 28 years old, married and has a son. He is in retail sales business and sells fabrics at the Chinese market. He plans to use this loan to increase his goods turnover. This will enable him to attract new clients and grow his business. Djamshed plans to repay the loan within 7 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase turnover

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mrs. Mercy C. grew up in Madrangca, San Jose, and Antique. She has been blessed with two children. Her common-law husband works as a nursing attendant in Antique Provincial Hospital. 
	She buys and sells frozen foods that she makes. Her customers are neighbors and workers in her community. She also accepts orders and deliveries while waiting on customers in the store. Her loan is for additional capital to earn more income and sustain the basic needs of her family and achieve their future goals.
	She plans to have her own stall in the town market. It will be the best action and help her give a better education to her children. She is very thankful to ASHI for providing her an additional income.

loans.use: To grow her frozen foods business

loans.name: Mirdjon

texts.ru: Мусоев Мирджон житьель Бохтара. Возраст 30 лет.Имеет троих детей. Кроме его семьи , с ним живут его родители. Семья у них очень большая , но очень дружная и веселая. Он уже четыре года занимается торговлей продуктов питания. Имеет свой собствененый магазин , который находится рядом с домом. Кредит хочет использовать на приобретение холодильника и дополнительной ветрины. Погасить же кредит сможет в течение 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Mirdjon M. lives in Bohtar. He is 30 years old, married and has three children. His parents also share his family home. His family is big, but very happy and friendly. Mirdjon has been in the food products sales business for four years. He owns a store close to his home. Mirdjon wants to use this loan to purchase a refrigerator and an additional display. He will repay the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a refrigerator and another display

loans.name: Ramata

texts.fr:
Madame  Ramata  D. est âgée de 60 ans, veuve elle vit avec ses 4 enfants au domicile de son défunt mari au quartier Secoura de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas été à l’école pour des raisons sociales, très tôt elle commença à  mener des activités commerciales. Elle en a mené plusieurs mais  finit par opter pour le métier de teinturière. Initiée par l’ONG ALPHALOG, elle mène cette activité depuis 20 ans et jouit d’une grande notoriété nationale et internationale, non seulement elle participe à des foires et expositions nationales et internationales mais également elle est la première présidente du Centre Culturel de Ségou, Présidence qu’elle a occupé pendant plus de 10 ans. Elle jouit aussi d’une grande clientèle, diverse et variée et  reçoit de la commande de partout. 
 Dans l’optique de plus se  professionnaliser et de réagir vite aux demandes de sa clientèle, elle fait recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elle  est en relation avec cette dernière depuis 42 mois, après  3 prêts solidaires et 2 prêts individuels tous bien remboursés, elle est à son 3ème prêt individuel pour un montant de 300 000FCFA. 
Ce prêt   sera  utilisé pour acheter 50 pagnes de tissus écrus, 20 sacs de kalama 5 cartons d’eau de javel et 2 cartons de savons. Elle s’approvisionne en matières premières sur place à Ségou.
Madame Ramata  D.  vend lors des expositions, foires, festivals ou au Centre Culturel Sinignesigui de Secoura. Ses ventes se réalisent   au comptant ou à crédit avec paiement d’un acompte de 50% pour les clients fidèles. Sa clientèle est composée d’hommes et de femmes, nationaux ou étrangers.
Avec ce prêt, elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel 150 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour subvenir aux dépenses courantes de la famille. 
Elle ambitionne faire le transport.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ramata D., 60, is a widow and she lives with her four children in the home of her deceased husband in the Secoura neighborhood in Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Not having been able to attend school for socio-economic reasons, she began early on to work at income-generating activities. She tried several, but ended up deciding to specialize in dyeing cloth. Trained by the NGO "ALPHALOG", she has been working in this sector for 20 years and is well-known nationally and internationally. She has not only taken part in national and international fairs and exhibitions, but she is also the first president of the Cultural Center of Ségou. She has held this post for over 10 years. She also has a diverse and varied clientele and gets orders from here, there and everywhere.

With a view to becoming more professional and being able to be more responsive to orders from her clientele, she has turned to the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. She has been dealing with us for 42 months, and after three solidarity loans and two individual loans, all reimbursed in a timely manner, she is on her third individual loan in the amount of 300,000 F CFA.

This loan will be used to buy 50 lengths of freshly woven cloth (gray goods), 20 sacks of kalama, 5 cartons of bleach, and 2 cartons of soap. She buys her raw materials right in Ségou.

Mrs. Ramata D. sells her goods at exhibitions, fairs, festivalsand at the Sinignesigui Cultural Center of Secoura. Her sales are made on a cash basis or for credit with 50% downpayment for faithful customers. Her clientele is composed of men and women, Malians and foreigners.

With this loan she expects to make a monthly profit of 150,000 F CFA which will be used to cover her family's current expenses. Her ambition is to go into transporting goods.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of raw materials for making "bogolan" (Malian mud cloth)

loans.name: Yokub

texts.en:
Yokub is a farmer, not only devoted to his work but also to being the father of a family. He works hard in the raising of cattle, which he takes out to graze in the early mornings. Without a doubt it is not an easy task, but the love for his family gives his work reason and meaning. Currently, Yokub wants to improve his situation by increasing the number of his cattle which in the long run will provide better financial income. If you support him, he will be forever grateful.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing the cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: Bahri

texts.en:
B. Bahri is 46 years old. She is still working diligently to help her husband who works as a farmer. Since she has lived with her husband, she has worked in the business of buying and selling cattle and also breeding sheep. She uses the profit to cover the family expenses and her children’s education fee. Bahri has 4 children. Her first child has already graduated University. The other ones are studying in school. The loan from IMON International will be used to purchase the cattle for expanding her business. She hopes that the business goes well and her family will have a better quality of life.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing the small cattle in order to expand the business and to improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.name: Javhar

texts.ru: Джавхар Расулова проживает в городе Курган-Тюбе. Одна воспитывает сына. Занимается торговлей. Продает национальную одежду, на Китайском рынке.Опыт работы составляет три года. Бизнес приносит неплохой доход. Но она планирует увеличить ассортимент товара путем получения кредита. Это даст возможность привлечь новых клиентов и заработать больше. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 7 месяцев.
texts.en:
Javhar R. lives in Kugran-Tube. She raises a son. For 3 years, Javhar sells national clothing at a Chinese market. Her business brings a good profit, but Javhar wants to take a loan to finance business expansion. She plans to repay the loan within 7 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Kushmurod

texts.en:
M. Kushmurod is 45 years old. He is married with three children. All his children are in school and are performing well. He has great passion for dairy farming and has been in this business for 15 years together with his wife. He would like to expand his business by adding another cow to the ones he has. This is because recently he acquired orders from outside town to supply milk. Kushmurod is requesting $ 800 USD in order to buy another cow and to feed them. With additional income Kushmurod will be better able to cater for his family's financial obligations, especially the education of his children.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing the cattle in order to expand his business

loans.name: Mahmadiso

texts.ru: Махмадисо Худойбердиев проживает в районе Бохтар. Возраст 50 лет, женат и имеет четверых детей. Уже шесть лет занимается торговлей. Торгует на центральном рынке , калошами. В данный момент хочет увеличить ассортимент товара  путем получения кредита. Это поможет ему привлечь новых клиентов и развивать свой бизнес. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Mahmadiso H. lives in Bokhtar. He is 50, married, and has 4 children. Mahmadiso has been in business for 6 years. He sells rubber boots at the central market. Mahmadiso applied for this loan to increase the assortment of his products. This will help him attract new clients and develop his business. Mahmadiso plans to pay off this loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the assortment of goods sold

loans.name: Ozoda

texts.ru: Бегова Озода жительница города Курган-Тюбе.Возраст 41 год, замужем и имеет троих детей. Муж уехал на заработки в Россию. Поэтому она одна обеспечивает свою семью.Работает на рынке. Торгует фруктами. Этим бизнесом занимается уже около пяти лет. Кредит планирует использовать для того, чтобы закупить фрукты, а так же оплатить арендную плату за несколько месяцев вперед. Это даст возможность сохранить оборотную сумму. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Ozoda B. lives in Kurgan-Tube. She is 41, married, and has 3 children. Ozoda's husband left to work in Russia. Ozoda sells fruits at a local market to provide for her family. She has been in business for 5 years. Ozoda will use this loan to purchase fruits and prepay a few months of stall rent. She plans to pay off this loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the sales volume and pay rent for the stall

loans.name: Yuldoshboy

texts.en:
A. Yuldoshboy was born in 1956 and is married with 6 children. As an aspiring and hard-working man he has always dreamed of achieving success in whatever he does. Thus, when he joined IMON International, he was able to make much progress with his previous loan, which he invested mostly in crop farming. Then, he saw a new business opportunity: rearing of the young cattle, which is very profitable because of the constant demand for meat at the market. Given this loan, Yuldoshboy will purchase young cattle and feed for them to expand his business. He plans to use the profits from his business to educate his children, improve the structure of his home, and improve the standard of living of his family.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing the cattle in order to expand his business

loans.name: Safarali

texts.ru: Ганиев Сафарали проживает  в Вахшском районе. Возраст 39 лет. Женат и имеет двоих детей. Работает частным таксистом. Таким образом обеспечивает свою семью. Жена домохозяйка , а дочки учатся. Для того , чтобы создать для них хорошие услоыия он очень много работает. В данный момент цены на горючее снизились и поэтому он решил закупить бензин на полученный кредит.Это даст возможность сохранить цены на предлагаемые услуги. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 8 месяцев.
texts.en:
Safarali G., 39, is married and has 2 children. He lives in Vakhshsk. Safarali is a taxi driver. His wife is a homemaker and his daughters are in school. Safarali works hard to provide for his family. While gasoline prices are low, Safarali wants to borrow money to purchase gasoline. He will repay this loan within 8 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase gasoline

loans.name: Ngwana

texts.en:
O. is married with three children; she lives in Bamenda, Cameroon.  She plans to invest this loan in  buying and selling of corn, cocoyam, tomatoes, and garri, which is in high demand in her locality.
This is O.’s second loan; she has been a member of GHAPE since 2007.  She is certain that if she continues to be polite and welcoming to her customers, while keeping herself and her business place clean, her customers will continue to purchase her items.  With the profits from this loan, O. will reinvest in her business.  She will also help to pay her children’s school fees, support her husband in his business, and help her daughter to start her business.  
O. is happy to be taking out a loan with GHAPE as they have educated her on how to use her money, while still providing her with a low interest rate.  She hopes to pay her loan quicker than the loan term so that she can continue to increase her loan amount with GHAPE.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Buying and selling of corn, cocoyam, tomatoes, and garri

loans.name: Hamlet

texts.en:
Hamlet is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fuzuli town, and is now settled in the Fuzuli region in the village of Bala Bahmanli. Born in 1965, he is married and has two children. 

He has been in this business for five years. His minimum net profit is 200 AZN. Now he needs a loan of 950 AZN to buy spare parts to improve his business.

In the future, he would like to expand his shop and to sell spare parts for all types of cars so he will have a good income. He will spend his future income to build a second shop, where he would like to do wholesale of spare parts.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Oynisso

texts.ru: Камолова Ойниссо проживает в городе Курган-Тюбе. дова , осталась одна с семью детьми. Работает на рынке в Курган-Тюбе.Кредит запрашивает для того, чтобы арендовать другую торговую точку . где-то в центральных рядах рынка. Там больше людей и торговля двигается лучше.Это поможет увеличить ежедневную выручку и таким образом доход . Погасить кредит сможет  в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Oynisso K. lives in Kurgan-Tube. Oynisso is a widow with 7 children. She works at the local market. Oynisso asks for this loan to rent another stall at the market to expand her business. Oynisso K. will repay this loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Vajidin

texts.ru: Ваджиддин Махмадов житель города Курган-тюбе. Жеат и имеет четверых детей. Возраст 35 лет. Занимается бизнесом. Завозит бананы и реализует их оптом. В данный момент хочет увеличитьб ассортимент товаров, завезти яблоки и мандарины. Поэтому он решил обратиться к нам за кредитом. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Vajidin M., 35, lives in Kurgan-Tube. He is married and has 4 children. He is a bananas wholesaler. Vajidin needs this loan to add apples and mandarin oranges to his assortment. He will repay the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the assortment of goods sold

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace N. is thirty-nine years old. She is married and has three children, two of whom are boys. One of the children is in the junior high school. The other two are in the primary school. She lives with the family in Koforidua, a small town not very far from Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. It is entirely a farming and commercial town. Grace works to support her husband. She trades in banana. Most of the women in the community trade in banana and other fruits. Grace buys unripe banana from farmers in the nearby villages, stores them to ripen and then sell. She sells to retailers in her community in the local market. Grace has been in business for six years. It has been her dream to save enough money to support her husband to take care of the family. She wants a loan to procure banana in bulk so she can maximize her profit margin.

loans.use: To procure banana

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
Raul tiene 75 años de edad, vive con su esposa en casa propia en la calle Ángel Dávalos de la zona de Alto san Pedro de la Ciudad de La Paz, percibe una renta de jubilado con la cual mantiene a su familia.

El crédito que solicita es para la refacción de su domicilio ya que como es casa antigua tiene varios deterioros, su renta no le alcanza para realizar una refacción completa por lo tanto esta refaccionando por partes.

Es cliente nuestro desde el año 2007 y su historial de pagos es muy bueno y esto lo califica para acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Raul is 75 years old and lives with his wife in his own house on Ángel Dávalos Street in the zone of Alto San Pedro in the city of La Paz. He receives a pension that supports his family.

His house is old and needs some repairs. The loan he is requesting will be used to partially refurbish it as his pension is not enough to fully restore it.

He has been our customer since 2007 with very good credit records which qualify him to get a new loan.


Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Martinez Cairo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Housing

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 43 years old, married to Niba Gideon, and the mother of two children. She lives in Ntamulung, Bamenda, Cameroon. With inadequate parental support during her own childhood, she could not make it through secondary education. Finally, she joined GHAPE at this juncture in her life and, after obtaining training in business management, she obtained her first loan of 40,000 Frs in 2007.Her achievement from this loan was plowed back into her medicine store. Alice plans to invest this loan in the medicine store by buying more medication.

With the profits from this loan, Alice hopes to expand her business and support her children, improve their education, and improve her family’s living standards. She knows she will not have a problem with her repayments because her loan schedule is set up so that her payments are small and regular.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase medicines for re-sale

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora Maria vive en alquiler con su esposo y sus dos hijos en la calle Illimani de la zona Santa Bárbara de la ciudad de La Paz, trabaja como procuradora en la Alcaldía.

 El crédito que solicita es para la operación de su cuñado, de 65 años de edad, cuya rodilla está en muy malas condiciones. La operación se efectuará en el departamento de Tarija debido a que el seguro donde son atendidos los rentistas es de muy mala calidad.

Maria es cliente de Impro desde Agosto de 2008; su historial crediticio es bueno  y además el carácter social del crédito influye notablemente para que pueda acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Señora Maria lives with her husband and two children in a rented home in the city of La Paz. She works as an attorney in the mayor's office. The credit that she is requesting is for the operation of her brother-in-law, who is 65, and whose knee is in very bad shape. The operation will take place in the department of Tarija since the hospital where people who rent are attended isn't of very quality. Maria has been a client of Impro since August of 2008. Her credit history is good and the social nature of this credit has notably influenced her ability to receive a new credit.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for the expenses of a knee operation for her brother-in-law

loans.name: German

texts.es:
El señor German vive en casa propia con su esposa en la calle José Aguirre de la zona de Alto san Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz; German es rentista y percibe una jubilación con la que mantiene a su familia, pero como sus ingresos son reducidos él tiene un Snack que funciona en la calle Loayza de la zona central, en este lugar el vende café, refrescos, sándwich, etc. y de esta manera el puede aumentar sus ingresos.

El crédito que solicita es para  la compra de insumos para su Snack (café, leche, azúcar, pan, carnes frías, etc.) y continuar con su negocio.

El señor es cliente de Impro desde el año 2003 y su historial de pagos es  muy bueno, por lo que puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
German lives in his own house with his wife on José Aguirre street in the region of Alto San Pedro in the city of La Paz. German is a rentier, and receives a pension which supports his family. But as his income is reduced, he also has a Snack Cart which operates on Loayza Street in the central zone. He sells coffee, drinks, sandwiches, etc. and in this way augments his income. The loan he is requesting is to stock his Snack Cart (coffee, milk, sugar, bread, fried meat, etc.) and to continue his business. German has been a client of Impro since 2003 and his history of payments is very good, for that he is able to access new credit.

Translated from Spanish by Cara Gutterman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of food such as sugar, coffee, bread, fried meat for his Snack Cart.

loans.name: Kotimi

texts.en:
Kotimi M. is forty years old. She is a married woman with five children, a son and four daughters. Some are in the junior high and the basic school while others are learning a trade, hair dressing. She lives with her family in a rented apartment in a small town called Koforidua in the Ashanti Region. Her husband is a farmer who cultivates food crops like maize, cassava, etc.

Kotimi is a business woman. She sells maize and bananas. She buys her goods from farmers in the nearby villages and sells to retailers in her community. She says she sells the maize in the market square to the food vendors but sells the ripe bananas by the roadside. Kotimi has been in this business for over twenty years. She wants a loan to buy maize and bananas in bulk. Kotimi is working hard to help her husband so that they can put up a building of their own.

loans.use: To buy maize and bananas for re-sale

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya is a married mom with two children. She lives in Ordzhonikidze and owns a small business selling souvenirs in the central city mall. Natalya has many loyal customers who know her little store for its versatile merchandise and affordable prices. She has been in the business for 8 years. Presently, her turnover capital is about 25,000 Grivnas. Monthly profit is about 2,600 Grivnas.

Natalya would like to increase assorted inventory in her store and her sales as a result. She is hoping to get a stable source of income and continue developing her business. A committed wife and mother, Natalya works tirelessly to improve the quality of life for her family. Today she is requesting a loan of 3,500 Grivnas to re-stock her inventory. We are hoping that her eye for market trends and customer needs will help her maintain consistent growth in her business and reach success.

loans.use: To re-stock her inventory

loans.name: San Pedro Y Pablo Group

texts.es: El grupo " San pedro y Pablo" esta representado por la señora Yolanda  y conformada 13 miembros  que en su mayoría se dedican a actividades D. venta D. productos como comida, cosméticos, vidrio, ropa y otros miembros se dedican a actividades como el trasporte público D. pasajeros, servicio D. limpieza, chaparía y servicio D. peluquería. Dentro del ámbito comercial y D. servicios existe mucha competencia pero mucho depenD. D. las ganas que se tienen para salir adelante, la experiencia y la calidad humana para no dejarse ganar con la competencia. El crédito esta destinado a la compra D. insumos, materiales y para la reparación D. sus herramientas D. trabajo para poder brindar un producto y un servicio D. calidad. Los socios (as) cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios por su anterior participación en instituciones similares a la fundación Agrocapital, ellos (as) tienen conocimiento sobre el manejo y administración D. fondos así como la responsabilidad para cumplir con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
The 'San Pedro y Pablo' group is represented by Yolanda, and is maD. up of 13 members, the majority of whom work selling products such as food, cosmetics, glass and clothing. Other members work in public transport, laundry services, panel-beating and hair-dressing. Within the sphere of commercial goods and services there is a lot of competition, but the members depend greatly on their earnings to move ahead, and use their experience and human qualities to not allow the competition to win. This loan will be used to buy supplies and materials, and to repair their work tools so they are able to offer quality products and services. The members already have experience working in solidarity groups, through their earlier participation in organizations similar to Fundacion Agrocapital. They have the knowledge to manage and administer their funds as well as the responsibility to fulfil their obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana runs her own small firm, manufacturing plastic windows. The windows are very popular as replacements for old, wooden, single-pane windows that are common in many buildings. They offer much better insulation against the cold in the winter and the heat in the summer. Oksana and her husband live in Ordzhonikidze.

Oksana launched this venture with the help of her husband a year ago. They researched the market, noticed growing demand in the market for plastic windows and decided to step in. Oksana says they have not been sorry to have taken the risk. Presently, they have about 70,000 invested in working capital. Monthly profit exceeds 4,000 Grivnas a month.

Oksana is seeking a 5,000 Grivna loan to purchase additional window fittings for her production unit. Oksana is only getting started with the expansion and development of her business. She wants to keep the benefits her customers have enjoyed before: free delivery services and a flexible discount system. Moreover, Oksana is hoping to grow her business and be able to offer additional jobs for the unemployed in her town as there are many who were downsized due to the volatile economic situation in the country.

loans.use: To purchase window fittings

loans.name: Valdemar

texts.en:
Valdemar is married. He and his common-law wife live in Drogobych. Valdemar sells clothing and footwear in the local market. He has been in this business for 3 years, ever since he resigned from his position of master of sports in weightlifting. Presently, Valdemar has over 100,000 Grivnas in turnover capital.

Valdemar is very industrious and enterprising – he is focused on his business and is determined to expand his vending facility. He is currently seeking a loan of 5000 Grivnas. Valdemar plans to use the loan to increase his assortment of merchandise and grow his business. With the increased sales and profits, he hopes to open an additional vending kiosk and improve the living standards of his family. We are happy to have this opportunity to assist him in his business endeavors.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for re-sale

loans.name: Las Activas Group

texts.es: El grupo " Las Activas" esta representado por la señora Rossemery  y conformada 13 personas todas dedicadas al comercio de productos como comida, ropa, frutas, pan, refrescos, zapatos y otros. Dentro del mercado comercial existe mucha competencia ya que existen muchos productos, pero para poder competir se debe de contar con productos de calidad para tener mayor demanda en el mercado. El destino del crédito es para la compra de insumos y mercadería para mejorar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos Yy así poder brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Los socios (as) cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios por su anterior participación en instituciones semejantes a la fundación Agrocapital y tienen conocimiento sobre el manejo y administracion de fondos así como la responsabilidad para cumplir con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
The "Las Activas" group is represented by Rossemery, and is made up of 13 people who all work in the retail sector, selling products including food, clothes, fruit, bread, soft drinks, shoes and other items. There is a lot of competition within the commercial marketplace as there are many products on offer, and in order to compete in this environment they must offer quality products to attract strong demand from the market. The loan will be used to buy basic supplies and merchandise to improve their sales and increase their incomes. In this way they can offer their families a better quality of life. The members have experience with solidarity groups through their earlier participation in organisations similar to Fundacion Agrocapital. They have knowledge about managing and administering funds, as well as the responsibility to fulfil their obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ernestina Del Socorro

texts.es:
Ernestina del Socorro M. tiene la edad de 49 años, su estado civil es soltera, Doña Ernestina tiene 2 hijos su edades son las siguientes su hijo mayor de 30 años y trabaja por cuenta propia u su hijo menor de 28 años que trabaja y estudia, su compañero de vida labora como chofer, los propósitos de Doña Ernestina son de aumentar su pulpería para que tener mas seguridad y confianza en el aspecto económico ya que todo depende de la economía del país, sus sueños son que las ayudas económicas que tenemos de los países industrializados sigan apoyándonos como lo han hecho hasta los momentos por lo que realmente es un gran beneficio el que se obtiene por que ayudan a crecer a personas pobres con el fin de lograr una mejor calidad de vida para cada uno de ellos, sus deseos son de establecer un mini súper para obtener mas ingresos para sufragar los pagos del hogar y las deudas contraídas con la institución ya que le gustaría administrar un negocio en donde sus clientes queden satisfechos con sus compras.

Su actividad económica es una pulpería y la venta de comida,la ubicación de su negocio es en su casa de habitación, por lo que el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 29 años, Doña Ernestina inicia este negocio por iniciativa propia y empezó con un puesto en el mercado pero dio inicio con otro negocio como lo fue la venta de comida por lo que comenzó a buscar la atracción de sus clientes con la venta de comida y la popularidad de atraerlos y así empezó este negocio además decide incorporar su pulpería en la que tenia una canasta donde ofrecía golosinas pero debido a las circunstancias que se le presentaron Doña Ernestina no pudo seguir con el puesto del mercado ya que no podía pagar el arrendamiento del tramo por lo que decide establecerse en su casa de habitación y así implementa su negocio, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que esta destinado para la compra de productos variados ya que tiene que abastecer su pulperia.
texts.en:
Ernestina de Socorro M. is 49-years-old, single, and has two children. Her oldest son is 30 and works for himself. Her younger son, 28, works and studies. Her partner is a driver. Ernestina wants to grow her general store so she can have more economic security and confidence, as everything depends on the national economy. Her dream is that the economic aid we get from the industrialized countries will continue to support us as it has up to this point. It really does provide a great benefit because it helps poor people grow, bringing a higher quality of life to each and every one of them. Ernestina would like to open a mini mart so she can earn more money to defray household expenses and her debt to the Foundation. She wants to run a business in which customers are satisfied with their purchases. She has been in business for 29 years, working from her house running a general store and selling food. She went into business on her own initiative, opening a stall at the market; but then she started her food business, because food is very popular and she was looking to attract customers. That's how she got into her current business. She also added a candy basket to her store. Circumstances, however, did not allow Ernestina to keep up her stall at the market because she couldn't pay the rent on the space, so she decided to set up shop in her house and run her business there. Ernestina is seeking a loan for working capital so she can buy a selection of products, which she'll use to stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa N. is forty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to eight children: three females and five males. Five of her children are currently in junior high and primary schools. The grown ups have completed and some are learning trades while others are also working. Adwoa’s husband operates a drinking bar in the locality in which they stay.

She lives with her husband and some of her children in a rented apartment in a small town near Offinso in the Ashanti Region. It is a farming as well as a commercial community in Ghana. Industrious as she is, Adwoa trades to support her husband in taking care of the family. She trades in maize. She buys bags of maize from farmers in the surrounding villages and sells at affordable prices to retailers. She also sells at the local market, especially to the food vendors. Adwoa has been in business for fifteen years. She wants a loan to buy maize in large quantities so she can distribute to more customers.

loans.use: To procure maize

loans.name: Marvin German

texts.es:
El Señor Marvin German Ríos S. tiene la edad 38 años, su estado civil es casado, Don Marvin tiene 3 hijos su edades son las siguientes su hijo mayor de 12 años de edad cursa el 1 año de secundaria su otro hijo de 10 años cursa el 5 grado de primaria y su hija de 8 años cursa el 4 grado de primaria, su compañero de vida labora en la venta de repostería y además de cosméticos, los propósitos de Don Marvin son de incrementar su negocio para prevalecer lo suficiente ya que siempre ha sido una persona que no descuida  sus responsabilidades como lo es la manutención de su familia, sus sueños son de comprar una propiedad para sus hijos ya que en la que habitan recientemente  es de su suegra ya que no tenían los recursos necesaR. para alquilar una casa donde pudieran vivir también le gustaría establecerle a su esposa un negocio completo de repostería ya que este seria una buena fuente de ingresos.

La actividad económica de Don Marvin es la venta de mercadería en general como: shorts, camisas, pantalones y ropa interior, la ubicación de su negocio es de manera ambulante el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 9 años, Don Marvin inicio este negocio por familia ya que desde muy pequeño su familia le enseño a ganarse el dinero de una forma muy honesta por lo que a la corta edad de 18 años empezó a vender productos de mercadería como ropa interior y calcetines para varón por lo que recorría los diferentes mercados en busca de clientes a quien ofrecerles su mercadería una de las cosas que mas difíciles que atreveso fue empezar sin el apoyo de su familia por lo que decide por cuenta propia superarse el mismo y sacar adelante a su familia pero su amor por el trabajo logro que obtuviera el negocio que actualmente conserva por lo que ahora necesita el financiamiento para la compra de sus productos ya que el piensa invertir muy bien este dinero para que sus hijos no tengan que pasar las mismas dificultades que atreveso el para poder mantener el negocio que posee actualmente.
texts.en:
Marvin German Ríos S. is 38 years old. He is married. Marvin has three children whose ages are the following: his eldest son is 12 years old and is in his first year of secondary school. His other son is 10 years old and is in the 5th grade. His daughter is 8 years old and is the 4th grate. His life partner sells pastries and cosmetics. Marvin's goals are to increase his business enough to prevail since he always has been a person who does not neglect his responsibilities such as the support of his family. HIs dreams are to purchase a property for his children since where they live now belongs to his mother-in-law since they do not have the necessary resources to rent a house where they may live. He would also like to establish a pastry business for his wife since this would be a good fountain of income. Marvin's economic activity is selling general merchandise such as shorts, blouses, pants and underwear. He conducts business on foot. He's owned this business for nine years. Marvin started this business through family since, since he was young, his family taught him to earn money in an honest way. At the young age of 18, he began to sell products such as underwear and socks for men for which he traveled to different markets in search of customers to whom he could offer his merchandise. One of the most difficult things that he came across was starting without the support of his family. He decided to overcome this on his own and get his family ahead. His love for the work helped him obtain the business that he currently runs and for which he now needs a loan to purchase products since he thinks he will invest this money well so that his children will not have to go through the same difficulties that he encountered in order to support the business he possesses now.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena D. is fifty years old. She is married and has given birth to five children, two girls and three males. One of her children has completed junior high school. The rest are still in school. Abena’s husband is a farmer. She lives with her husband and her children in a rented apartment in a small town called Koforidua near Offinso. It is a farming as well as a commercial community in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

Abena is a businesswoman. She trades to support her husband in taking care of the family and undertaking projects. She deals in cereals (maize). Abena buys bags of maize from farmers in the surrounding villages. She sells to retailers in her community. She also sells at the local market to food vendors. Abena has been in business for five years. She wants a loan to be able to procure maize in large quantities so she can distribute to more customers.

loans.use: To buy maize

loans.name: Rovshan

texts.en:
Rovshan was born in 1985. This young man is single, lives in Khachmaz town. He has been in the café business for three years. 

Now, he needs a loan of 950 AZN to buy the necessary things for his café.

loans.use: to buy the necessary things for café

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia O. is forty years old. She is a married woman and has four children: a girl and three boys. The first three are currently in the basic school. The last born has not reached school-going age yet, according to Felicia. Her husband is a store-keeper. He farms as well.

Felicia and the family live in a family house at Koforidua, a commercial/farming community near Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Most of the inhabitants are either into farming or trade in farm products. Very few people run different types of businesses.

Felicia trades in children’s school uniforms and bags. She buys the school uniforms and bags from the tailors and dress makers in Kumasi, a nearby city, and sells in the market square in her community. She says she also treks to nearby markets to sell. Felicia has been in this business for barely a year now and wants a loan to increase her working capital so that she can buy the goods in bulk. It is her dream to sponsor her children to make it to the apex.

loans.use: To buy school uniforms and bags

loans.name: Vahid

texts.en: Vahid was born in 1958. He is married and lives in Khachmaz region, in the Karakurtlu village. This man drives people from Guba to Khachmaz. He has been in the taxi business for 4 years. Now he needs a loan of 950 AZN to buy the seats and wheels for this car.

loans.use: to buy the seats and wheels for this car

loans.name: Valens

texts.en:
Greetings from Valens M. in Niboyi sector, Kicukiro district, Kigali (the capital city of Rwanda)! Valens is 56 years old.

Valens gets up early in the morning around 6 AM to start work and closes around 10 PM.This entrepreneur owns a small shop where he sells different fruits and vegetables such as avocados, bananas, oranges, lemons, tomatoes, marrows, and he also sells eggs, soft drinks, and much more as you can see from his photo. He employs one person to help him to run his business.

Valens is looking for a loan worth 500,000 Frws, which will help him to expand his business and to buy more types of soft drinks. This loan will be repaid in 8 months on a monthly basis.

loans.use: Expansion of his business

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria trabaja como costurera juntamente con su esposo; confecciona chamarras que son comercializadas en la ciudad de Cochabamba. Esta actividad constituye su principal fuente de ingreso con que cubre la manutención de sus tres hijos que depende de la pareja, de los cuales dos están en la escuela y la mayor en la universidad estatal. Su domicilio está ubicado en la zona 16 de febrero de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará para la compra de material de construcción y así terminar la construcción de un cuarto para la hija mayor, ya que actualmente comparten un dormitorio con sus padres y hermanitos.
 
Es el primer crédito con IMPRO, la evaluación realizada califica a Maria para la aprobación de préstamo solicitado.
texts.en:
Maria works as a seamstress alongside her husband. She makes jackets that are sold in the city of Cochabamba. This activity constitutes their main fountain of income with which they cover the support of their three children who depend on the couple and of whom two are in school and the eldest is at the state university. The loan will be used for the purchase of construction material and used to finish the construction of a room for their eldest daughter since she currently shares a room with her parents and little brothers. This is her first loan with IMPRO. The evaluation qualifies Maria for approval for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cost of materials to finish the construction of a room for her eldest daughter.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
Tomas trabaja de transportista asalariado manejando un taxi en la ciudad de La Paz; es viudo y es una persona  de la tercera edad que vive solo con el apoyo de sus hijos que ya son independientes.  Su domicilio esta ubicado en la zona Las Lagunas de la Ciudad de El Alto.

En este momento Tomas vive en alquiler y el préstamo que ahora solicita será utilizado para comprar un garaje pre-fabricado y ubicarlo en su terreno, donde hay una habitación construida que Tomás planea utilizar como dormitorio y  de esa forma podrá vivir con mayor tranquilidad pues podrá guardar el taxi en un lugar seguro por las noches y no tener que caminar para llegar a su hogar y al mismo tiempo ahorrar el costo de alquiler que paga.
 
Es segundo crédito con Impro,; el buen comportamiento de pago permite facilitarle otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Tomas works as a wage-earning taxi driver in the city of La Paz; he is a widower and lives alone in his old age though he is supported by his children who are independent. His home is located in the Lagunas zone in the city of El Alto. Currently, Tomas rents his home and this loan will be used to buy a prefabricated garage which he can place on his land where he already has a small edifice built. Tomas will use this as his bedroom and therefore be able to live more calmly since he will be able to keep his taxi in a secure place at night and not have to walk to his home; he will also be able to save on rent. This is his second loan from Impro; his punctual payments on his previous loan make it easy to approve him for this one.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a prefabricated garage to keep the taxi he drives

loans.name: Azer

texts.en: Azer lives in Khachmaz town. He is married. This man has been in his business for 4 years. Now he needs a loan of 950 AZN to buy the necessary things for a beauty salon. He was born in 1979.

loans.use: to buy the necessary things for beauty salon

loans.name: Rita

texts.es:
Rita trabaja con su esposo en la rama de carpintería; elaboran juegos de living con la ayuda de sus dos hijos mayores; dicha mercadería es comercializada en la ciudad de La Paz, convirtiéndose esta actividad en su fuente de ingreso con  que cubre la manutención de sus tres hijos que están en los últimos años de la secundaria. Rita tiene su casa propia que aún no está completamente terminada  y está ubicada en la zona de Villa Alemania en  la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará para la compra de material de construcción para así terminar los cuartos que aún están inconclusos en su vivienda.
 
Este será su segundo crédito con Impro; el buen comportamiento de pago que demostró con nuestra institución le permite acceder a otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Rita works with her husband in the carpentry business; they make living room furniture sets with the help of their two older children. The furniture they produce is sold in the city of La Paz; this is their primary source of income that covers the household costs for their three children who are still in high school. Rita has her own home which is still not completely finished, but is located in the Villa Alemania zone of the city of El Alto. The loan will be used to buy construction materials to finish the unfinished rooms of her home. This is her second loan from Impro; her punctual payments on her previous loan showed that she is worthy of receiving another.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement, paint, etc.) to finish the unfinished rooms in her home

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Muraho (Hellooo!) from Daniel R. in Kabarore Sector, Gatsibo District in the eastern province of Rwanda. Daniel is 50 years old, married with 6 children.

Daniel started his business one year ago. Daniel owns a carpentry workshop where he offers different activities such as selling timber, constructing furniture, woodworking and repairing objects made out of wood. He employs 4 people to help him to run his business.

This entrepreneur is requesting a loan worth 500,000 Rwf, which will help him to expand his business and also to buy more material for his business. This loan will be repaid in 8 months on a monthly basis.

loans.use: Expand his woodworking business

loans.name: Nazira

texts.en: This woman is widow. She was born in 1961. Nazira lives in Khachmaz town. Three years ago she started a clothing sales business. Now she needs a loan of 950 AZN to buy clothes for improving her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Tural

texts.en: Tural is single and lives in Khachmaz town. This man was born in 1979. He has run this business for 5 years. Now he needs a loan of 950 AZN to buy fruits and vegetables to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables for re-sale

loans.name: Murerwa

texts.en:
Greetings from MURERWA B., 32 years old and mother of three kids with no orphan. She lives at Kimisagara Sector, Nyarugenge District in Kigali Capital of Rwanda. 

She started her business 6 years ago. She has two milk shops; one is near Centenary House and another is at Gatsata where she gets profit of 150,000Rwf per month. She wants to get a loan of 500,000Rwf, which will be repaid in eight months on monthly basis from Vision Finance Company s.a. This loan will help her to expand her business. She now understands how much is good to work with Vision Finance Company s.a, especially with KIVA.

loans.use: Expand her Business

loans.name: Alice

texts.fr: Dame T. Alice est née en 1975 à Cotonou.Mariée à AZOGA Pierre, elle est mère de 4 filles.Originaire d'Abomey,elle a fréquenté jusqu'en classe de CM2.Après son echec au Certificat d'Etude Primaire,elle abandonna les classes et alla en apprentissage de coiffure et ceci pendant 2 ans.Elle n'a pas pu prendre son parchemin, parce qu'elle tomba enceinte .Deux ans après,elle commença la vente d'oignons avec l'aide financière de son mari.Aujourd'hui, elle a un niveau d'activité très elevé .Et c'est dans le souci de renforcer son activité,qu'elle sollicite ce prêt. Elle compte s'approvisionner uniquement en sacs d'oignons.
texts.en:
Mrs. Alice T. was born in 1975 in Cotonou. Married to Pierre Azoga, she is the mother of 4 daughters. Coming from Abomey, she went to school up to 5th grade. After she failed her Primary Studies certificate, she left off school and began an apprenticeship in hairdressing, which she continued for 2 years. She did not get her diploma here either because she got pregnant. Two years later, she began selling onions with financial support from her husband. Today, she has a very active business. She is requesting this loan to bolster this business. She intends to buy only sacks of onions.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing 65 sacks of onions

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Greetings from Betty U. in Rwezamenyo Sector, Nyarugenge District, Kigali (capital of Rwanda)! Betty is married, 29 years old, mother of 1 child and raising 1 orphan.

She started her business one year ago. She has a fashion shop near Rubangura taxi stop where she makes 45,000 Rwf as monthly profit.

This entrepreneur wants to get a loan worth 500,000 Rwf, which will help her to expand her business. This loan will be repaid in eight months on a monthly basis. Her present goal is to send all her siblings to school.

loans.use: Expansion of her business

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose W. is thirty-five years old. She is a married woman and has given birth to four children, two boys and two girls, who are currently in the basic school. Her husband is a farmer. He cultivates cassava, plantains, and other foodstuffs. Rose and her family live at their family house in Koforidua, a small town close to Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Most of the inhabitants of Koforidua are either in farming or buy and sell farm products. Very few people are in other types of business.

Rose buys and sells second-hand textiles. She buys textiles and all kinds of second-hand clothes including bedspreads, towels, ladies’ wear, etc., from Kumasi, a nearby city, and sells the goods in the market square in her community. She says she also treks to nearby markets to sell. Rose has been in this business for five years now and wants a loan to increase her working capital so that she can buy textiles in bales. She desires to help her husband take proper care of the family.

loans.use: To buy bales of second-hand textiles

loans.name: Laurès

texts.fr: Monsieur D. Laurès est né le 03 Décembre 1983 à Cotonou. Il a fréquenté jusqu'en classe de seconde.Après l'abandon des classes ,il a suivi une formation en maintenance informatique pendant 2 ans et a reçu son parchemin de fin de formation. Parrallèlement à son métier,il est très entreprenant et a ouvert des cabines téléphoniques, il vend également les cartes de recharges.C'est dans le souci de renforcer et diversifier ses activités que M. D. sollicite ce prêt.
texts.en:
Mr. Laurès D. was born on December 3, 1983 in Cotonou. He attended school up to 10th grade. After he left school, he took a computer maintenance training course for two years and received his diploma at the end of the course. Along with this trade, he is quite an entrepreneur and opened telephone booths. He also sells rechargeable phone cards. It is to bolster and diversify these businesses that Mr. D. is requesting this loan.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing 40 rechargeable phone cards for all available networks

loans.name: Alima

texts.en:
Alima A. is forty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to two children – a boy and a girl. She says currently, both of her children are in junior high school. Alima’s husband is a cocoa and maize farmer. She lives with her family in an old family house at Koforidua, near Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Koforidua is a farming and commercial town. The majority of the inhabitants are either farmers or buy and sell farm produce. Few dwellers of the town are in official professions.

Alima is a nerchant. She sells maize. She buys bags of maize from the farmers in her community and nearby villages. She says food vendors come from the cities to buy from her. She also sells in the local market and treks to nearby markets. Alima has been in business for two years. She wants to buy maize on a large scale so that she can supply to the increasing number of her customers and increase her profit margin. Alima desires to help her children climb the academic ladder to higher levels.

loans.use: To buy maize for re-sale

loans.name: Valentine

texts.en:
Greetings from Valentine M. in Kimisagara Sector, Nyarugenge District, Kigali (capital of Rwanda)! Valentine is 46 years old and the mother of nine kids with no orphans in her care.

She started her business 6 years ago. She has two milk shops; one is near Centenary House and another is at Gatsata where she makes a profit of 130,000 Rwf per month.

She wants to get a loan of 500,000 Rwf in order to expand her business. Furthermore, she says that this loan will increase her profit and also will enable her to satisfy the needs of her customers.

loans.use: Expansion of her business

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr: Dame H. Jeanne est âgée de 42 ans,elle n'a jamais fréquenté et dès son jeune âge,elle aida sa mère dans la vente de diverses articles. Elle a 5 enfants. Après s'être mariée, elle s'est lancée dans la vente de friperie pour laquelle au départ,elle était ambulante.Aujourd'hui,elle est devenue une semi-grossiste et c'est pour renforcer son activité que dame H. sollicite ce prêt.
texts.en:
Mrs. Jeanne H., 42, never attended school and from a young age, she helped her mother sell various items. She has 5 children. After having married, she began to sell used clothing, in the beginning as an ambulant salesperson, going door-to-door. Today she has become a sort of wholesaler and it is to bolster that business that Mrs. H. is requesting this loan.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing 4 bales of used clothing

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace A. is twenty-two years old. She is married and has no children for now. She lives with her husband in a commercial/farming community called Koforidua in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Her husband sells glass products, and Grace is a seamstress by profession. She graduated from her apprenticeship barely two years ago and has been running her own business.

Grace sews for both men and women but she says most of her clients are women. She sews a variety of designs to sell. She also sews for clients who come in with their own fabrics and styles. Grace owns the shop in which she works. She wants a loan to procure fabrics such as linen, polyester, etc and sewing accessories such as lining, pins, etc. She lives with her husband in a rented apartment. She desires to work hard to save enough money to acquire a bigger and better workshop.

loans.use: To buy fabrics and sewing accessories

loans.name: Akua

texts.en: Akua F. is 39 years old. She is married and has three children, two of whom are boys and the other a girl. One of the children is in junior high school. The other two are in the primary school. She lives with the family in Koforidua, a small town not very far from Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. It is entirely a farming and commercial town. Akua works to support her husband. Her husband is a fitting mechanic. He repairs motor bikes. Akua trades in bananas. Most of the women in the community trade in bananas and other fruits. She buys unripe bananas from farmers in the nearby villages, stores them until ripe and then sells them. She sells to retailers in her community in the local market. She at times resorts to other types of fruits. Akua has been in business for three years. It has been her dream to save enough money to support her husband and take care of the family. She wants a loan to procure bananas in bulk so she can maximize her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy bananas for resale.

loans.name: Hortance

texts.en:
Greetings from Hortance U. in Nyakabanda Sector, Nyarugenge District, Kigali (the capital city of Rwanda)! Hortance is 30 years old, married with one child.

She started her business 9 years ago. This entrepreneur operates a shop where she sells different kinds of men's and women's clothes (Fashion House). Hortance employs one person to help her to run this business; she earns about 116,000 Rwf as monthly income.

Hortance is requesting a loan worth 500,000 Rwf, which will help her to expand her business. This loan will be repaid in 8 months on a monthly basis.

loans.use: Expansion of her business

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.fr: Originaire d'EKPE ,un petit village du département de l'Ouémé, Dame D. Bernadette est âgée de 30 ans; elle n'a jamais fréquenté école et est placée dès son jeune enfance chez une tutrice à Cotonou. Elle aida cette dernière dans la vente de divers articles :oeufs frais,pagnes.Quelques années plus tard,elle quitta sa tutrice pour sa mère au village et y resta jusqu'à son mariage avec AZOGA  Celestin.Elle est mère de trois (3) enfants dont 1 seul scolarisé.  Elle s'est mise à son propre compte avec l'aide financière de son mari et sa belle mère .Elle vend divers articles:charbons,condiments,huile végétale,huile rouge,pétrole.Elle sollicite un prêt pour renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
Ms. Bernadette D. is from EKPE, a small village in Ouémé County. She is 30 years old and never attended school, though at an early age, she was placed with a tutor in Cotonou and helped her with selling various goods: fresh eggs and pagnes (colorful West African cloth). After a few years, she left her tutor for her mother in the countryside and remained there until her marriage to Mr. Celestin AZOGA. Today she is the mother of three children, one of whom is in school. With financial help from her husband and mother-in-law, she got started on her own selling: charcoal, condiments, vegetable oil, red palm oil, and gasoline. She is requesting a loan to bolster her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies: 40 sacks of charcoal, 1 drum of vegetable oil (25 liters), and a drum of gasoline (25 liters)

loans.name: Nidia Iliana

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señorita Nadia Iliana M. le está haciendo faltas las protecciones de las ventanas y puertas. Pero en este momento no cuenta con el capital necesario para poder llevar la mejora. 
 Es por eso que solicita un crédito para que su casa este mas segura cuando ella se encuentre trabajando. 
Planea pagar el préstamo con los ingreso de su empleo como auxiliar financiero en una tienda  de muebles para el hogar.
texts.en:
Nadia Iliana M.'s home still lacks bars to protect the windows and doors; however, she currently does not have enough capital to add these things to her home. She is seeking a loan so that her home can be safer while she is away working. She plans to repay the loan with the income from her job as a financial assistant in a home furniture store.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Installing bars to protect the windows and doors of her home

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena P. is 36 years old. She is married and has given birth to three children – two boys and a girl. All of her children are still in school. She lives together with her children and husband in Koforidua, a small town near Offinso. Koforidua is a business and farming community in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Abena’s husband deals in second hand foot wear. Abena works to support her husband to provide for the family. She is a fish monger. She sells in a shed in the local market square. She also treks to nearby markets to sell. She procures her goods from big time fish mongers in Yeji in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Abena has been in business for six years. According to her, most of her customers are food vendors in her community. She wants a loan to buy fish in bulk to make more profit so she can help her children in school.

loans.use: To procure smoked fish for resale.

loans.name: Noemi Marcelina

texts.es:
Noemí es madre de cuatro hijos, dos de ellos aun viven con ella y con su esposo. A partir de este año ella se dedica a vender ropa deportiva ofreciéndoles a amigos y familiares, pero especialmente a deportistas que encuentra visitando diferentes gimnasios. Se animo a emprender este negocio con la idea de progresar y seguir creciendo.

Por otro lado, desde hace cinco años Noemí se encarga de atender en un salón de belleza propio. Debido a sus estudios de comestología, hace algún tiempo decidió abrir las puertas de su casa y ofrecer el servicio de corte de cabello y peinado a sus amigos en un primer momento y luego a diversos clientes.

Gracias al espacio que goza en su salón de belleza, Noemí también vende maquillaje y cosméticos en general. Por lo pronto, lo que ella espera en el futuro es contar con la ayuda de su hija, quien también estudiará comestología, para poder ampliar el local de su salón y poner uno nuevo en el mercado para la venta de ropa
texts.en:
Noemi is the mother of four children, two of whom still live with her and huer husband.
