La señora Rene L. está muy agradecida por el gran apoyo que le brindaron en su anterior crédito con el cual pudo comprar  las mesas y sillas para el negocio.  
 Ella solicita su cooperación para este otro préstamo, que es para la comprar de mercancía y acondicionar el negocio, ya que viene la temporada de calor y quiere que sus clientes estén más cómodos al consumir sus alimentos. Desea pagar el crédito con los ingresos de su negocio.
texts.en:
Ms. Rene L. is very thankful for the great amount of support she received when she got her last loan. She was able to buy tables and chairs for her business. She is asking for your cooperation so that she will be able to get her next loan. With this next loan she will purchase merchandise and an air conditioning unit for her business. The warm season is coming and she wants her customers to be more comfortable while they are eating their meals. She plans to pay back the loan with the income she receives from her business.

(Translated by Jian of San Roque School)

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Merchandise and Air Conditioniner

loans.name: Yolanda Felicita

texts.es:
Yolanda vive en una zona de Comas desde los inicios de este distrito y cuando nadie quería vivir allí. Vio los alrededores desarrollarse, y desde hace ocho años tiene un restaurante conocido y muy apreciado por la zona: ‘La Esquina del Sabor’.

No siempre ha estado dedicándose a este negocio, antes tenía un salon de belleza, pero tuvo que dejarlo por que cayó enferma. Una vez que volvió a trabajar lo hizo a través de la venta de comida. Eligió este tipo de trabajo para no dejar solas sus hijas que en ese tiempo tenían siete y ocho años. Empezó vendiendo papas rellenas y tamales los días domingos al vecindario. A medida que se pasaba la voz de la buena sazón de su comida, su negocio fue creciendo.

A sus cincuenta años Yolanda es separada. No obstante tiene un buen restaurante y dos hijas ya mayores, una de ellas ahora trabaja de profesora. 

Yolanda recibe préstamos de EDAPROSPO desde hace casi dos años, y las ganancias de su negocio las invierte en la mejora de la cocina del restaurante y de su hogar.
texts.en:
Yolanda lives in an area of Comas, where she has lived since the beginning of the district, when nobody wanted to live there. She saw the outskirts develop, and has had a restaurant, well known and appreciated by the district, for eight years. The restaurant is called La Esquina del Sabor. She has not always owned her restaurant. Before she opened her restaurant she had a beauty salon, but had to leave because she fell sick. Once she returned to work she began selling food. She chose this type of work because she couldn't leave her seven and eight year old daughters alone. She began selling filled potatoes and tamales to the neighborhood on Sundays. Because of the good seasoning of her food, her business has grown. At her age of fifty, Yolanda is now separated from her husband. Nevertheless, she now has a good restaurant and two daughters, who are now older, one of which is working as a teacher. Yolanda has received loans from EDAPROSPO since almost two years ago, and the profits of her business are invested in the improvement of the kitchen of her restaurant and her home.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operación de su hija menor y techado de su casa

loans.name: Adjoavi

texts.fr:
A. Adjoavi est une demoiselle très dynamique qui fait le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale, elle habite le quartier d’agoè démakpo et fait ce commerce depuis 2005, son lieu d’approvisionnement est le grand marché de lomé. Elle n’a jamais obtenu de crédit de wages et sollicite un prêt de 150000F pour s’acheter des marchandises pour les besoins de son commerce. 
Elle n’est pas mariée mais elle a deux enfants qui sont à sa charge
texts.en:
Adjoavi A. is a very energetic young woman who's been selling food staples since 2005. She lives in the Agoè Démakpo neighborhood, and gets her supplies at the grand market in Lomé. She never got a loan from Wages before, and she's now seeking a loan of XOF 150'000 (ca US$ 300) to buy supplies for her business. She's not married but has two children to support.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resells staples

loans.name: María Maribel

texts.es:
Maria empezó trabajando con mototaxis con su esposo y sus hijos en el año 2001. Los compraban y vendían a la vez, el día de hoy sus tres hijos mayores todavía trabajan en este negocio, mientras Maria ya no. Actualmente y desde hace tres años, cuando cumplió treinta y ocho años, empezó con su tienda de bazar y abarrotes siguiendo el consejo de sus hijos.
 
Hace dos años empezó a recibir los préstamos de EDAPROSPO, que le permitieron ampliar su negocio, y ahora está planeando en el futuro junto a sus hijos alquilar un local en el mercado para vender ropa.
texts.en:
Maria began working with taxis with her husband and their children in 2001. Their family bought and sold taxis. Today, their three older children still work in this business, but Maria no longer does. At the present, and since three years ago, when Maria was thirty-eight years old, she began her own hardware and grocery store following the advice of her children. Two years ago she began to receive loans from EDAPROSPO, an affiliate of Kiva, which allowed her to expand her business. She is now planning to rent a local space in the market with her children in order to sell clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Products for Carnival season

loans.name: Rosa Victoria

texts.es:
Rosa lleva tres años con los préstamos que le brinda EDAPROSPO, y aunque solo tiene veintitrés años ya cumplió cinco años en su negocio. Tiene una tienda de helados, abarrotes y gaseosas,  por las noches ayuda a su madre en la venta de hamburguesas.

Aunque tiene un negocio propio, Rosa no ha dejado el estudio, y ahora esta llevando una carrera de Historia en la universidad.
texts.en:
Rosa has worked with EDAPROSPO, an affiliate of Kiva, for three years, and although she is only twenty three years old, she has already been in business for five years. She has a store which sells ice cream, groceries, and soda. At night she helps her mother with sell hamburgers. Although she has her own business, Rosa has not quit studying, and is currently a student of history in University.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ice cream and soda for her store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Kangni

texts.fr:
N. Kanyi est un jeune homme qui habite le quartier de kotokou kondji. Il a pour activité génératrice de revenus la vente des objets de friperie, ce qu’il fait depuis 2001, il s’approvisionne au marché d’assiyéyé. Il demande son premier crédit de wages d’un montant de 300000F pour acheter 04 balles de chemise et  des pantalons en gros.
Il est célibataire sans enfants, il arrive avec ce qu’il gagne de plus à soutenir sa famille.
texts.en:
Kanyi N. is a young man who lives in the Kotokou Kondji neighborhood. The business he has been running since 2001 consists in reselling used clothing, that he gets at the Assiyéyé market. He's seeking his first loan from Wages, to buy wholesale 4 bales of shirts and trousers. He's unmarried and without children, and counts on his additional income to support his family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and bales of shirts and trousers

loans.name: Magda Orfelinda

texts.es:
Magda estuvo trabajando en empresas desde hace los dieciocho años, pero nunca estudió por dedicarse a su trabajo, aprendió a usar las máquinas de talleres únicamente observando. En el pasado trabajó en fábricas de ropa, pero a causa de su presión alta tuve que dejar este trabajo y quedarse a trabajar en casa.

Ella es madre soltera, y aunque el padre de su único hijo siempre la ayudó económicamente, Magda tuve que criar sola a su hijo, que ahora ya tiene treinta y dos años, con las ganancias de su negocio solamente. Desde su casa ella se ocupa de la compostura y arreglo de ropa. No obstante, ahora su hijo mayor, que todavía vive con ella, se ocupa de la mayoría de los gastos del hogar y las ganancias de su negocio son exclusivamente para mantenerse ella misma y para reinvertir en su negocio.

Magda ahorra sus ganancias para reembolsarlos. A sus cincuenta y cuatro años desea poder en un futuro comprar una remalladora grande para incrementar su negocio y poder producir ella misma ropa para vender.
texts.en:
Magda has been working in various businesses for the last eighteen years, but she never finished her education because she had to work. She learned how to use machines in the workshops only through observation. In the past, she worked in clothing factories, but because of her high blood pressure she had to leave this work and work from home. She is a single mother, and although the father of her only son has always helped her economically, Magda had to raise her son alone with only the profits of her business. Her son is now thirty two years old. Since returning to work from home, she alters and mends clothing. Nevertheless her son, who still lives with her, is now in charge of the majority of the expenses of the home, and the profits of her business are exclusively to maintain herself and to reinvest in her business. Magda saves her profits to reinvest them. At fifty four years old, she wants to be able to buy a large sewing machine for the purpose of mending, in order to increase her business and to be able to produce her own clothing for sale.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Materials necessary for her business, including paper, thread, and things for her home.

loans.name: Sefelmira

texts.es:
Aunque Sefelmira ha estado recibiendo los préstamos de EDAPROSPO desde más de un año. Desde mayo del año pasado abandono su anterior negocio, la producción de sandalias, por que ya no le era rentable. Ahora se dedica a la fabricación de bolsitas de plástico y cartón, y a cualquier otro trabajo se presente. Normalmente trabaja en una fábrica, pero a veces se lleva las bolsitas a casa para avanzar el trabajo por la noche.

A sus cuarenta y cuatro años Sefelmira tiene que arreglársela como puede, con varios trabajos. Entre su esposo, su hijo mayor y ella son propietarios de tres mototaxis, que a través de muchos sacrificios gozan de sus ingresos, trabajándolos ellos mismos o alquilándolos.

Más adelante le gustaría poder abrir una tienda para tener unos ingresos más estables y asegurar un futuro para su familia.
texts.en:
Even though Sefelmira has been receiving loans from EDAPROSPO for more than one year, she closed down her previous sandal production business last May because it was no longer profitable. She now makes paper and plastic gift bags, as well as takes any other job that arises, for a living. She normally works in a factory, but sometimes she takes the bags home so that she can make progress on her work at night.

At 44 years of age, Sefelmira has to sort it out as best she can with several jobs. Between her husband, her eldest son and her, they own three motorcycle taxis, which, after many sacrifices, now produce profits for them. They work with the vehicles themselves or sometimes they rent them out.

In the future, she would like to be able to open up her own store so that she can earn a steady income and secure a bright future for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Motorcycle taxi maintenance

loans.name: Foyonan Valérie

texts.fr:
D. Valérie  habite le quartier de tokoin wuiti, elle a pour activité  la vente de riz et d’autres produits d’alimentation générale, elle exerce ce commerce depuis 2007, la demande étant élevée ces derniers temps, elle sollicite de chez wages un  prêt d’un montant de 130000F pour acheter 02 sacs de riz, 02 bidons d’huile et des condiments d’alimentation. 
Elle est divorcée de son mari et a trois enfants  à sa charge.
texts.en:
Valérie D. lives in the Tokoin Wuiti neighborhood. Her business consists in selling rice and other food staples, she's been running it since 2007. Since demand got higher recently, she's seeking a loan of XOF 130'000 (ca US$ 260) from Wages, in order to purchase 2 sacks of rice, 2 cans of oil, and food condiments. She's divorced and has three children to support.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 2 sacks of rice, 2 cans of oil, and food condiments

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth ha estado trabajando en el pequeño taller de su madre desde los quince años. Estudió costura durante un año y luego se puso a trabajar. Recibe un sueldo por este trabajo, pero hace tres años sacó su primer préstamo con EDAPROSPO y empezó su propio negocio. 

Empezó preparando unos cuantos tamales y ofreciéndolos a sus vecinos. Se hizo buena fama, y de allí empezó a incrementar la producción de tamales que va vendiendo cada fin de semana.

Elizabeth está separada de su conviviente; no obstante, él le pasa dinero para cubrir los gastos de su dos hijos, de trece y seis años.

A sus treinta y cinco años le gustaría poder, en un futuro, alquilar un puesto en el mercado para la venta de ropa, y ahora mismo está ahorrando dinero para este fin.
texts.en:
Elizabeth has been working in her mother’s small workshop since she was fifteen years old. She studied sewing for one year, then started to work. She earns a salary, but three years ago she took out her first loan with EDAPROSPO and started her own business. She started out making tamales and offering them for sale to her neighbors. She became well-known, and from there began increasing her tamale production to sell on weekends. Elizabeth is separated, however he sends her money to help support their two children who are thirteen and six. At 35 years of age, her future plans include renting a stall at the market to sell clothing. She is currently saving money to achieve this goal.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabric to complete orders for the business she has with her mother.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha comenzó a trabajar  vendiendo ropa como ambulante en un mercado y según los pedidos que sus clientes le hacían en su casa también.. Sin embargo a veces sus cliente son le pagaban al contado y tenia problemas para cubrir los gastos de la reinversión así como de su casa. Es así que luego de nueve años se animó a poner un negocio sonde el pago y las ganancias sean directas.

Hace cinco años inició un negocio en el cual además de vender extintores a diferentes empresas y negocios pequeños también ofrecía el servicio de fumigación. Hoy en día cada vez le va mejor gracias a su empeño por conseguir más clientes y por las ganas de ofrecer también un buen trabajo.

Por ahora, además de dedicar a su negocio también esta analizando las posibilidades de construir un local en su casa para abrir un negocio de cabinas publicas de Internet o una tienda de abarrotes
texts.en:
Bertha started out as a street vendor, selling clothing at a market and also taking customer orders from her house. Regardless, sometimes her customers paid on credit and she had trouble meeting her expenses, both to reinvest in her business as well as for her home. For this reason, nine years ago she was inspired to start a business where the pay and earnings went directly to her. Five years ago, she started selling extinguishers to various enterprises and small businesses. She also offered fumigation services. Currently, things improve every day thanks to her efforts to attract more customers and offer quality services. For now, in addition to dedicating herself to her business, she is also analyzing the possibility of building a site at her house to install Internet cubicles or a grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a supply of extinguishers.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Bacilia

texts.es:
A sus sesenta y tres años de edad a Bacilia se le hace difícil dejar de trabajar puesto que toda su vida se ha dedicado a tener un negocio y también a contar con un ingreso extra para los gastos del hogar y educación de sus hijos, ya que el trabajo de su esposo no cubría todas las necesidades por no tener un trabajo estable.

Durante treinta y ocho años ha vendido comida en un mercado lejos de su casa, primero con un puesto alquilado y luego como ambulante. No obstante una vez que construyeron un mercado en su localidad deicidio mudarse y ahora desde hace seis años tiene un puesto donde vende menús los fines de semana y feriados.

Actualmente, ella se encarga de mantener a su hija menor de diecisiete años y afirma que no descansará hasta que ella pueda terminar una carrera.
texts.en:
In her seventy-three years of age, Bacilia finds it difficult to stop working given that all her life she has dedicated herself to maintaining her business. She also counts on the extra income for expenses associated with her home and her children’s education, given that her husband’s work didn’t cover all the necessities because he did not have a stable job. For thirty-eight years she sold food in a market far from her home, first in a rented location and later as a street vendor. Nevertheless once a market was built in her neighborhood she decided to move, and now for the past 6 years she has a location where she sells meals on weekends and holidays. Currently, she is in charge of supporting her youngest daughter who is seventeen years old, and she asserts that she will not rest until her daughter can finish her studies.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase basic supplies for her business and to purchase her medications.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Concepción

texts.es:
Durante dieciocho años Concepción se dedicó a vender comida en el mercado, sin embargo hace cinco años abandono este negocio puesto que se enfermó. El doctor le prohibió permanece tanto tiempo expuesta al calor ya que empezaba a tener principios de fibroma en el área de su abdomen. 

Por esta razón decidió mantener solo su negocio de crianza de animales. Hace una década y media que cría cerdos para venderlos a comerciantes de res en diversos mercados. En los últimos años le ha dado una mayor fuerza a su trabajo, por lo que ha logrado cubrir los ingresos que le generaba su antiguo negocio de comida.

Junto con su esposo, quien es chofer de uno de los dos ómnibus que tienen como propiedad, sustenta los estudios de sus hijos y los gastos de su casa, así como también el mantenimiento de sus animales.
texts.en:
For 18 years Concepción sold food at the market, then five years ago she had to close this business because she fell ill. The doctor prohibited her from spending so much time exposed to heat because she was starting to have fibroids in her abdomen. Because of this, she decided to focus on her animal-husbandry business. For 15 years she raised pigs to sell to pork merchants in various markets. In the last few years she has made great efforts in her work as she wanted to make the same amount of money as she had with her old food preparation business. Together with her husband, who drives an omnibus which they own, she pays for her children's studies and the household expenses as well as for the care of her animals.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy livestock and build part of her home.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Roci Magali

texts.es:
A sus cortos 21 años, Roci es una mujer, madre y esposa muy responsable y trabajadora. Junto con su esposo se encarga de manejar una pequeña empresa en la cual se dedica a la fabricación de ganchos de ropa. Estos productos los vende hace tres años al interior del país y a vendedores minoristas en diferentes provincias.

Paralelo a su negocio ella trabaja eventualmente para una empresa grande de ropa. Ella se encarga de confeccionar los acabados de diferentes prendas de ropa. Lo bueno de este trabajo es que le permite solventar gastos en temporadas donde los costos de estos suben, como Navidad y en feriados. Antes de casarse ella pudo estudiar computación en un instituto.

Actualmente tiene una hijita de un año y medio, esta casada y tiene planes de seguir creciendo en su empresa de ganchos para poder brindarle un futuro mejor para su hija.
texts.en:
At her 21 years of age, Roci is a very responsible and hardworking woman and wife. Together with her husband she manages a small business that manufactures clothes hangers. She has been selling these products for three years in the interior of the country as well as to small vendors in different provinces. Along with her business she also works sporadically for a large clothing company. She is in charge of the finishes on the different types of garments. The good thing about this work is that it allows her to cover her expenses during the seasons when costs are higher such as Christmas and during fairs. Before getting married she studied computing at an institute. She currently has a one and a half year old daughter and is married. She plans on continuing to expand her clothes hanger business in order to offer her daughter a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to manufacture clothes hangers.

loans.name: Sixta Alejandrina

texts.es:
Sixta es socia del Banco Comunal Amor Divino.
Sixta es casada, tiene 53 años y 3 hijos, Sixta elabora pasteles, queques que prepara en su casa y luego lo hornea en un horno alquilado, sus ventas los realiza al por mayor a las tiendas, por pedidos y también de manera ambulatoria. 
Sixta necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de harina, manteca, leche, azúcar.
Los sueños de Sixta son mejorar su casa, tener una pastelería en un local estable y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Sixta is a member of the Amor Divino (“Divine Love”) cooperative bank. Sixta is married, 53 years old, and has three children. Sixta makes cakes that she prepares at her house and then bakes in a rented oven. She realizes her sales at wholesale to stores, on order, and also as a street vendor. Sixta needs a loan of 2,000 Peruvian soles to invest into the purchase of flour, butter, milk, sugar. Sixta’s dreams include improving her home, having a bakery at a fixed location, and that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase flour, butter, milk, sugar.

loans.name: Rosario Consuelo

texts.es:
Cerca de diez años fue el tiempo que Rosario dedico a su trabajo de obrera en una fábrica de fólderes de cartón Cuando se caso con su esposo se integro al pequeño negocio, en aquel entonces, de confección de artes, pulseras y collares para damas. 

Poco a poco fueron perfeccionando las técnicas de elaboración de joyas y también fue creciendo la cantidad de pedidos que tenían. Hoy en día necesitan de la ayuda de dos jóvenes para poder abastecerse y cumplir con los pedidos.  

Rosario y su pesos no pueden tener hijos, lo que los ha llevado a invertir todo su esfuerzo y trabajo en el crecimiento de este mismo y el progreso de sus vidas. Dentro de unos años ellos desean formalizar su empresa y poder exportar directamente al exterior sin necesitar de un intermediario, como hoy lo hacen, y poder tener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Rosario dedicated herself to her work at a cardboard box factory for nearly ten years. When she married her husband, they became involved in a small business making handcrafted items such as bracelets and necklaces for women. Little by little, they perfected their jewelry-making techniques, and also growing the number of orders they received. Currently, they need the help of two young assistants to be able to keep their supplies up and fill orders. Regretfully, Rosario and her husband can’t have children. This has led them to invest all their effort and hard work into growing their business and improving their standard of living. Within a couple of years, they would like to formalize their enterprise and export their products outside the country without needing an intermediary as they do now. This would help them to increase their earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies, such as wire and stones.

loans.name: Juana Marina

texts.es:
Marina  es socia del Banco Comunal Amor Divino.
Marina es casada, tiene 45 años y 3 hijos, Marina junto a su esposo tienen una ferretería en su casa, actividad que vienen realizando hace 1 año,  y les esta yendo cada vez mejor. Además Marina tiene una tienda de abarrotes y bebidas.
Marina necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de chapas, focos, pinturas.
Los sueños de Marina son que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener una ferretería grande y ser mayorista, tener un hogar unido.
texts.en:
Marina is a member of the communal bank "Amor Divino" (Divine Love). Marina is married, is 45 years old and has three kids. Marina and her husband have a small store in their house where they sell hardware supplies. They have been doing this for a year now and the business continues to improve. Marina also has a store where she sells groceries and drinks.

Marina needs a loan of 1,000 Soles which she will invest in the purchase of door knobs, locks, light bulbs and paint. The dreams of Marina are that her children will become professionals, she will have a large hardware store, she will be a wholesaler, and that she will have a loving and close family.

(Translated by Andrea and Tyler of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The Purchase of Door Knobs, Locks, Light Bulbs and Paints

loans.name: Paz Y Amor 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Santa S. is a group coordinator for the Paz y Amor Bank of Hope. Of this 3-group bank, 2 groups of 5 are participating in this loan. All the group members live in Samana, Dominican Republic. Santa's business consists in selling beauty products and personal care products. Mostly, she sells the products at her home to people in her own neighborhood. She has 4 young children.

Santa's favorite activity is to read and she also loves to eat vegetables. All of the loan she receives will be used to replenish her business merchandise. Santa hopes in the future to expand her business to a point where she has her own beauty supply.

On behalf of Esperanza, thank you for supporting these entrepreneurs!

loans.use: Purchase various personal care products for re-sale

loans.name: Florentino

texts.es:
Florentino se dedica desde haces más de veinte años a la venta de repuestos y reparación automotriz. Cuando tiene la oportunidad de comprar autos descompuestos lo hace y luego de repararlos logra revenderlos una vez más a un mejor precio.

Toda su vida a trabajado con el fin de mantener su hogar. Hoy se siente orgulloso de ver a sus dos hijos mayores. No obstante, aún tiene la responsabilidad de velar por la educación de su nieto de nueve años, el cuidado de su esposa y el mantenimiento de su casa.

El sueña con abrir una tienda de repuestos en su casa y poder prescindir del local alquilado donde trabaja actualmente.
texts.en:
Florentino has been working for the past 20 years as a cart parts salesman and a mechanic. When he has the chance to buy broken-down cars, he does. He then fixes them up and sells them for a profit. All of his life he has worked to support his family. Today he feels proud to see his older sons. He is also responsible for paying for the education of his nine year old grandson. In addition he must provide for his wife and pay for the cost associated with their home. He dreams of opening a car parts store and operate it out of his house. Then he would be able to let go of the space that he presently rents and work out of his home.

(Translated by Alex and Jasmine of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Parts and Pay for Shop

loans.name: Paula Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Paula es una mujer trabajadora desde muy joven se ha dedicado a trabajar para sus familia, es docente de la secundaria  desde hade veinte años, tiene 49 años de edad, reside en el barrio Omar Trujillo en la capital de Managua, con tres hijos de 19,25 y 28 años de edad, dos de ellos trabajan y uno cursa la universidad. Sus planes es poder comprar un vehiculo ya que ha sido uno de sus anhelos, ya que por años ha viajado en ruta que van llenas, es por eso que ha ido ahorrando y con el apoyo que Afodenic esta brindando con crédito para poder comprar su vehiculo que se lo están ofreciendo en oferta lograra cumplir sus sueños lo cual va hacer de beneficios para poder viajar al trabajo y poder gozar con su familia un viaje placentero. Sus objetivos es poder ayudar a su hija que termine su carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Paula is a hard working woman. She has worked since she was very young for her family. She has worked as a high school teacher for the past twenty years. Paula is 49 years old. She lives in Omar Trujillo, which is the capital of Nicaragua, Managua. She lives there with her three children who are 19, 25 and 28 years old. Two of her children have jobs and one is in college. Her plans are to be able to buy a car, since it has been one of her dreams for many years now. She has been commuting to and from work on a bus that is always completely full and very uncomfortable. For that reason she has been saving money and with the help of Afodenic she will be able to fulfill her dreams. This will allow her to be able to purchase a care to drive to and from work and to be able to enjoy with her family a pleasant commute. Her goal is to help her daughter to finish her university education and to become a professional.

(Translated by Ashlee and Katey of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To Buy a Car to Commute to Work

loans.name: Graciela Alejandrina

texts.es:
Graciela es socia del Banco Comunal Amor Divino.
Graciela es casada, tiene 39 años y 4 hijos, Graciela vende truchas de manera ambulatoria en el mercado Nery garcía, también atiende a pedidos de sus clientes. Además Graciela vende útiles escolares en campaña escolar, talcos, serpentinas en época de carnaval y dependiendo de las campañas.
Gabriela necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de trucha, talcos, serpentinas.
Los sueños de Graciela son tener casa propia, un restaurante o bodega y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Graciela is a member of the Amor Divino community bank. Graciela is married; she is 39 years old and has four children. Graciela sells trout, walking about the Nery García market as well as on request to her customers. In addition, Graciela sells school supplies during the school year, powders and streamers during carnival and during elections. Gabriela needs a loan of 1,000 soles with which she will buy trout, powders and streamers. She dreams of owning her own home, having a restaurant or a store and seeing her children have careers.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy trout, powders and streamers.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa se dedica a la venta a de cosméticos desde hace ocho años. Empezó vendiendo productos de una sola marca, pero poco a poco y con la idea de obtener un mayor ingreso ha llegado a vender cosméticos de tres distintas marcas. Por otro lado, también ofrece el servicio de limpieza ay mantenimiento en un consultorio dental. Ha sido con este oficio con el que ella empezó a trabajar y a ayudar con los gastos en su hogar. 

Rosa es madre de dos hijas, quienes siempre han significado su motivación más importante para poder trabajar. Hoy en día ellas ya son mayores e independientes; por lo que las ganancias de Rosa las comparte con su esposo ara cubrir gastos y mantenimiento de su casa.
 
Junto con unas amigas esta considerando la posibilidad de abrir  un negocio de confección de ropa dentro de unos años.
texts.en:
Rosa has been making a living by selling cosmetics for the past 8 years. She started selling the products of only one brand, but little by little, she has been able to start selling the cosmetics of three different brands. She also offers a cleaning service in a dental office. With this side job she was able to work and help out with the household expenses.

Rosa is the mother of two girls, who are her motivation to work. Now that they are grown, Rosa and her husband live alone. She shares her earnings with her husband so that all of the household expenses with be covered. Together with some friends, Rosa is considering the possibility of starting a business of making clothing in a few years.

(Translated by Ally and Mariela of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: New Merchandise (Cosmetics)

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen es socia del Banco Comunal Amor Divino.
Carmen es casada, tiene 56 años y 6 hijos, Carmen junto a su esposo se dedica a la fabricación D. ladrillos en la comunidad D. Compañía, actividad que realizan con la ayuda D. peones. Además Carmen se dedica a la siembra D. verduras que venD. en el mercado D. abastos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.
Carmen necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. leña y pago D. los peones.
Los sueños D. Carmen son mejorar su casa, tener una tienda en su casa y que su hija sea profesional.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the communal bank "Amor divino" (Divine Love). Carmen is married and is 56 years old. She has 6 children. She and her husband make a living by making bricks. in a community called Compañía. They hire day laborers because they need help making the bricks. Carmen also makes a living raising and selling vegetable plants. She sells them at a wholesale market in Ayacucho. Carmen needs a loan of 1,000 Soles. She will invest this money in the purchase of fire wood and will also use it to hire workers.

Carmen dreams of making improvements to her house, having a store in her house and her daughter becoming a professional.

(Translated by Nikki of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood and to hire workers

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel además de ser una señora joven y alegre también es muy trabajadora. Por las mañanas cuida de un niño desde hace seis años. Mientras que por las tardes sale a vender diariamente frituras y platos típicos de su país en la puerta de su casa.

Eventualmente, la contratan como cocinera en distintas fiestas. En estas fiestas algunas veces ella también vende pollos al por mayor con la idea de ofrecer un servicio más completo. También la contratan par a la limpieza de casas y locales.

Gracias a su trabajo ella puede educar y alimentar a sus dos hijos, uno de once años y la segunda de solo cuatro años. Su esposo la ayuda con los gastos trabajando como taxista.

En un futuro le gustaría poder abrir una tienda de abarrotes o ropa.
texts.en:
Besides Maribel being a young and happy lady, she's a very busy woman as well. In the morning she has taken care of a child for the past 6 years. During the afternoons, she sells fried treats and the typical plates of her country from the door of her house.

She is often hired to cook at parties and festivals. At the festivals sometimes she also sells chicken. She also works by cleaning houses and businesses.

Thanks to her work, she has been able to send her two children to school and to provide for their needs. One of her children is 11 and the other is only 4 years old. Maribel's husband helps her with the costs of their home by working as a taxi driver.

In the future she would like to open a clothing store or a grocery store.

(Translated by Jian and Elliot of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients in bulk, including chickens to roast

loans.name: Bernardina Delia

texts.es:
Bernardina es socia del Banco Comunal Amor Divino.
Bernardina es casada, tiene 56 años y 3 hijos, Bernardina tiene una panadería en su casa en donde elabora todo tipos de panes, para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda de personal, sus ventas los realiza en su mismo horno. Además Bernardina tiene una bodega en su casa en donde vende abarrotes y también tiene un locutorio.
Bernardina necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de harina por sacos.
Los sueños de Bernardina son sacar adelante a sus hijos con una profesión, ampliar su negocio y que toda su familia gocé de buena salud.
texts.en:
Bernard is a member of the Divine Love Community Bank. Bernardina is married, is 56, and has 3 children. Bernardina has a bakery in her house where she makes all kinds of bread, for which she counts on personal assistance, her sales are realized in her own oven. Also Bernardina has a bodega in her house. Bernardina needs a loan of 2000 soles which will be invested in buying flour. Bernardina's dreams are to move her children forward with a profession, to grow her business and that her whole family has good health.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying flour

loans.name: Jeronimo Martin

texts.es: Don Jerónimo  tiene 37 años de edad, reside en laureles sur en la ciudad de managua, su esposa es ama de casa y le tiene tres hijos que cursan la secundaria, el negocio de don Jerónimo, es  la venta y reparación de batería, trabajo que hace desde hace trece años, que inicio con prestamos en microfinacieras, en Afodenic llevo seis ciclos de prestamos que son de muchos beneficios para su negocio, como en su vida personal, con este crédito quiere lograr terminar de cerrar bien su casa ya que es insegura, y poder gozar de una casa digna. También desea seguir ayudando a sus hijos a que estudien, poder mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio para brindar un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Jerónimo is 37 years old and lives in the Laureles Sur neighbourhood of Managua. His wife is a housewife; they have three children in high school. Jerónimo sells and repairs batteries. He started this business three years ago with loans from microfinancial institutions. He has borrowed six times from Afodenic and his loans have been of great benefit to his business as well as to his personal life. He will use this loan to make his house more secure, so that he can have a decent home. He also wants his children to continue their studies as well as improve the infrastructure of his business so that he can give his customers better service.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials for home improvements.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.es:
Jacqueline es madre de tres hijos, uno de doce años, el segundo de nueve y el último de tan solo tres años. Es por ellos que siempre ha estado dispuesta a aprovechar todas las oportunidades de trabajo o negocio que se le presenten, para poder ayudara a mantener a sus tres niños.

Hace diez años trabaja con una señora vendiendo comida en un puesto ambulante en la calle principal de su localidad. En un inicio empezó vendiendo solo productos de belleza pero una vez que se le presento la oferta de trabajo ella la acepto y hoy no solo vende cosméticos y vende comida junto a la señora, desde hace siete años vende postres en la puerta de su casa. Por las tardes vende gelatina o mazamorra, depende de la estación, junto con su hermana quien vende por su parte frituras y comidas típicas. 

Aunque no le va mal en su trabajo, ella asegura que podría irle mejor, por ello planea abrir un bazar o tienda de ropa dentro de unos años.
texts.en:
Jacqueline is a mother of three: her children are 12, nine and three years old. For them, she is always prepared to seize work or business opportunities as they present themselves so that she can help support her three children. For the past 10 years she has been working with another woman selling food from a cart in the main street of her neighbourhood. Initially she was only selling beauty products but when the offer of work came she accepted it and today she sells not only cosmetics but food with this woman. For the past seven years she has sold desserts from the doorway of her home. In the evenings she sells jello or pudding depending on the season together with her sister who sells fried foods and traditional foods. Although work is not going poorly, she asserts that it could go better and because of this she is planning to open a hardware store or clothing store in a few years.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For beauty products and to stock her pudding-selling business with glasses, spoons and so on.

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes 7 Group

texts.en:
"Mujeres Valientes" is an Esperanza Bank of Hope based in Puerto Plata. The newest members of this bank have joined "Mujeres Valientes" as the 7th group. Group coordinator Vonice J. is a mother of 3 (children ages 8, 5, and 3), who will invest her loan in clothing sales. She has been selling clothes for ten years now, ever since she arrived in the Dominican Republic from Haiti.

Vonice purchases her inventory in nearby Santiago and sells locally. She will receive 5,000 pesos (about 140 USD) during this first loan rotation and expects to make about a 2,000 (almost $60) peso net profit from her merchandise investment. With her profits, Vonice looks to better her children's lives and pay school fees.

Other members of Vonice's group will also be investing in clothing and accessories for re-sale. This entire group is comprised of Haitian immigrants, a demographic that faces many extra day-to-day challenges in the Dominican Republic.

loans.use: Purchase more varied clothes to sell

loans.name: Anatolia

texts.es:
Anatolia es socia del Banco Comunal Amor Divino.
Anatolia es conviviente, tiene 42 años y 6 hijos, Anatolia vende medicina natural que ella misma prepara dependiendo del pedido de sus clientes, sus ventas los realiza en el mercado Nery garcía y también a domicilio.
Anatolia necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de hierbas variadas.
Los sueños de Anatolia son tener una tienda naturista en un local estable, comprar un terreno para construir su casa.
texts.en:
Anatolia is a member of the Amor Divino community bank. Anatolia is married, 42 years old and has six children. Anatolia sells natural medicine which she prepares herself at the request of her customers. She sells her medecines from the Nery García market as well as from home. Anatolia needs a loan of 2,000 soles to invest in a variety of herbs. Anatolia dreams of having her own store to sell her natural medecines from a stable location and of buying a plot of land to build her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a variety of herbs.

loans.name: Sofia Catalina

texts.es:
Sofía y su esposo hace un tiempo se dedicaban a vender mochilas, maletas y carteras en un mercado como ambulante. No obstante, una vez que su esposo consiguió un trabajo estable en una empresa de gas, Sofía abandonó el negocio de las maletas. Luego de ello, Sofía consiguió un trabajo en la Municipalidad de su localidad. Lamentablemente después de un año y medio, también debió abandonarlo puesto que quedó en cinta de su única hija.

Ahora se dedica por las mañanas y en sus tiempos libres a la venta de productos de belleza de tres diferentes marcas. En las tardes se ocupa trabajando en una discoteca en la cual también gana clientes para su negocio de cosméticos.

Eventualmente cuando no tiene muchos ingresos en su negocio trabaja independientemente para una imprenta. En un futuro, anhela abrir un pequeño puesto en el mercado junto con su hermana.
texts.en:
Sofia and her husband sold rucksacks, luggage and wallets on a market as street vendors for a while. Nevertheless, once her husband obtained a steady job in a gas company, Sofia stop selling the luggage products. After this, Sofia got a job at the local town hall. Unfortunately, after a year and a half, she had to leave the job because she became pregnant of her only daughter. Now, she sells beauty products from three different brands in the mornings and during her free times. In the evenings she works at a discotheque, where she also gets clients for the cosmetics business. Sometimes when she doesn't have enough income she works independently for a printing company. Her dream in the future is to open a small stand on the market together with her sister.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more merchandise

loans.name: Herlinda

texts.es:
Herlinda es socia del Banco Comunal Amor Divino.
Herlinda es casada, tiene 41 años y 4 hijos, Herlinda vende pescados en el mercado Covadonga, actividad que realiza los días sábados y domingos, los demás días trabaja como madre cuidadora de un programa de niños.
Herlinda necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pescado.
Los sueños de Herlinda son ampliar su negocio, surtir su negocio y vender al por mayor.
texts.en:
Herlinda is a member of the Amor Divino community bank. Herlinda is married; she is 41 years old and has four children. Herlinda sells fish in the Covadonga market on Saturdays and Sundays. The rest of the week she babysits. Herlinda needs a loan of 1,000 soles to buy fish. She dreams of expanding her business, increasing her stock and selling wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Rosa Luz Paola

texts.es:
Cuando recién terminó su secundaria Rosa se dedicaba a fabricar productos de cuero para una empresa. Estuvo aquí por año y medio, debido a problemas personales tuvo que abandonar el trabajo. 

Actualmente vende ropa para bebés y niños por pedido y a domicilio. Antes contaba con la ayuda de un familiar suyo quien tenía un puesto en el mercado y ofrecía la ropa de Rosa. Por ahora ella vende solo por su cuenta y ya tiene cerca de cinco años con su negocio.

Al igual que su hermana ella, trabaja como cajera en una discoteca por las noches. Ella afirma que este trabajo la ayuda para cubrir gastos extras en su casa.

A sus veinticinco años y siendo soltera tiene planes d abrir un puesto en el mercado para poder crecer en su negocio y vender mas ropa.
texts.en:
Rosa made leather products for a company when she had just finished middle school for a year and a half, but due to personal problems she had to leave the job. At present she sells clothes for babies and children by order or she visits her clients at home. Before, she used to have the help of a relative who had a stand in the local market and he was offering Rosa's products. At present she only sells the clothes on her own; she has had this business for 5 years. She also works as a cashier at a discotheque at the nights just like her sister. She tells us that this work help her to cover the extra expenses at home. Being single and 25 years old she plans to open a stand in the local market to be able to make her business grow and to sell more clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more merchandise

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es:
Wilfredo es socio del Banco Comunal Amor Divino.
 Wilfredo es soltero, tiene 40 años y vive con sus padres, Wilfredo es docente de educación secundaria, vende material pedagógico, libros que ofrece a sus colegas, sus ventas son al crédito. 
Wilfredo necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de laminas, programas y libros.
Los sueños de Wilfredo son tener una librería y culminar sus estudios de maestría.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is partner of the Communal Bank called "Amor Divino" Wilfredo is single, he is 40 years old and lives with his parents, Wilfredo is a teacher of secondary education, he sells pedagogic material, books that he offers to his colleagues. His sales are on credit. Wilfredo needs a loan of 1500 soles ($475) money that will be invested to buy paper, software and books. Wilfredo's dream is to have a bookstore and to finish his Master's Degree.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy paper, software and books.

loans.name: Fuerza Divina 6 Group

texts.en:
Ana Belkis P. is the group coordinator for Group 6 of the "Fuerza Divina" (Divine Force) Bank of Hope, in El Seybo, in northeast Dominican Republic. This group has 5 members.

Ana has 2 small businesses; in one she sells clothes, especially undergarments for all ages and sleepwear. Her other business is selling fried meat-filled pastries and fried plantains. She has 4 children at present; ages 16, 11, 8 and 6. She had a 5th son who passed away some time ago. She says overcoming the death of her child has been one of her biggest trials in life.

Ana is striving to stabilize both of her businesses in order to help her children get ahead in life and study. She believes her businesses will allow her to accomplish her dreams and acquire a higher sense of realization with her remaining children that will ease the pain of the loss of her son.

This is a struggling mother who is an example of everyday courage to all her community and her group peers. Thank you for supporting these entrepreneurs!

loans.use: To purchase undergarments and sleepwear for clothing business: products such as flour and oil for fried food business

loans.name: Orfelinda

texts.es:
Orfelinda es socia del Banco Comunal Amor Divino.
Orfelinda es conviviente, tiene 42 años y 3 hijos, Orfelinda vende ropa que ofrece a amigos y familiares, sus ventas son al crédito, la ropa lo adquiere en la ciudad de Lima. Además Orfelinda prepara tortas que reparte de acuerdo a pedidos.
Orfelinda necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de uniformes para la campaña escolar.
Orfelinda sueña con tener una pastelería en un local estable.
texts.en:
Orfelinda is a partner of the Communal Bank called "Amor Divino". Orfelinda is a live-in partner, she is 42 years old and she has 3 children. Orfelinda sells clothes that she offers to her friends and relatives. She makes her sales on credit. She buys all the clothing in the city of Lima. Orfelinda also makes cakes that she delivers according to the orders. Orfelinda needs a loan of 900 soles ($300), and the money will be invested to buy school uniforms for the school season. Orfelinda dreams of having a bakery in a stable premises.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy school uniforms for the school season.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Felix es socio del Banco Comunal Musuq Rumi que significa Nueva Piedra en quechua.
Felix es casada, tiene 56 años y 3 hijos, Felix se dedica a la compra de ganados en las diferentes ferias de la región, luego los beneficia en el camal de la ciudad de Ayacucho y lo reparte por mayor a los carniceros.
Felix necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ganado vacuno.
Los sueños de Felix son tener capital propio, mejorar su casa para la comodidad de sus hijos y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Felix is a partner of the Communal Bank called "Comunal Musuq Rumi" which means New Stone in Quechuan. Felix is married, he is 56 years old and he has 3 children. Felix buys cattle from the different fairs of the region where he lives, then he take it to the slaughterhouse of the city of Ayacucho and then distributes the meat as wholesale to the butchers. Felix needs a loan of 2000 soles ($625); the money will be invested to buy dairy cattle. Felix's dream is to have his own working capital, improve his house for the comfort of his children and that his children finish their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy dairy cattle

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina es socia del Banco Comunal Musuq Rumi que significa Nueva Piedra en quechua.
Justina es conviviente, tiene 45 años y 3 hijos, Justina tiene una tienda en un local alquilado ubicado cerca al mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho, en donde vende abarrotes al por mayor y menor. Además Justina se dedica a la siembra de papa en sus terrenos propios.
Justina necesita un préstamo de 3400 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra d azúcar y arroz.
Los sueños de Justina son seguir trabajando y hacer mas grande su negocios, sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Justina is a partner of the Communal Bank called "Musuq Rumi" which means New Stone in Quechuan. Justina is a live-in partner; she is 45 years old and she has 3 children. Justina has a shop in a rented premises located close to the wholesale food market of the city of Ayacucho, where she sells wholesale and retail groceries. Justina also sows potatoes in her own land. Justina needs a loan of 3400 soles ($1050) and she will use the money to buy sugar and rice. Justina's dream is to keep on working and to make her business grow and that her children finish their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sugar and rice.

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es:
Marleny  es socia del Banco Comunal Musuq Rumi que significa Nueva Piedra en quechua.
Marleny es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 3 hijos, Marleny tiene cabinas de Internet en su casa y también locutorio. Además Marleny tiene una tienda en donde vende abarrotes, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Marleny necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cerveza, gaseosas, galletas, caramelos.
Los sueños de Marleny son seguir construyendo su casa, mejorar su negocio e implementar un taller de confección de prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Marleny is a member of the Musuq Rumi, or New Stone in Quechua, community bank. Marleny is married; she is 28 years old and has three children. Marleny has internet booths in her home as well as a telephone booth. In addition, Marleny has a store where she sells groceries. Her store is open 7 days a week. Marleny needs a loan of 800 soles to buy beer, soft drinks, cookies and candies. She dreams of continuing to build her home, improving her business and opening a sewing shop where she would make clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beer, soft drinks, cookies and candies

loans.name: Ivan

texts.es:
El señor Ivan vive en casa de su tía en la calle chaco de la zona de Cristo Rey de la ciudad de La Paz; la actividad que tiene es la venta de ropa que le manda su mama de Chile, también vende CDS en las oficinas publicas.

El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital y comprar más ropa y CDs para así de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos y solventar sus estudios.

Esta es la primera vez que solicita un crédito de  Impro, pero por la actividad y el flujo de caja elaborado califica para obtener uno.
texts.en:
mr. Ivan lives in a house with his aunt on Chaco Street in Cristo Rey zone in the city of La Paz; the activity that he has is selling clothes which his mom sends him from Chile, and he also sells CDS in the public offices. The loan which he is asking for is to increase his capital and buy more clothes and CDs and in this way increase his income and pay for his studies. This is the first time he has asked for credit from Impro, but because of the business and the flow of capital, he qualifies to get one.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a larger quantity of clothes from Chile to increase his income

loans.name: Aparicio

texts.es:
Aparicio es socia del Banco Comunal Musuq Rumi que significa Nueva Piedra en quechua.
Aparicio es casada, tiene 48 años y 6 hijos, Aparicio viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde compra ganado vacuno, los animales los vende en la feria de San Juan y también los beneficia en vende por mayor a los carniceros.
Aparicio necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ganado vacuno.
Los sueños de Aparicio son mejorar su negocio, tener capital propio y mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Aparicio is a member of the Musuq Rumi Community Bank, which means New Rock in Quechua. He is a 48-year-old married father of six. He travels to the different flea markets in the region in search of heads of cattle to purchase, which he then sells at the San Juan flea market and also sells them at wholesale to butchers. Aparicio needs a loan of 2,000 soles, which he plans to use to purchase more heads of cattle. His dreams are to improve his business, establish his own wealth and improve his home.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase heads of cattle

loans.name: Victoria Ridina

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Marcela.
Victoria es soltera, tiene 58 años y 6 hijos, Victoria trabaja como auxiliar de educación en el puericultorio de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además Victoria los días domingos vende comida típica en su casa, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su hija.
Victoria necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leña, maíz y carne.
Victoria sueña con que su ultimo hijo sea profesional y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the Marcela Community Bank. She is a 58-year-old single mother of six. She works as an education assistant at a daycare center in the city of Ayacucho. Furthermore, on Sundays Victoria sells typical regional meals out of her home, an activity made possible thanks to the help of her daughter. Victoria is requesting a loan of 600 soles, money which she plans to invest in the purchase of firewood, corn and meat. Her dreams are for her youngest son to be a professional and to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase firewood, corn and meat

loans.name: Maria Jacinta

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Marcela.
Maria es viuda, tiene 50 años y 2 hijos, Maria tiene un puesto en el mercado Nery García en donde vende verduras variadas, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además Maria se dedica a la agricultura de verduras.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de zapallo, ajo, cebolla.
Los sueños de Maria son ayudar a sus hijos para que sean profesionales y tengan negocios propios.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Marcela Community Bank. She is a 50-year-old widow with two children. She has a post at the Nery García market where she sells a variety of vegetables every day of the week. Furthermore, Maria also takes part in the cultivating of the vegetables. She is requesting a loan of 1,050 soles, which she plans to use for the purchase of pumpkin, garlic and onion. Her dreams are for her children to be professionals and have their own businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pumpkins, garlic and onions

loans.name: Eudelia Mercedes

texts.es:
Eudelia es socia del Banco Comunal Marcela.
Eudelia es casada, tiene 43 años y 3 hijos, Eudelia tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende choclo sancochado con queso, actividad que realiza por las mañanas y tardes con la ayuda de sus hijas. Además tiene un pequeño taller de confección de prendas de vestir.
Eudelia necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de telas variadas.
Los sueños de Eudelia son ampliar su taller y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Eudelia is a member of the Marcela Community Bank. She is a 43-year-old married mother of three. She has a post at the 12th of April Market where she sells boiled corn cobs with queso, which she does in the morning and afternoon with the help of her daughters. Furthermore, she also has a small sewing shop making clothing items. Eudelia is requesting a loan of 600 soles, which she plans to use to purchase various fabrics. Her dreams are to expand her sewing shop and improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase various fabrics

loans.name: Angela De Los Angeles

texts.es: La Señora Ángela de los Ángeles R. Márquez tiene la edad de 57 años, está casada, y no tiene hijos.  La actividad económica es la venta de granos básicos y productos plásticos, y la ubicación de su negocio está en el mercado central. Doña Ángela dio inicio a esta actividad de forma ambulante en las áreas aceras del mercado y algunas veces recorría las calles en busca de clientes. Una vez, un comerciante le comentó que le podría vender su puesto de venta ubicado en el mercado central.  En ese sentido, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para invertir en la compra de más artículos plásticos y granos básicos ya que últimamente sus clientes se han ampliado. Sus sueños son de realizar de su venta una gran distribuidora que ofrezca productos y los distribuya por todo el departamento. Además, a Doña Ángela le gustaría a Dios le regale un poco mas de vida para estar al lado de su esposo, y además seguir trabajando en este negocio.
texts.en:
Ángela de los Ángeles R. Márquez is 57 years old, married, and does not have any children. She sells basic grains and plastic products, and her business is located in the central market. Ángela began this activity as a street vendor in the areas closest to the market and sometimes took to the streets in search of clients. Once, a merchant commented that he would be willing to sell his vending stall located in the central market. In this manner, the loan would be for work capital to invest in the purchase of more plastic articles and basic grains given that lately her clients have increased. Her dream is that her business becomes a major distributor that offers products and distributes them all over her department. Moreover, Ángela would like for God to gift her with a little more life so that she can be at her husband’s side, and continue working in this business.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase of more plastic products and basic grains.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Yuly Evelin

texts.es:
Evelyn es socia del Banco Comunal Marcela.
Evelyn es soltera, tiene 20 años y vive con sus padres, Evelyn vende cosméticos por catalogos que ofrece a amigos y familiares, sus ventas son al crédito. Evelyn estudia sistemas en un instituto y tiene una moto que alquila.
Evelyn necesita un préstamo de 750 soles dinero que será invertido como parte de pago de una mototaxi.
Los sueños de Evelyn son terminar su carrera, trabajar y mantener a sus padres.
texts.en:
Evelyn is a member of the Marcela Community Bank. She is 20 years old, single and lives with her parents. She sells cosmetics via catalog that she offers on credit to friends and relatives. Evelyn studies systems at a local institute and has a motorcycle that she rents. She is requesting a loan of 750 soles, which she plans to use as part of her payment for her motortaxi service. Her dreams are to finish her degree, work and provide for her parents.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Part of payment for her motortaxi

loans.name: Esfuerzate Y Sed Valiente 3 Group

texts.en:
Margalena G. is the bank coordinator for "Esfuerzate y Sed Valiente" (Group 3). The bank operates in San Marcos, a neighborhood a little bit outside of the city of Puerto Plata. Her group is the newest addition to this community bank, bringing their total number to 15 members. These entrepreneurs will undertake a variety of businesses, mostly involving clothing and food sales.

Margalena is 43 years old and is married to a man her own age. They have three grown children and three grandchildren. Margalena is a very active woman and has not delayed in putting time into her business. Most people probably see their business as a mean to achieve something, but Margalena also sees her business as a passion. Over 20 years ago, she started a beauty salon in her own house and in the front of her house she has a small frituria - which means that she fries a variety of foods for sale. About 4 years ago she also started to buy and sell clothes and natural products like medicine and drinks. Sometimes she is so busy with everything she is involved in that her husband and friends help her out. "I simply love to do business," she says.

San Marcos is a poor neighborhood, but the participants in the group think their economy has improved lately and that loans from Esperanza are one important reason for this improvement. It is no wonder that they have chosen Margalena as their coordinator. She is energetic and the one that has the most experience running a business.

With her upcoming loan, Margalena wants to expand her businesses, in particular she wants to sell more clothes. By being responsible with her loan, her businesses, family, group, and neighborhood will have more opportunity to prosper.

loans.use: Expand her fried food business and continue a new business activity: natural products sales

loans.name: Lesbia Azucena

texts.es:
En el municipio de Ciudad Sandino de la ciudad de Managua, la señora Lesbia V. se dedica arduamente a su negocio de venta de comida el cual comercializa muy amablemente en su localidad donde atiende todos los días siendo visitada por sus clientes. 

La razón por la cual ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada con un crédito que le permita la compra de la materia prima para la preparación de los alimentos. Es importante destacar que por medio de este crédito se beneficia grandemente y apoya a su familia que tanto requiere de su apoyo.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Sandino in the city of Managua, Lesbia Villaneuva dedicates herself arduously to her restuarant business that she runs very graciously from her locale where she attends every day to be patronized by her clients.

The reason why she has come to Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) is to acquire a loan that will allow her to purchase ingredients to prepare her foods. It is important emphasize that by means of this loan she will see great benefit in that she supports her family who need her support so much.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients.

loans.name: Mariela De La Concepcion

texts.es: Mariela de la Concepción O. Chacón tiene la edad de 33 años, está casada, y tiene dos hijas. Su hija mayor tiene 16 años y su hija menor tiene 9 años. Los propósitos de Doña Mariela son de mantener el ritmo de ventas para que seguir financiando los estudios de sus hijas a fin de que ellos puedan tener futuros exitosos. La actividad económica de Doña Mariela es la venta de granos básicos, cosméticos, especies, productos de pollo y otros, y está ubicado en el Mercado Terminal de Buses del departamento de León. Doña Mariela desea este financiamiento para capital de trabajo, lo cual quiere mejorar la atención a sus clientes ofreciéndoles diversidad de productos, ampliar su inventario, y aumentarles el salario a sus trabajadores. Su sueño es realizar su propia vivienda en un terreno que compró para dejarles a sus hijas un lugar donde puedan vivir tranquilamente y con todas las comodidades necesarias. Además,  Doña Mariela desea que su familia sea feliz a pesar de las circunstancias y dificultades de la situación económica grave en León y la Nicaragua.
texts.en:
Mariela de la Concepción O. Chacón is 33 years old, married, and has two daughters. Her eldest daughter is 16 years old and her youngest is 9 years old. Mariela’s intention is to maintain the rhythm of her sales to continue financing her daughters’ studies so that they may have successful futures. Mariela sells basic grains, cosmetics, spices, chicken products, and other items, and is located in the Market Terminal of Buses of the department of León. Mariela wants this loan to acquire work capital, given that she wants to improve customer service by offering them variety of products, and will also use this loan to increase her inventory, and raise the salary of her workers. Her dream is to build her own home on a plot of land she bought to leave to her daughters, where they may be able to live in tranquility with all the necessary comforts. Moreover, Mariela wishes that her family be happy despite the circumstances and difficulties of the grave economic situation in León and Nicaragua.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase and diversify her inventory, and raise the salary of her workers.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Edwins

texts.es:
El señor Edwins B. actualmente vive en el municipio de Ciudad Sandino donde se dedica a su actividad de venta de productos de uso domésticos y electrónicos como lo son controles de televisores, antenas y otros artefactos.

Es importante destacar que el señor B. vende ambulantemente todos los días por las calles de Ciudad Sandino y por medio de esta actividad lleva el sustento a su casa de habitación beneficiando a su pequeño hijo. Con el crédito que solicita a Ceprodel se beneficia grandemente porque logra salir adelante en su negocio que tanto requiere de financiamiento.
texts.en:
Edwins B. currently lives in the municipality of Sandino where he is dedicated to his business selling products of cosmetic use and electornics, such as televisions, antennas and other accessories.

It is important to emphasize that B. sells door to door every day on the streets of Sandino, and through his business he provides sustenance for the home, for the benefit of their baby boy. The loan he is requesting from Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) will be of great benefit to him because he can see success in his business that requires such significant financing.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
Ruth es socia del Banco Comunal Pura Vida.
Ruth es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 1 hija, Ruth tiene una tienda en una galería alquilada ubicada en el mercado central de la ciudad de Ayacucho, en donde vende ropa de damas, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima.
Ruth necesita un préstamo de 750 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de sacos y ternos.
Los sueños de Ruth son tener una tienda en la ciudad de Lima, comprar su casa y brindarle todo lo mejor para su hija.
texts.en:
Ruth is a member of the Pure Live Community Bank. She is 28 years old, has one daughter and lives with her partner. Ruth has a women's clothing store in a shopping center located at the central market in the city of Ayacucho. She gets her products from the city of Lima. Ruth is requesting a loan of 750 soles, which she plans to use for the purchase of sports jackets and suits. Her dreams are to have a store in Lima, buy a home and provide the best for her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sports coats and suits

loans.name: Sara Esmirna

texts.es:
La señora Sara S. se dedica a su negocio de pulpería atendido en su casa de habitación donde labora arduamente con el propósito de mantener su hogar brindando buenas condiciones a su familia. 

La razón por la que ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es porque requiere un crédito para la compra de los productos de pulpería. Es por esta razón que ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con dicho crédito y así dar lugar al mejoramiento de su negocio satisfaciendo a sus clientes que tanto requieren de su apoyo.
texts.en:
Sara Sanchez is dedicated to the grocery store she runs from her home, where she works very hard with the goal of maintaining her household and providing her family with proper living conditions.

The reason for engaging Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) is that she requires a loan to purchase grocery store products. For this reason she has engaged Ceprodel to be benefitted by a loan and in this manner bring improvements to her business, to satisfay her clients that require so much of her support.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products.

loans.name: Juana Evangelista

texts.es:
En el municipio de Ciudad Sandino la señora Juana Evangelista se dedica a su negocio de venta de verduras especialmente tomates ofrecidos con mucho entusiasmo en su localidad el cual atiende desde hace 30 largos años habiéndose ganado el aprecio de sus clientes

La razón por la cual ella hoy en día busca el apoyo en Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de los tomates ya que al habérsele agotado requiere nuevamente llenar sus estantes para continuar con este negocio que es de mucho beneficio para ella.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Sandino, Juana Evangelista dedicates herself to the sale of fresh vegetables especially tomatoes that are very popular in her region, where she has been providing service for the past 30 long years, winning over the appreciation of her clients.

The reason why today she is seeking the support of Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) is to be the recipient of a loan to purchase tomatoes, especially now that she has exhuasted her supply and she requires to replenish her stands to continue with her business, being a great benefit to her.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase tomatoes.

loans.name: Gabriela Edith

texts.es:
Gabriela es socia del Banco Comunal Pura Vida.
Gabriela es soltera, tiene 28 años y vive con sus padres, Gabriela junto a su mama tienen un recreo en su casa en donde vende comidas típicas los días sábados y domingos. Además Gabriela es docente y esta trabajando en un jardín en la ciudad. Gabriela piensa implementar un negocio de fotocopias.
Gabriela necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de insumos de fotocopiadora.
Los sueños de Gabriela con tener un multiservicio con todos los servicios, ampliar su recreo.
texts.en:
Gabriela is a member of the Community Bank "Pura Vida".

Gabriela is single, is 28 years old and lives with her parents. Gabriela, together with her Mom, have an area in their house were they sell traditional foods on Saturdays and Sundays. In addition, Grabriela is educated and she works in a public park in the city. Gabriela thinks of setting up her own photocopy shop.

Gabriela requires a loan in the amount of 900 soles, funds that will be invested in the purchase of photocopier accessories. Gabriela's dream is to have a multi-service business supplying all major services, to expand her business.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase photocopier accessories.

loans.name: Hilda Maurina

texts.es:
Hilda es socia del Banco Comunal Pura Vida.
Hilda es conviviente, tiene 48 años y 4 hijos, Hilda tiene un recreo en la casa de su mama en donde vende comida los días domingos. Además Hilda viaja a las ferias en donde compra animales que vende en la feria de San Juan Bautista. Hilda tiene proyectado implementar un multiservicios.
Hilda necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de una fotocopiadora.
Los sueños de Hilda son construir su casa, sus hijos sean profesionales e implementar su multiservicios.
texts.en:
Hilda is a member of the Community Bank "Pura Vida".

Hilda is married common-law, she is 48 years old and she has 4 children. Hilda has a space in her mother's house from where she sells prepared foods on Sundays. In addition, Hilda travels to the fairs where she purchases livestock that she then resells in the San Juan Bautista fair. Hilda has a goal of one day setting up a multi-service shop.

Hilda requests a loan in the amount of 3000 soles, funds that will be invested in the purchase of a photocopier.

Hilda's dreams are to build her own home, to see her children grow up to be professionals and to set up a multi-service shop.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a photocopier.

loans.name: Nydia Carolina

texts.es:
El negocio de venta de prendas requiere de mucha inversión constante por lo que debe de ser suplido constantemente con dichas prendas. La joven Nydia H. se dedica satisfactoriamente a vender estas prendas como lo son cadenas, aretes, pulceras, entre otros y para esto hace uso de los créditos brindados por Ceprodel.

La razón por la cual ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada con un crédito que le permita la compra de dichas prendas para luego ofertarlas en su negocio que tanto requiere de su apoyo para crecer.
texts.en:
The business of selling personal products requires a lot of investment because it must always be well-supplied with such products. Nydia H. successfully sells these products such as chains, earrings, bracelets, among others, and it is for this that she uses her credit from Ceprodel. The reason she has gone to Ceprodel is to benefit from the credit that allows her buy these products and then offer them in her business that requires your support to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Cara Gutterman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of personal products

loans.name: Veronica De La Concepcion

texts.es: Verónica de la Concepción S. M. tiene la edad de 32 años, es soltera, y tiene tres hijos. La actividad económica de Doña Verónica es costura, y ella inició este negocio con gran sacrificio porque ella tuvo que trabajar por mucho tiempo y salvar muchas de las ganancias para comprar una maquina eléctrica lo que le permitía terminar de manera más rápida. Los propósitos de Doña Verónica con este préstamo son de mantener la actividad económica y guardar más ganancias para contratar más empleados. Sus sueños son de obtener un taller amplio en el que pueda proporcionar trabajos a su misma familia.  También a ella le quiere dar la oportunidad a personas que realmente quieren trabajar para sacar a sus familias adelante. En este sentido, a Doña Verónica le gustaría darle mejoras a su vivienda para tener un lugar seguro donde estar con su familia y de esta manera proporcionarle una buena vivienda en donde puedan vivir sus hijas en tiempos futuros.
texts.en:
Verónica de la Concepción S. M. is 32 years old, single, and has 3 children. Doña Verónica owns a business working as a seamstress. She made a great sacrifice because she had to work a lot at the beginning to save money to buy an electric sewing machine that allowed her to complete her work faster. The purpose of this loan is to maintain this work and to save more money in order to hire more employees. She dreams of owning a large factory in which she could offer jobs to her own family. Also, she wants to provide the opportunity to people who wish to work in order to better provide for their families future. In this sense, Doña Verónica would like to make improvements to her home so she can have a safer place for her and her family. This way, she will provide a good household where her children can live in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita V. is 60 years old and a widow. She has 9 children; 5 are already married while the others are single and still studying in college. Her loan could do much in purchasing feed for her pigs.
