This, she believes, could give her enough income. She wants to raise the bar when it comes to business. Now, she is asking CEVI for a loan in the amount of Php 15,000 to grow her business more. Her loan will also help her get started in another line of business. In this way she will have more to offer her children.

Now that she keeps on receiving loans from CEVI, she is developing a positive outlook on life. It's not just the loan that Margarita receives that makes her happy but it is the credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage that CEVI provides for all its clients.

loans.use: To purchase feed for her pigs

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn T. is 30 years old and has only one child. Her husband is a soldier in the Armed Forces of the Philippines and currently assigned in North Cotabato to combat government rebels who inflict trouble on the province. She is into farming and mangoes are her main crop. On a small parcel of land her husband inherited from his parents, they grow mangoes for the future of their children.

Jocelyn is asking a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI to buy fertilizer for her farm. The loan will also be used to pay for her tenants' labor in her mango plantation. Through this loan, she believes she will be able to have a better harvest.

Jocelyn also can take advantage of the insurance and training services as well as the credit assistance that CEVI provides to all its clients.

loans.use: Purchase of  fertilizer

loans.name: Lovelle

texts.en:
Lovelle M. is a pig grower. She started raising hogs in 2004 and she is still in this business because she thinks it is the most profitable business for her. She has 8 piglets and 4 pigs. Aside from that, she is also raising a sow that gives her piglets to sell. The profit that she gets from raising pigs has supported the needs of her children well.

Lovelle is asking for a loan of Php 15,000 to purchase feed for her pigs. Part of her loan will be used to start a new business, selling sardines with door-to-door delivery. She wants to add another sow to have more piglets. She believes that CEVI programs will help her achieve all her dreams.

Lovelle has been a CEVI client for more than 2 years already. Now she enjoys the credit assistance, training and insurance coverage that CEVI provides.

loans.use: Purchase of feed for her pigs

loans.name: Jose Guadalupe

texts.es:
José Guadalupe Ramírez  A.  tiene una casita de madera la cual quiere construir de block. El se encuentra casado y tiene cuatro hijos ellos viven en un terreno que les otorgo su suegro. El quiere darles la mejor comodidad por que dice que su casita es muy fría por que la tiene cubierta de hules y se le trasmina mucho el aire. 
Necesita apoyo para empezar a levantar las paredes de su casa y pagar mano de obra.
texts.en:
Jose Guadalupe R. A. has a small wood house which he wants to rebuild in cement blocks. He is married and has four children. They live on a plot of land that was given to them by his father-in-law. Jose wants to provide his children with a more comfortable environment since his home is very cold because it is covered with oil cloth and the air goes through it. Jose needs help to raise the walls of his home and to pay for the labor.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials and pay for labor.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Mrs. Lilibeth C. is 42 years old. She has 5 children. Three of them are in high school, one is in college and one is at home. Her married life didn’t go well, so when she and her husband decided to separate, her whole family life was affected including her children.

She is into farming. She grows sugarcane and sells it all to some retailers and sugar manufacturing companies. From her harvest, she has been able to provide for the needs of her children. She is asking for a loan from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer. Part of the loan will also be used to start other line of business to augment their income. The loan will enable her to get started in a new business so as to pay the tuition of her children.

Lilibeth now enjoys not only the credit assistance that CEVI provides. She also receives training and insurance coverage by joining CEVI's credit program.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa D. is 55 years old. She has 10 children and two of them are already married. Her husband worked as a government employee. However, because of illness her husband died and left her with all the responsibility for their children. Now, as a widow, she is continuously longing for the love that her husband gave her.

Rosa is a pig grower. She started in 1998 with only 1 sow. From her experience, she realized that she could earn as much as Php 8,000 from 3 piglets that she sells. She is asking for a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy feed for her pigs. She wants to raise more hogs. In this way she can earn more profit from her business. The loan that she will get will also be a big help to let her get started with a new business.

Insurance coverage, training and credit assistance are what Rosa D. enjoys from joining the CEVI credit program.

loans.use: Purchase of feed for her pigs

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es: ANA CECILIA M. D. A., vive en la ciudad D. Soyapango a las afueras D. la capital D. El Salvador, a sus 50 años D. edad vive con su madre, esposo e hijos. Debido a que solo consta con educación media, Ana Cecilia montó una pequeña tienda en su propia casa, en la cual se encarga D. vender productos D. primera necesidad, tales como huevos, sopas, comida enlatada entre otros productos. A pesar que sus ventas son muy buenas, Ana Cecilia necesita aumentar los productos D. su tienda y poder percibir mejores ingresos para suplir todas las necesidades D. su hogar. Debido a que no cuenta con los recursos necesarios, ella solicita un préstamo para poder cumplir su deseo D. incrementar el inventario D. su negocio, percibir más ganancias y poder salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
ANA CECILIA M. D. A., lives in the city of Soyapango, on the outskirts of the capital of El Salvador. At 50 years of age, she lives with her mother, her husband, and children. Thanks to a middle education, Ana Cecilia began a small store in her own home, where she works to sell products of basic necessity, things like eggs and soap, food mixed with other products. Because of this her sales are very good. Ana Cecilia needs to augment the products in her store and to be able to get better income in order to meet all the needs of the household. Since she doesn’t have the necessary resources, she is asking for a loan in order to be able to complete her desire of increasing the inventory in her business, to get more profits and to be able to improve her family’s life.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase inventory in Ana's Store

loans.name: Minerva

texts.en: Minerva B. is a businesswoman who roams the village with her styrofoam box filled with fish, pork, and chicken meat to sell to her co-villagers in Ilagan, Isabela. Her husband who currently works abroad gave her the initial capital. But since Minerva does not want to depend on her husband’s remittances she decided to request a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 to have additional business capital. At the moment, Minerva and her son, Berrick Kyle, who is already 9 years old and currently in grade three, are still living in Minerva's parent’s house since they don’t have their own yet. Minerva hopes that they will have their own house someday, beside her parent’s home.

loans.use: additional business capital

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith D. has 2 children and both of them are married. She is a farmer and loves to grow crops. She likes rice. Every day she works in her farm, feeling the dirt and the heat of the sun for a living. She also sells rice. In 1985, she began her business from a little money that she had saved when she was still young. Until now, she is still in this kind of business. This keeps Judith busy all the time working hard to earn more for her needs as well as her children's needs.

She is asking for a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and other farm inputs. She dreams of having her own land. The loan that she will soon receive will help her earn more to buy land. In this way her children could have a livelihood for their new family.

As a CEVI member, Judith now enjoys the credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage that CEVI gives all its clients.

loans.use: Purchase of farm inputs

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana V., 46, raises piglets for a living. She has 4 children, two are married, and one is in high school while one is at home. Her husband is a rice grower. This helps contribute to their family income.

In 1994, Rosana started her pig business. Until now this keeps her busy all the time because she enjoys taking care of her pigs. Her profit from raising hogs enables her to buy food for the family. CEVI helped her to get stared in her business. Because of her loan, she is able to raise her children well.

She is asking for a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy feed for the pigs. In this way, she can have them grow and sell them at quality prices.

CEVI helps Rosana sustains her pig business. Through credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage that CEVI provides to all its clients like Rosana, more and more are able to grow their businesses.

loans.use: Purchase of feed for her pigs

loans.name: Odeaza

texts.en:
Odeaza F. lives in the remote village of Cabisera 14-16 of Ilagan, Isabela also known as Barangay Casilagan.  She has lived there for almost 20 years with her family. She is 39 years old and is married to Wilson. They have two children: Dexson who is 18 years old and who just ended his second year of high school and Judelyn who is 19 years old, and who is now in the third year of nursing courses at college. Her husband is engaged in rice, corn and vegetable farming while Odeaza maintains their hog raising business. At the same time, she keeps their home clean and orderly. She is happy that they are able to support their simple needs at home but sad because her younger child has no interest in pursuing his high school education. 

To further sustain the feed supply for her three hogs, Odeaza is requesting a loan. It would mean a lot to her because through it, she will be able to support her nursing student and be able to buy farm supplies for their farm.  Odeaza hopes to become successful with the business through the assistance of this lending program, her hard work and patience. She expects to double her income if she can maintain her business well.

loans.use: To buy feed for her hogs

loans.name: Precilla

texts.en:
Precilla P. and her husband are blessed with four children. The two oldest, Romulo, age 28, and Michelle, age 26, both serve as church ministers. The third, Ronalyn, is 24 years old and an education graduate who now teaches. The youngest, Jirha, is 13 years old and is studying as a high school freshman.

Precilla raises hogs and also farms both rice and corn. She has requested a loan of PHP 4,000.00 to support both businesses. Her goal is to expand her hog raising business to maintain her income and support the educational needs of her youngest child. Precilla said she must be strong and work hard in order to achieve her dreams, just like well-known entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To maintain her hog raising and farming businesses

loans.name: Shelby

texts.en:
Shelby lives in the small rural village of Yeban Sur, Benito Soliven, Isabela. She is 39 years old and married to a farmer named Domelio. The couple has three children. Xyrus, who is 15 years old, is in the third year of high school. Xymund is 8 years old and in grade two. The youngest, Rochelle, is 6 years old and still in kindergarten.

Shelby maintains a village store. It has been an important source of income for her family, supporting both their farming needs and the basic needs of the family. Shelby works hard and recognizes that an entrepreneur must have a good attitude in order to maintain her customers.

Shelby is requesting a loan of PHP 4,000.00 to expand her store with additional products, such as candies, soft drinks, breads, and other basic commodities that are in demand. By expanding her business, she hopes to increase her daily income.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell in her store

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia S. wants to request a loan of $125 to use in the repair of her family's passenger tricycle, which her husband drives when he is not busy with his farm. In addition, Sylvia plans to use some of the loan to purchase pigs and sacks of rice, which she and her husband will sell in their neighborhood.

Sylvia wants her family to be always healthy and strong, especially in facing life's difficulties. Of course, she also wants to improve her business so that it will become stable.

Having her happy and loving family, Sylvia seems to be already fulfilled with her life but according to her, nothing is permanent in life. Thus, she must strive harder and look for better opportunities that will improve her family's life. One of these opportunities is to venture into businesses which will guarantee more income opportunities.

At 49, Sylvia is more attentive than when she was younger. She is married to Lucas, who is not only her partner in life but also her business partner. Their children are Reynaldo, who is 29 years old and who did not graduate from college, and Nomar, who is 25 years old and a nursing graduate but who is unemployed due to lack of employment opportunities in the province.

loans.use: To repair passenger vehicle and purchase pigs and sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vicky D. is a vendor in the distant village of Cabisera 14-16 of Ilagan, Isabela. She is married to Angelito D., who maintains their small farm lot and sometimes works as a hired farm laborer in their village. They have a five-year-old daughter named Abegail, who is currently attending a day care center. Her small, happy and organized family serves as Vicky's motivation to work harder in order to attain success.

Vicky runs a smoked fish vending business. She is requesting a loan of $100 to expand this business. She will buy different varieties of vegetables, meats, and snacks at wholesale prices in the public market, which is far from her village. It does not matter to her even when she needs to ride a passenger jeep (which is rarely available) in order to reach the public market because the price there is cheaper. She has to sacrifice for the sake of her family.

From her daily income, Vicky wants to save for the future education of her daughter. Therefore, she is praying that her loan request will somehow be granted in order for her dreams to come true.

loans.use: To expand her fish business with vegetables, meats, and snacks

loans.name: Arnel

texts.en:
Arnel A. is 28 years old and lives in Barangay Lapogan Tumauini, Isabela. He is married to Juanita and they have an eleven-month-old child named Gian Carlo. Arnel works hard in order to support his family. Their source of income is his passenger tricycle.

Arnel is requesting a loan of $150 to maintain his motorcycle. He will also use part of the loan to buy a piglet, which will be raised in their backyard. He hopes to expand his business to improve his family's life. Arnel hopes for his loan request to be granted so he can earn more money and be able to support the educational needs of his children and the basic needs of his family.

loans.use: Maintenance of motorcycle and to buy a piglet

loans.name: Rosa Antonia

texts.es: Rosa Antonia H. R., es una mujer trabajadora la cuál reside en la ciudad de Soyapango en el país de El Salvador.  Ella tiene una pequeña venta de cosméticos, ropa y joyas de fantasía fina, las cuales comercializa de manera ambulante en los alrededores de su municipio.  A pesar de su esfuerzo por mantener su negocio Rosa Antonia solicita un quinto préstamo a integral  debido a que una de sus meta es  poder incrementar su mercadería y de esta manera poder ayudar a su familia, ya que este es su principal medio de vida a través del cuál ha logrado salir adelante, es por ellos que solícita ayuda una vez más y de esta forma cumplir con una meta trazada para bien de ella y su hogar.
texts.en:
Rosa Antonia H. R. is a working woman who lives in the city of Soyapango, in the country of El Salvador. She has a small store of cosmetics, clothing, and costume jewellery, which she sells in open air markets in the areas surrounding her town. Because of her efforts to maintain her business, Rosa Antonia is asking for a fifth loan, which is integral since her goal is to be able to increase her merchandise and by this manner help her family. This is already her principle source of income and through it she has improved their livelihood, and it is for them that she is asking for help one more time and by this manner to complete her stated goal of good for herself and her household.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase inventory in Rosa's store

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
A woman with a positive mind who always believes that in her every breath she must have the guts to go on and continue living no matter how hard and challenging life--this describes Analiza A., who is a 37-year-old mother of two. She is married to Banjo, who is one of the Barangay Councilors in their village. He also operates the family's passenger tricycle. Their children are John Siahm, who is 10 years old and a grade III student, and Atasha, who is 5 years old and a day care student.

According to Analiza, the village where the family lives is progressive because of the different government projects being implemented there, such as a farm-to-market road, an irrigation system, a potable water system, and a post-harvest facility.

Analiza’s family does not own a farm to cultivate, so she wants to make their current source of income more stable and also develop an alternative source of income. In order to do this, she is requesting a loan of $100, which will be used in the maintenance of the passenger motorcycle and for the establishment of a hog and poultry raising business.

Analiza wants to start these projects as soon as possible because she really wants to help her husband in earning money for the education of their children and for the basic needs of their family.

loans.use: Maintenance of passenger motorcycle and starting capital for a hog and poultry raising business

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
In order to help her husband, Visitacion engaged in a vegetable vending business. She has been in this business since 2006 and she still wants to improve it to gain more income.

Therefore, she is requesting a loan of $100 in order to have additional capital. She will buy different varieties of vegetables, meat, and fish to offer to her customers. Aside from retailing vegetables, Visitacion also ventures into selling secondhand ready-to-wear clothes to generate more income so that she may be able to meet all her family's needs.

She is doing her best because she really wants to support the education of her children, who will soon enter college. She prays hard that her loan request will be granted for the sake of her children who are studying well to achieve their ambitions in life.

Visitacion is 39 years old and married to Florendo, who is 45 years old and involved in farming activities. They are blessed with three children: Mark Jeffrey, who is 16 years old and a high school senior; Florendo Jr., who is 12 years old and in the last grade of elementary school; and Claris Jane, who is 9 years old and in grade three.

loans.use: Purchase vegetables, meat and fish to sell

loans.name: Ingrid Guadalupe

texts.es: Ingrid Guadalupe C. D. C., casada y con hijos, resiD. en el municipio D. Soyapango, en el país D. El Salvador, consta con un nivel educativo D. bachillerato, trabaja a diario transportando niños hacia sus colegios y residencias, Ingrid ha logrado crear su propio negocio al cuál llama transporte escolar “C.”, gracias a un préstamo brindado para poder comprar su microbus, préstamo el cuál ha pagado al día. A pesar que es una mujer casada debe trabajar para poder costear los estudios D. sus hijos, ya que su esposo vive en los Estados Unidos hace dos años, actualmente vive con su suegra, a la cuál debe ayudar diariamente con los gastos del hogar. Es por ello que solicita un préstamo, para lograr compra una caja D. velocidades para el microbus, ya que esta se ha deteriorado a lo largo D. los cuatro años D. uso. Por esta razón es necesario para Ingrid acceder a un préstamo y seguir adelante con su negocio.
texts.en:
Ingrid Guadalupe C. D. C. is married and has children. She lives in the town of Soyapango, in the country of El Salvador, and she has a high school diploma. She works daily transporting children to their schools and homes. Ingred has managed to grow her own school transportation business which she calls “C.,” thanks to a supporting loan that allowed her to buy her mini-bus, a loan that today she has repaid. Because she is a married woman, she has to work in order to pay for the studies of her children, since her husband has lived in the United States for the past two years. She currently lives with her in-laws, whom she helps with the daily expenses of the household. This is why she is asking for a loan, in order to be able to buy a box of gears for the mini-bus, which has deteriorated a good deal over four years of use. For this reason it is necessary for Ingrid to take a loan and to continue forward with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy gear for Ingrid's mini-bus

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita T. lives with her family in Barangay Lapogan in Tumauini, Isabela. She is 48 years old and married to a farmer named Eugenio T.. They have five children: Elbino, who is 30 years old but unfortunately wasn't able to finish his college course; Edward, a 28-year-old high school graduate who is now working as a driver; Elizabeth, who is 26 years old, married, a high school graduate, and the only girl among the five children; Ernesto, the fourth child, who is a 23-year-old elementary graduate like the youngest child, Enrico, who is 22 years old. Estelita happily shared that her family is bonded with love and that they live harmoniously.

Estelita wants a loan of $150 to finance their passenger tricycle's daily operation since it is their only daily source of income while they are waiting for the harvest season. Some of the loan will also be used to provide for their needed farming inputs. Their tricycle is being operated alternately by her two sons Ernesto and Enrico.

Estelita is so thankful that her children are very responsible, although they have no interest in pursuing their studies any more. At times, Estelita envies her neighbors whose children were able to finish college and had the chance to seek better jobs, unlike her children, who just settled in their simple life.

Eselita believes in the golden rule, “Don’t do unto others what you do not want others do unto you.” Therefore, Estelita said, she must always be friendly and should maintain her good relationships to her neighbors and fellow men in the village.

loans.use: Finance the daily operation of their passenger tricycle and farming needs

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia S. is 49 years old and married to Leonardo, who is a tricycle operator and also serves as one of the Barangay councilors in their village. The couple works together and they keep on striving for their family. Arsenia also serves as an active leader of a women's organization in their village.

They are blessed with six children: Hazel, a 27-year-old college graduate; Marilou, a 25-year-old college graduate; Cheryl, a 21-year-old college undergraduate; Erwin, an 18-year-old college student; Katrina, a 16-year-old who is still in the fourth year of high school; and Sugar Ray, who is 13 years old and in the first year of high school. The two eldest daughters, Hazel and Marilou, are already married.

Arsenia is requesting a loan of $150 for her village store business. The loan will be used to improve her store to sustain their daily living and continue sending her children to school until they finish college.

Arsenia wants to become a successful entrepreneur and be a role model to other small entrepreneurs in their village. Arsenia said that her dream will come true by treasuring time because it is as precious as gold--it is the most important factor in any kind of business. She knows that she needs to work hard and learn to spend less.

loans.use: Improvement of her store

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion B. is a vinegar and soy sauce manufacturer in the village of Barangay Lapogan Tumauini, Isabela. This is a business initiated by her daughter, who has just gotten married. She continues the business to earn additional income aside from farming to sustain her family's needs.

Concepcion is 55 years old and married to Juanito Basili, a farmer who was formerly a community councilor. They have six children: Nick is 35 years old, married, and a high school graduate; Nedy is 31 years old, married, and a college graduate; Novie is 30 years old, also married, and a computer engineering graduate; Nomar is 27 years old and a college graduate too; Nida is 25 years old and the only one who did not finish college; and the youngest, Norie Ann, is 21 years old and in the fourth year of college.

Concepcion is proud that their children are now enjoying a good life despite the hardships the family has encountered, especially during the time when all her children were still studying. Concepcion is not selfish so she did not prevent her children from marrying, reasoning that they are educated enough to decide what they need to do or not do.

Now, Concepcion still strives to support her youngest child in finishing her last year in college. She hopes to increase her daily income from her vinegar and soy sauce manufacturing and vending business in order to sustain their family's needs. Thus, she hopes to get a loan of $150, which will serve as her additional capital. She also wishes to attend trainings in the future to improve her business. These include product development, packaging and labeling, since she is not using any business name yet.

loans.use: Expand her vinegar and soy sauce manufacturing and vending business

loans.name: Josefa Noemy

texts.es: Josefa Noemy R. D. M., es una mujer casada D. 32 años D. edad y con un pequeño hijo, resiD. en Cojutepeque departamento D. Cuscatlan, en El Salvador;  tiene más D. ocho años D. poseer su propio salón D. belleza, a través del cuál logra contribuir con los gastos del hogar, debido a que su esposo venD. CD´S y juguetes en una tienda y dichas ganancias no logran a cubrir los gastos del hogar, Josefa trabaja arduamente con el deseo D. sacar adelante a su pequeño hijo. Josefa solícita un préstamo, para poder incrementar nuevos productos D. belleza, y poder incluir al negocio juguetes, perfumería y ropa, con el fin D. poder percibir mejores ingresos para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Josefa Noemy R. D. M. is a married woman of 32 years of age. She has a small son, and lives in Cojutepeque in the department of Cuscatlan, in El Salvador. She has worked for more than eight years in her own beauty salon, and because of this she is able to contribute to the expenses of the household, since her husband sells CDs and toys in a store and those profits aren’t enough to cover the expenses of the household. Josefa works arduously with the desire of improving the life of her small son. Josefa is asking for a loan in order to get new beauty products, and to be able to incluD. in the business toys, perfume, and clothing, with the goal of being able to get a better income for herself and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products and increase inventory in Josefa's shop

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Shalala

texts.en: Shalala was born in 1979. She is single and lives in Khachmaz town. Four years ago, she started her business. Now she is requesting a loan to buy flour, granulated sugar and the necessary ingredients for baking tasty sweets.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar and the other ingredients for baking sweets

loans.name: Ana Leticia

texts.es: Ana Leticia G. P., tiene 26 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene cuatro hijos menores de edad. Reside en Cojutepeque departamento de Cuscatlan en El Salvador. Ella tiene como actividad en su trabajo engordar pollos para venderlos en sus 4 galeras  las cuales poseen toda la infraestructura necesaria para este tipo de trabajo. Ana Leticia esta realizando su segundo préstamo a integral y es miembro de la categoría “A” por pagar sus crédito a tiempo. La razón por la cuál solícita este segundo préstamo, es para poder comprar mas concentrado para alimentar a los pollos y de esta misma forma poder comprar otros insumos para dicha actividad. Puesto que ella y su pareja son los únicos que trabajan para poder mantener las necesidades básicas como alimentación y estudios de su familia, necesitan nuevos ingresos para su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana Leticia G. P. is 26 years old. She has a partner and she has four underage children. She lives in Cojutepeque, department of Cuscatlan, in El Salvador. She has a good activity in her work, fattening chickens in order to sell them in the four wagons that she has that have all the infrastructure needed for this sort of work. Ana Leticia is asking for her second, integral loan, and is a member of the category “A” for repaying her credit on time. The reason for asking for this second loan is to be able to buy more concentrate to feed her chickens and in this manner be able to buy other ingredients for her activity. She and her partner are the only people who work to be able to supply the basic necessity like food and education for her family; they need new income for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy concentrate and other ingredients for chicken feed

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Adela Edith

texts.es: Adela Edith R. O., reside en Cojutepeque en el país de El salvador junto a su esposo y sus dos padres de avanzada edad. Poseen una tienda llamada “Milagro”, la cuál esta ubicada en su misma casa y a través de esta se encarga de vender enseres de primera necesidad, la cuál contribuye a costear los gastos del hogar, tales como alimentación y vivienda, como también necesidades básicas de dos personas adultas mayores. Adela se ha dedicado a su tienda durante 10 años y su mayor deseo es obtener un préstamo para poder obtener el capital necesario para comprar mercadería a precio de mayoreo y poder venderla al por menor y obtener una ganancia merecida, a través de la cuál lograra ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Adela Edith R. O. lives in Cojutepeque in the country of El Salvador, along with her husband and her two parents of advanced age. They have a store called “Milagro” (“Miracle”), which is located in her house and due to this work selling belongings of basic necessity; she contributes to paying the expenses of the home, things like food and livelihood, and also the basic necessities of two grown up people. Adela has worked in her store for 10 years and her greatest desire is to obtain a loan in order to be able to obtain the capital necessary to buy merchandise at a better price and to be able to sell it for less and obtain a better income, through which she would be able to help her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To obtain the capital to buy products at a better price

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Vahid

texts.en: Vahid was born in 1964. He is married and lives in the Khachmaz region, in the village of Galagan. Seven years ago, he started his business. Now he is requesting a loan to expand his car-washing facility.

loans.use: To expand his car-washing facility

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie B. lives in Barangay Lapogan, Tumuini, Isabela.  The village is located between the boundary of Ilagan and Tumauini, Isabela.  She is already 42 years old and married to Apolinario, a baker.  They are living with their only son Jay–Pee who is now 20 years old and a graduate of automotive course.  Their eldest daughter died of leukemia. The village where they live is an Agrarian Reform Community where main sources of income come from rice and corn farming. 

She is hoping that she will be able to avail a loan amounting to PhP4,000 for her direct selling business. Elvie is a selling agent for Avon and Natasha cosmetic products outlet in the town center, where she purchases the orders of her costumers from their village. She is earns income on commission basis at 25% for every PHP100 sales. She hopes to increase her business capital and income especially that she expect peak sales this coming month because it is harvest season for corn in their village.  She and her husband do not have other sources of income but she is still thankful that through their income they were able to send their son to school and finish a vocational course.  

Elvie intends to do her best to prosper her business and save some of her income for emergencies.

loans.use: Additional Capital for her direct selling business

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
The sacrifices of this mother for her children should be admired by everyone. Helen said that life is hard but still she endured all the trials she faced for her children's sake.  

Helen B. came from a distant place of Visayas - central Philippines. She came to live in Isabela particularly at Barangay Lapogan Tumauini, Isabela by chance. She is already 32 years old married to Nick.  They have two children Nicole – 4 years old and Nick Jr. – 3 years old. 

Helen runs a village store business in their community. She wants to improve the business to support her children’s future education. Helen wanted to request a loan amounting to PhP5,000 for additional business capital. Helen said that she ought to work hard and be patient to support her family. She even engaged herself in buy and sell of empty cans and bottles including any recyclables materials before she established her village store. Helen promised that the amount that she will borrow will be utilized solely for her business since her children are not yet studying. She hopes to become successful in the future and prays for her husband to change.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma Ramadhani is a Tanzanian micro-entrepreneur business man. For 5 years, he has run a butcher shop at Buguruni Ward in Dar es Salaam. He receives a meat order from the meat suppliers, who purchase directly from the slaughtering center at Vingunguti in Dar es Salaam.

The butchery business is profitable due to high demand of meat for domestic purposes. He requests a loan of $925 (1,200,000 TZS) to purchase more meat to increase his business.

loans.use: Purchase more meat to sell in the butcher shop

loans.name: Salomen Ambe

texts.en:
Salomen, born May 26, 1951 is happily married to Ambe Valentine and they have been blessed with 7 children, 4 of them below 15 years of age. Salomen came to know about GHAPE in the year 2003 after encountering some challenges in life such as ill health, death of relatives, and poverty. In order to overcome these challenges, Salomen received her first loan in the year she came to know of GHAPE in the amount of 20,000 frs; she received a loan of 60,000 frs in the year 2004, 80,000 frs in the year 2005, and 150,000 frs in the year 2007. The repayment of the various loans was done promptly.

Given her present loan, she plans to rent a plot for cultivation for 100,000 frs; 50,000 frs will be used for the purchase of seeds, and 50,000 frs will be used for the purchase of fertilizer. She will commence repayment on the fourth month from the day of disbursement. This business will help her community by providing food for them, and many of them will buy from her. With the profit from the loan, she plans to give sound education to her children, complete her house, and bring her daughter who has been sick for a long period of time to the hospital. She prefers to receive a loan from GHAPE because of the social training GHAPE offers, and the issue of collateral security is not a problem.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Renting farmland for cultivation of crops

loans.name: Mwanamvua

texts.en: Mwamvua F. runs a jewelry shop at Buguruni in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. She purchases the gold and silver materials from the Kariakoo shops.Then she creates designs in different shapes, according to the customers' orders, for example, gold rings or chains. She is requesting a loan of $775 (1,000,000 TZS) to purchase more materials to make jewelry.

loans.use: Buy more gold and silver to make more jewelry

loans.name: Fikake

texts.en:
E. is married to Fanka Gabriel and they have 4 children all below 15 years of age. E. is living with her entire family in a house of 3 sleeping rooms and one sitting room. E. has faced so many challenges in life such as the death of her parents, school dropout and family problems. These problems made life unpleasant to E. until the year 2006 in which she came to the knowledge of GHAPE and became a member. E. obtained her first loan from GHAPE in the year 2006, which was 20,000 FRS, and received 150,000 FRS in the year 2008; the repayments were made promptly.

With a loan of 250,000 FRS, E. plans to buy more yams for 100,000 FRS, plantain and cocoyam for 100,000 FRS, and fruits and vegetables like pineapples, carrots, and bananas for 50,000 FRS.

E. greatly believes the business will progress because of the experience she has had in the business and the high demand for her goods. With this business, E. helps her community by supplying food to them, reducing their need to travel to the market and even increasing the economic status of her community. She plans to use the profit from the loan to pay for her children's school fees and to feed and clothe her children. Her repayments will commence in the fourth month from the day of disbursement.

She prefers to receive loans from GHAPE because of the training GHAPE offers before disbursing loans, the proper follow up that is done when the loan is repaid, and the comfortable method of repayments.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Buying and selling of yams, plantain, cocoyam, and fruits.

loans.name: Humay

texts.en: Humay (her husband is pictured) is 38 years old. She lives in Khachmaz town. This family has 2 children. Her husband has been in business for 3 years. Now, they need a loan of 950 AZN to buy a new door and spare parts for their bus.

loans.use: To buy a new door and spare parts for their bus

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima K. sells cereals and other groceries at Mnyamani ward at Buguruni in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. She purchases the items from the Kariakoo city market and Buguruni market. Sometimes she buys items directly from the producers. She mostly sells wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, cashew nuts, and ground nuts.

Halima K. uses the income from the shop to feed the family and purchase goods to sell. She is requesting a loan of $925 (1,200,000 TZS) to buy more goods to sell.

loans.use: Purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Shahin

texts.en: Shahin is single. He lives in Khachmaz town. He is 40 years old. Two years ago he started selling salt and fodder for cattle. His minimum net profit is 500 AZN (Azerbaijani Manat) per month. Now he needs a loan of 950 AZN to buy salt and fodder for cattle.

loans.use: To buy salt and fodder for cattle

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna M. runs a business selling traditional clothing (batick) at Tungi in Kigamboni, Dar es Salaam. She is a married woman with four school-aged children. She purchases the materials and prepares the clothing herself. She purchases the different colored cloth from the Kariakoo market. Many Tanzanian women wear batick with different designs.

Anna M. is requesting a loan of $925 (1,200,000 TZA) to purchase more cloth to expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase more cloth to prepare batick to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married to Gideon M. and they are blessed with seven children, none of them below 15 years of age. Mary is living in a house with 6 sleeping rooms and one sitting room with her entire family. Mary has been a very hard-working woman during her whole life just to sustain her family. In the cause of hard work, Mary encountered some challenges in life such as the death of her son, of other relatives, and poor health. These challenges made life miserable for Mary until the year 2007 when she discovered GHAPE as a source of relief and became a member.

In that same year of 2007, Mary received her pioneer loan of 40,000 FRS CFA and the repayment was made promptly. If she receives this loan, she plans to rent farmland for cultivation for 50,000 FRS, purchase seedlings, manure, fertilizer for 75,000 FRS, and 25,000FRS will be used to hire laborers to work in the farm. Mary is convinced the business will progress because of the experience she has had in farm work. Furthermore, she is commonly known in her locality as a main supplier of these goods, and she is considered trustworthy by the members of her community.

The farm work that Mary does will help her community by reducing their distance to the market in order to buy what she is supplying. Mary plans to use the profit from her loan to pay her children's school fees, feed them, and to take of their medical fees if they are sick and taken to the hospital. Mary prefers to receive a loan from GHAPE because of the trust she has in GHAPE; the method of repayment is comfortable and convenient.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase of seedlings, clear farmland, etc.

loans.name: Mwanahamis

texts.en: Mwanahamis M. runs a shop at Kigamboni Ward in Dar es Salaam, Tanzanian. She sells a variety of items in her shop. Some items she purchases from Kariakoo city market, and others she purchases directly from the producers. She has been running the business for 4 years. Her business plan is to run a wholesale shop, but she lacks the funds to do this. She is requesting a loan of $475 (600,000 TZS) to purchase more items to sell.

loans.use: Purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Yashar

texts.en:
Yashar lives in Khachmaz town. He has run a taxi business for 5 years. His minimum net profit is 300 AZN (Azerbaijani Manat) per month. Now he needs a loan of 950 AZN to buy spare parts, 4 wheels, and paint, and to fix the engine. He is 32 years old.

Yashar's future plans: After repairing and painting this car, he would like to sell this car and buy a new car to increase the number of his clients.

loans.use: To paint this car, to buy spare parts and 4 wheels, and to fix the engine

loans.name: Violeth

texts.en:
Violeth W. M. runs a shop and a café at Kigamboni, in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. She sells a variety of food, including beans, maize flour, wheat flour, ground nuts, and cashew nuts. She sometimes purchases these products at the Kariakoo city market, and sometimes directly from the producers.

She plans to runs a wholesale shop, but has limited funds. She requests a loan of $1075 (1,400,000 TZS) to purchase more items to meet her customers' demands.

loans.use: Purchase more food items to sell

loans.name: Pili

texts.en: Pili M. runs a beautiful salon at Vingunguti ward in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. She has the most clients over the weekend, from Thursday to Sunday, when most of the women are cerebrating the weekend. Dar es Salaam is hot, so  the salon is a very good business because there is a great demand for this service. Pili M. purchases the supplies for the salon from the big shops in Kariakoo. She is requesting a loan of $775 (1,000,000 TZS) to buy hair dryers.

loans.use: Buy hair dryers for the salon

loans.name: Vugar

texts.en:
Vugar is 25 years old. This man is single. He lives in Khachmaz town. He has run this business for 2 years. This young man not only sells phones and phone accessories, he also repairs phones. His minimum net profit is 600 AZN per month. Now he needs a loan of 950 AZN to buy more phones and phone accessories.

Vugar's future plans: He would like to sell all types of phones and phone accessories. He dreams of studying at the university. He plans to study after improving his business and getting more income.

loans.use: to buy phones and phone accessories

loans.name: Savera

texts.en: Savera M. has a business selling newspapers and mobile phone air time at Mnyamani Street at Buguruni in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. She is an agent of newspaper companies and sells to customers. Also, she purchases the mobile phones from the wholesale shop and sells them retail to customers. Her family depends on the income from her business to meet their daily needs. She requests a loan of  $625 (800,000 TZS) to purchase items for the business.

loans.use: Purchase more newspapers, mobile airtime minutes, and mobile phones to sell

loans.name: Zalubia

texts.en: Zalubia O. M. runs a business selling traditional clothes (vitenge and kanga). She purchases the clothes from Mnazi Mmoja traditional clothes shopping center and resells the clothes to customers. She has run the business for 4 years. She is requesting a loan of $625 (800,000 TZS) to expand the business.

loans.use: Purchase more traditional clothing to sell

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel F., born in 1963, is married and blessed with four children. He has been a hard-working boy from childhood when he got a job. This job was very short since he was sacked from the job without any fault of his. He also lost his brother who usually supported him in paying school fees and the basic needs of the family. With these drawbacks in life, poverty set in as he now was really unable to maintain the living standards of the family. He then moved to a little two-room house. The school for the children was changed which made them trek very long distances as they even became sick and expenses grew. Faced with these difficulties, his luck changed when his friend introduced him to GHAPE in 2008 were he got his first loan of 400,000 frs which he finished paying back. He is now asking for a loan which he will use to purchase newspapers, firewood, and piglets.

He knows the business will succeed since his community is in need of firewood for cooking and also the pigs will provide pork and the pig manure will be used to improve land to farm food crops and vegetables to the community.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase of firewood, newspapers and piglets

loans.name: Babak

texts.en:
Babak lives in Khachmaz town. He is 32 years old. He has been in this business for 2 years. His minimum net profit is 400 AZN. Now he needs a loan of 950 AZN to buy a lot of types of sweets.

Babak's future plans: He would like to increase the sorts of sweets he has for sale and after getting more income, he would like to build a bakery.

loans.use: to buy a  lot of types of sweets

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena Matemba runs a grocery shop at Mbagala in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. She is an entrepreneur business woman with three school-aged children. She has been running the business for 3 years. She sells a variety of items, including wheat flour, maize flour, ground nuts, cashew nuts, and sugar.

Income derived from the business is used to meet her family's daily needs and pay school fees. She requests a loan of $625 (800,000 TZS) to purchase more items to sell.

loans.use: Purchase more groceries to sell in the shop

loans.name: Josehina

texts.en:
Josephina T. runs a café and sells traditional clothing at Mbagala ward in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. She purchases the traditional clothes (vitenge and kanga) at the Mnazi Mmoja shopping center and sells them to customers at Mbagala.

Her business plan is to run a whole shop of traditional clothes. She requests a loan of $625 (800,000 TZS) to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.use: Purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher was married but his wife recently died, leaving behind six children, of whom three are below 15 years of age. Being a hard-working man, he has faced some challenges in life such as ill health, poverty and the death of his wife.

These problems made life difficult for him until the year 2006 in which he came to know of GHAPE and enrolled himself. In that same year, Christopher received his fist loan of 20,000 FRS; he received a loan of 35,000 in the year 2007, and 100,000 FRS in the year 2008. Christopher was able to make all repayments of his previous loans promptly.

Given this loan, he plans to buy vegetable seeds, a sprayer, and insecticide for the vegetable. This business will help the community by providing fresh vegetables for them. Christopher plans to use the profit from the loan to pay his children's school fees and give them good food. He will start repayment on the fourth month from the day of disbursement. Christopher prefers to receive a loan from GHAPE because the method of repayment is comfortable and convenient.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase of vegetable seeds and insecticide

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en: Sabina K. runs a business of selling charcoal at Mbagala ward in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. She purchases the bags of charcoal directly from producers and sells it to retail to her customers. She employs two workers who help her run the business. She also runs a café at Mbagala. She is requesting a loan of $475 (600,000 TZS) to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.use: Buy more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: José Santos

texts.es: José Santos B. F., reside en Cojutepeque, departamento de Cuscatlán, en El Salvador, vive con su esposa, su pequeña hija de 10 meses de edad y su bisabuela de 68 años de edad, la cuál trabaja en una pequeña tienda. José Santos, es un hombre trabajador que tiene como visión brindarle un mejor estilo de vida a su familia y poder ofrecerle un mejor futuro a su pequeña hija. Por ello desea obtener un nuevo préstamo por parte de integral, ya que con anterioridad había obtenido otros préstamos los cuales logro pagar al día. Dicha solicitud la realiza con la esperanza de poder comprar productos para el cabello y las uñas y poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y lograr sacar adelante su negocio y así percibir mejores ganancias que contribuyan a suplir las necesidades de su familia.
texts.en:
José Santos B. F. lives in Cojutepeque, in the Cuscatlán province of El Salvador. José Santos lives with his wife and their young daughter, who is only 10 months old. They also live with José Santos' great grandmother, who is 68 years old and works in a small store. José Santos is a hard-working man who has a vision of providing a better lifestyle for his family. He'd also like to offer a better future for his young daughter. Because of this, José Santos would like to take out a new loan as part of a comprehensive lending plan. José Santos has loaned in the past and has always made payments on time. He asks for this loan with the hope that he can buy hair and nail products in order to provide better service to his clients. In this way his business will get ahead and he'll earn more money to satisfy his family's needs.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy new hair and nail products

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: Doña Maria tiene 46 años de edad, habita en Villa libertad, con dos hijos de 19 y 24 años de edad, el mayor es independiente y el otro estudia, su esposo se desempeña como operario de maquina en  una de las empresas de zona franca. La sra. Maria vende ropa, zapatos y refrescos, negocio que inicio con una liquidación de su trabajo anterior, con esta solicitud que esta haciendo es para invertir en inventario en la compra de ropa y zapatos para ofertar a su clientela. Vende al contado y al crédito quincenal, para ella es de mucho beneficio este préstamo que le otorga Afodenic para mantener su negocio. Sus planes es poder hacer crecer su inventario para poder poder ayudar a su hijo a terminar los estudios para que sea un profesional
texts.en:
Doña Maria is 46 years old and lives in Villa libertad with her two sons. Her 24 year old son is fianncially independent, and her 19 year old is in school. Maria's husband works as a machine operator at a company in the industrial park. Maria sells clothing, shoes, and soft drinks. She started this business with the liquidation of her former job. This loan will be used to invest in inventory, including clothes and shoes to sell to her clients. Maria sells on credit and layaway, and because of this a loan from Afodenic is very beneficial and will keep her business running. She plans to expand her inventory in order to help her son finish school so that he can be a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes and shoes

loans.name: Glenda Elyzabeth

texts.es: La sra. Glenda es una mujer que con mucha dedicación ha logrado establecer su negocio de venta de ropa y cosméticos, el cual inicio con ayuda de su esposo y su mama que ha sido para ella una madre emprendedora. Doña Glenda tiene 32 años de edad,  reside en villa reconciliación, con dos hermosos hijos de 7 y 10 años de edad, ellos están cursando la primaria en el colegio del barrio, su esposo trabaja en un taxi que tiene. Con este crédito es su quinta solicitud en Afodenic que ha sido de mucho beneficio para mantener su negocio, con esta solicitud del préstamo va a invertir en ropa variada de adulto y niños para surtir el inventario y poder atraer mas clientes. Sus planes a corto plazo es poder mejorar la infraestructura de su casa.
texts.en:
Glenda is an extremely dedicated woman who has established a clothing and cosmetic sales business. She started this business with the help of her husband and her mother, who has been very hard-working. Glenda is 32 years old and lives in villa reconciliación with her two beautiful children. They are 7 and 10 years old, and both children attend the local primary school. Glenda's husband works as a taxi driver and owns his car. This loan is Glenda's fifth with Afodenic, and all of her loans have been very beneficial for her business. With his loan Glenda will invest in a variety of clothing for adults and children, in order to increase her inventory and attract more customers. Her short-term plans are to improve the infrastructure of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: El Sra.: Antonia tiene 40 años de edad, habita en Rene Cisneros en la capital de Managua, tiene un hijo de 19 años de edad, es madre soltera lo cual tiene que sobresalir para apoyar a su hijo su negocio es la venta de palomitas, algodones, papas fritas y refrescos, desde hace seis años esta en las ventas, que inicio con fondos propios y con poca mercadería, ella desea invertir en materia prima para elaborar los productos que vende para esto esta solicitando solicitud en Afodenic que será para ella de gran beneficio para seguir adelante con sus ventas de ricos y baratos dulces que día día sale a vender. Sus planes es seguir fortaleciendo su negocio invirtiendo en materia prima, su anhelo es poder tener su propia casa ya que habita en casa de sus padres.
texts.en:
Antonia is 40 years old and lives in the Rene Cisneros neighborhood, in the capital city of Managua. She is the single mother of a 19 year old, and works hard to support her son. Antonia sells popcorn, cotton candy, french fries, and soft drinks. She's been in sales for six years, having started out with her own money and a little bit of merchandise. Antonia hopes to invest in prime materials, which she'll use to make the products that she sells. She is asking for a loan with Afodenic for this purpose. The loan will help her boost her daily sales of the delicious and cheap sweets. Antonia plans to continue strengthening her business by investing in prime materials, and she hopes to have her own home one day, as she currently lives in her parents' house.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various products to make cotton candy

loans.name: Armida

texts.es: Armida A. D. P., es una señora D. 47 años D. edad, la cuál trabaja D. manera ambulante para poder comercializar sus productos tales como licras, shorts y todo lo relacionado con ropa interior. Ella trabaja diariamente para poder costear la alimentación y estudios D. su hijo D. 17 años D. edad y su nieto D. 7 años, los cuales depenD. únicamente D. lo que ella logra obtener D. sus ganancias. Ya que Armida es la única fuente D. ingresos para su familia, ella solicita un préstamo y D. esta manera, poder aumentar su mercadería y variedad D. productos, D. modo que pueda obtener mayores ganancias durante la temporada seca, debido a que en la temporada lluviosa se le dificulta poder salir a las calles y vender sus productos, es por ellos que su deseo más granD. es ampliar su negocio y percibir mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Armida A. D. P. is 47 years old. She works in traveling sales, selling all types of undergarments. Armida works every day in order to earn enough to cover the food and school fees for her 17 year old son and her 7 year old grandson, who depend on her earnings. Armida is the only source of income for her family, and she is asking for a loan to increase her merchandise and expand the variety of her products. In this way she'll be able to obtain better earnings during the dry season, because during the rainy season it is difficult for her to travel the streets. Armida would like to expand her business and increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire more and newer merchandise.

location.town: Ciudad Delgado en el departamento de San  Salvador

loans.name: Cecilia Del Carmen

texts.es: Cecilia del Carmen M. tiene 39 años de edad, es acompañada y junto a sus tres hijos menores de edad reside en el municipio de Apopa, departamento de San salvador. Cecilia posee un puesto de verduras y frutas frescas, el cuál contribuye con los gastos del hogar, sobre todo le ayuda a poder pagar el alquiler de su casa, ya que no posee casa propia. Uno de sus mayores sueños es poder obtener más capital y aumentar la variedad de frutas y verduras, de manera que en un futuro pueda comprar una casa propia para ella y su familia. Es por ello que solicita un préstamo, el cuál contribuya a mejorar su negocio y de esta manera también mejorar su economía familiar.
texts.en:
Cecilia del Carmen M. is 39 years old, she has a partner, and she and her three young children live in the town of Apoga, in San Salvador. Cecilia has a fresh fruit and vegetable stand, with which she helps with the household expenses. Above all it helps her to pay the rent for her house, since she doesn’t have her own house. One of her biggest dreams is to be able to obtain more capital and increase the variety of fruits and vegetables she offers, so that in the future she can buy her own house for her and her family. Because of this, she is requesting a loan, which will be used to improve her business and, in this way, will also improve her family’s finances.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the number of fruits and vegetables in her business

location.town: Apopa en el departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Silvio Tomas

texts.es: Don Silvio tiene 39 años de edad, reside en el barrio 380 en la cuidad de Managua, su esposa le tiene dos hijos que cursan la primaria, ella es ama de casa, el sr. Silvio se desempeña como cadete de taxi, desde hace seis años, el inicio trabajando de cadete y ganaba por día , con sus ahorro compro un taxi propio que le genera mas ganancias para su familia y para dar mantenimiento a su vehiculo, con la solicitud de préstamo la quiere para comprar repuestos de su carro para dar mejor servicios  a sus clientes, sus planes es poder mejorar su casa como cambiar su unidad de taxi.
texts.en:
Silvio is 39 years old and lives in the 380 neighborhood of Managua. He and his wife have two children, who are in primary school. His wife is a homemaker and Silvio is a taxi driver. He started in the taxi business six years ago, earning his salary by the day. With his savings he bought his own taxi and now he earns more, covering his family's expenses and maintenance on the vehicle. Silvio would like a loan to buy replacement parts for his car in order to provide better service to his customers. He plans to improve his house and to upgrade his taxi.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy replacement parts for maintenance work on his taxi

loans.name: Elena Marisol

texts.es: Elena Marisol G. D. C., resiD. en el municipio D. Apopa en el departamento D. San Salvador, a sus 39 años D. edad debe trabajar en su pequeño negocio el cuál es una pequeña tienda en la que venD. golosinas algunas frutas  verduras, jabón y otros enseres del hogar. D. esta manera ella se gana la vida y contribuye junto a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ya que este se ve obligado a viajar periódicamente hacia los Estados Unidos para poder incrementar los ingresos del hogar. Elena solicita un préstamo con el fin D. poder abastecer con más productos su tienda y aprovechar al máximo sus ganancias y poder invertirlas en el desarrollo D. sus dos pequeños hijos, sobre todo en el tiempo que su esposo esta fuera del país.
texts.en:
Elena Marisol G. D. C. lives in the Apopa municipality in the San Salvador department. At her 39 years of age she works in her small business selling candies, fruits and vegetables, soap and other household products. She makes a living in this manner and contributes, along with her husband, to the household expenses as her husband is obligated to travel to the United States periodically to increase their income. Elena is requesting a loan in order to stock her store with products which will allow her to make the most of her earnings so that she can invest in the development of her two small children especially during the time when her husband is out of the country.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock more products for her store.

location.town: Apopa en el departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: José Juan

texts.es: El señor José Juan M. está muy agradecido por su gran apoyo que le brindaron en su anterior préstamo. Él solicita de nuevo su cooperación para la comprar de refacciones que necesita su taller de automotriz  ya que sus clientes le están pidiendo que el se encargué de comprar las piezas, y desea invertir en su negocio y así tener mas ganancias para su familia.
texts.en:
Jose Juan Martinez is very grateful for the support that was provided to him with his last loan. He is again asking for your cooperation in order to purchase parts that he needs for his auto shop as his clients are asking him to purchase the parts. Jose Juan wants to invest in his business in order to obtain greater income for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase auto parts.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.es:
El señor Abraham R. y su esposa la señora Perfecta Alemán tiene una hermosa familia que son dos hijos ya mayores de edad. Con un crédito anterior de FVP adquirió su vivienda, el cual pago puntual mente.
Don Abraham necesita realizarse unos estudios médicos pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder pagar los estudios clínicos que necesita.  
Por el momento entres su esposa la señora Perfecta y sus hijos se están haciendo cargo de los gastos familiares y quienes lo van a poyote para esté crédito.
texts.en:
Abraham R. and his wife Perfecta Aleman have a beautiful family - they have two older children. With a prior loan from FVP, which he paid on time, he was able to acquire his home. Abraham needs to have some medical exams but does not have the necessary money to pay for the exams she needs. Currently, his wife Perfecta and his children are taking care of the household expenses. They will support him with this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Medical expenses.

loans.name: San Juana Milagros

texts.es:
La señora San Juana Milagros acaba de adquirir su vivienda por medio de un crédito gubernamental, pero le esta haciendo falta las protecciones de las ventanas y puertas también algunos acabados del interior de la casa.
 Doña San Juana no cuenta con el capital necesario para poder realizar la mejora, para poder habitar la vivienda. Entre la señora San Juana y su esposo el señor Juan José planean pagar el préstamo con los ingresos de su trabaja como chofer de camión de carga.
(En la foto no aparece la señora San Juana sino su esposo Don Juan José).
texts.en:
San Juana Milagros has just acquired her home through a government loan but her home lacks the protection of windows and doors as well as some interior finishes. San Juana does not have the necessary capital to make these improvements in order to occupy her home. San Juana and her husband Juan Jose plan on paying this loan with the income her makes as a truck driver. (Juan Jose appears in the picture - San Juana is not pictured).

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase windows and doors and some interior finishes for her home.

loans.name: Maritza Lorena

texts.es:
Doña Maritza Lorena  G. D. Hernández  resiD. desD. hace once años el municipio D. Soyapango,  ella se dedica a la venta D. útiles escolares y  D. otros productos, su tienda esta ubicada frente a un centro escolar,  punto estratégico para el comercio D. papelería, cuadernos, libretas y todo lo que demandan los alumnos al inicio del año escolar,  y  durante el resto del año para hacer sus tareas.  

Doña Maritza tiene experiencia crediticia que la califica como buen pagador, por diez años  a manejado  exitosamente su  negocio.  Ella desea aprovechar esta época,  ya que es la idónea en el regreso a clases, por lo que solicita a integral un crédito  para  tener variedad D. artículos escolares.  Y D. esta forma aumentar sus ganancias y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Maritza Lorena G. D. Hernandez has lived in the municipality of Soyapango for eleven years. She dedicates herself to the sale of school supplies and other products. Her store is located across the street from a school - a strategic location for the sale of paper, notebooks and everything else that is in demand by students at the start of the school year and during the rest of the year. Maritza has credit experience which shows she is good at repaying her loans. For ten years she has successfully managed her business. She wants to take advantage of this time as it coincides with the return to classes. This is why she is asking for a loan in order to have a variety of school supplies in stock. This will allow her to increase her income and be able to help her husband with the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase school supplies to stock her store.

loans.name: Binda Edward

texts.en:
Edward was born on 4th April 1944, and he is married to two wives. He has twelve children with his wives. Six of these children are below 15 years of age. He lives in a house that is made up of four rooms and three persons are entitled to a single room.

Edward grew up with very little support from his parents, especially in the area of education. With little education, Edward made his living by doing odd jobs. With these difficulties in life, he decided to join GHAPE.

He enrolled in GHAPE in the year 2007 and he has managed a single loan with no problems with repayment. Edward is requesting a loan of 100,000 FRS with which he is going to buy the following: piglets for 65,000 FRS and garden inputs for 35000 FRS, He will use the profit generated by this loan to continue to educate his children and part will be plowed back into his business. He thinks his business will succeed because he has been doing this business for long period of time.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Buying piglets and garden inputs

loans.name: Unice

texts.en:
Unice is married to Bernard S. and they are blessed with three children. She has been a very hard-working woman during her whole life just to sustain her family .She was forced by her parents to get married early because they were unable to pay her school fees and so she dropped out of school. This has made Unice very worried when she sees her friends doing well. In the cause of hard work, she encountered some challenges in life such as the death of her father and poor health. These challenges made life miserable for her until the year 2007 when she discovered GHAPE as a source of relief and became a member.

In that same year of 2007, she received her pioneer loan of 40,000 FRS CFA and the repayment was made promptly. She is now asking for a loan of 100,080 FRS which she will use to buy red palm oil. She is convinced the business will progress because of the experience she has in the business and because she is considered trustworthy by the members in her community. Operating this business in her community will shorten the distance her neighbors have to go to purchase palm oil which is a big expense for them. Unice plans to use the profit from her loan to pay her children's school fees, feed them, and to take care of their medical expenses if they are sick and taken to the hospital. She prefers to received a loan from GHAPE because of the trust she has in GHAPE; the method of repayment is comfortable and convenient.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Buying and selling of red palm oil

loans.name: Abdul Hadi

texts.en:
Abdul Hadi is the son of M. R.. He lives in district 9 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and has two children. He sells clothes in his shop.

He wants to take out an individual loan of 50,000 Afghani, because he wants to buy new design clothes and the clothes for which the demand in the bazaar is high. He says that he is confident that he will progress with this loan.

loans.use: Buying more clothes for re-sale

loans.name: Ajab Khan

texts.en: Ajab Khan is the son of A. A.. He lives in district 8 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He has a general store where he sells different kinds of things and supports all his family members with the income. He would like to expand his business and buy some more inventory for his shop to attract more customers. He wants to take an individual loan of 50,000 Afghani for a term of 12 months to buy all the required materials to have a well-stocked shop.

loans.use: purchasing new inventory

loans.name: Esa Khan

texts.en: Esa Khan is the son of G. F.. He lives in district 16, Kabul, Afghanistan, and he lives in a big family with six members. He wants to repair his house to be able to live comfortably. He has requested an individual loan of 50,000 Afghani for a term of 12 months. He is happy that through this process one can solve his/her problems.

loans.use: Buying construction materials to repair his house

loans.name: Jovielyn

texts.en:
Jovielyn B. is a farmer and a store owner. She is 31 years old and has two children. Her husband is a rice grower. Sometimes, her husband drives a passenger motorcycle to add to their limited income. Her children are still young; one is in elementary grade while the other is still at home. Because life is never easy, she and her husband work together to sustain their family.

She is asking for a loan of Php 13,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy feed and farm inputs. She will also buy additional merchandise for her store. In this way, she will be able to contribute to the family income.

CEVI helps Jovielyn succeed in her business. Credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage are what the clients receive by joining the CEVI credit program.

loans.use: Purchase of feed for her store and farm inputs for her farm

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena T., is a pig raiser. Every day, she takes good care of her pigs because she thinks this is the most profitable thing to do. She is already 49 years old and has 6 children, who are all studying. Her husband is a rice grower. He tills the land for the family. Together, they cultivate the 1-hectare of land that her husband inherited from his parents. Hard work is what keeps their family going.

Hog raising is the most common business in their town. But because there is a high demand for meat in the market, there is healthy competition. Elena has a friend who retails meat. She sells all her pigs to her friend. The profit that she gets from selling pigs has helped a lot to send her children to school.

She is asking for a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy feed for the pigs. In this way, she will be able to take good care of her pigs and sell all of them at high prices.

CEVI is helping Elena flourish in her business. Through CEVI, Elena has access to credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage.

loans.use: Purchase of feed for her pigs

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie C. is 40 years old and has three children. Her husband grows rice to support their two children who are still studying. The cost of sending their children to school is painful in their budget. So they need to work very hard to meet all the family's needs.

In 1994, Marjorie started selling her farm produce in her store. From the small amount of capital that she had saved up, she added merchandise. Her customers are people in their neighborhood. Her rice made her earn more profit in her store. This is because rice is a much needed commodity; everybody buys rice.

She is requesting a loan from CEVI of Php 10,000. She will use the loan to buy groceries and feed for pig owners in their hometown. She is also considering looking for some other possible areas to augment their income.

Marjorie is happy to be taking advantage of credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage that CEVI provides to all its clients.

loans.use: Purchase of groceries for her store and fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn T. is 55 years old and has 5 children. Her business is farming but she also sells variety goods in their neighborhood. She has a sundry shop. Her profits go toward paying the tuition fees of her 2 children who are now studying. Her husband is a "tricycle" (three-wheeled vehicle) driver. Evelyn thinks that with only her husband's income as a driver, it would be hard for them to send all their children to school.
