She will use this loan to increase her working capital, to buy more materials, sort them and sell them and thus stay in business. María has been a client of Impro since 2006 and her repayment history is very good which is why we have decided that she qualifies for this new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy plastic bottles, cardboard, used clothing and so on to resell by the kilogram.

loans.name: Savenco

texts.en: Savenco V. is 30 years old and he lives in Cantemir district, Chioselia village. His business is growing grapes and he has been in business for more than 10 years. He really likes the job he does and wants to be involved in this business in the future. He wants to expand his business so he needs a loan to cultivate the land for more production in the future. So, he will use the loan to increase his working capital of his business.

loans.use: To increase working capital.

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing is 24-years-old and single. She rents music videos to the people in her community. Blessing hopes for a loan amount of $550 (N80, 000) to purchase more music videos to add to her inventory. She says thanks to all that make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more music videos for rent

loans.name: Amalia Rosmery

texts.es:
La señora Amalia Rosmery L. R. tiene 38 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal Jesús Nazareno del cual es tesorera y vive en el distrito de Agallpampa de  la provincia de Otuzco, en el departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Amalia estudió Enfermería Técnica, pero se dedica a su negocio y a su hogar, ya que vive con su pareja desde que cumplió los 22 años.
Tiene tres hijos los cuales son menores de edad.
Su negocio consiste en el tejido de tapetes, cubrecamas, diversos tejidos artesanales.
Con su primer crédito de 300 soles cancelado en 4 cuotas, lo invirtió en hilos para tejer.
Con este crédito de 100 soles que cancelará en 4 cuotas invertirá en hilos para tejer.
Amalia sueña con tener una tienda de tejidos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Amalia Rosmery L. R. is 38 years old, is a member of the community bank Jesus Nazareno of which she is treasurer, and lives in the Agallpampa district of the Otuzco province, in the department La Libertad, Peru. Amalia studied nursing, but works in her business and in her home, she has been living with her spouse since she was 22 years old. She has three small children. Her business is knitting tablecloths, bed covers, and other handicrafts. Her first loan of 300 soles, which was repaid in 4 installments, she invested in knitting yarn. This loan of 100 soles, which will also be repaid in 4 installments, will once again purchase knitting yarn. Amalia dreams of having a knitting shop.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more yarn for her knitting.

loans.name: Adijat

texts.en: Adijat sells provisions and food products and hopes to expand her business with a loan amount of $275 (N40, 000) to purchase more products to increase her inventory. She has been in this business for a long time. She is a LAPO client and says thank you to all Kiva lenders and LAPO microfinance for their financial support. Adijat is 45-years-old and is married with four children.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and groceries to sell

loans.name: Flor Palmira

texts.es: La señora Flor Palmira
texts.en:
Mrs. Flor Palmira Alvarez Gomez is 40 years old, is a member of the community bank Jesus of Nazaret which is located in the Agallpampa district of the Otuzco province, in the department La Libertad Peru. She attended school through the third year of high school, and did not continue studying because she went to work. She married when she was 20 years old and currently has 5 children, 4 of which still depend on their parents for financial support. Flor has many occupations, one of which is the weaving of bedspreads using synthetic wool yarn. She also buys and sells small animals, alive and as meat. Her first loan was of 300 soles, repaid in 4 installments, which she used to buy animals. With this loan of 100 soles, which she will repay in 4 installments, she will buy synthetic wool yarn for the making of bedspreads. Flor dreams of her children becoming professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase synthetic wool for the making of bedspreads.

loans.name: Francisca Teresa

texts.es:
La señora Francisca Teresa G. C., integra el Banco Comunal Jesús Nazareno del distrito de Agallpampa en la provincia de Otuzco en el departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Cursó hasta el tercer grado de primaria, no continuó estudiando porque no tuvo apoyo familiar.
Se casó de 25 años y tiene 3 hijos, los que son independientes, los tres trabajan fuera del hogar.
Francisca trabaja vendiendo cerdos, los compra y los vende, también elabora tejidos los que vende en tiendas grandes de Trujillo.
Su primer crédito fue de 300 soles que canceló en 4 cuotas, lo invirtió en la compra de cerdos.
Con este crédito de 300 soles que será cancelado en 4 cuotas invertirá en la compra de un cerdo y lana para tejer.
Francisca desea tener un centro de comercio muy grande.
texts.en:
Mrs Francisca Teresa Gomez C., is member of the community bank Jesus Nazareno of the Agallpampa district in the Otuzco province of the department La Libertad Peru. She attended school through the third year of primary school and did not continue because she did not have support from her family. She married at 25 years of age and has 3 children, who are independent and work outside the home. Francisca works in the sale of pigs, she buys and sells them, and she also makes knitted items which she sells in the large stores of Trujillo. Her first loan was of 300 soles, which she repaid in 4 installments, and which she invested in the purchase of pigs. This loan of 300 soles, which will be repaid in 4 installments, will purchase one pig and knitting yarn. Francisca wishes to have a large commercial establishment.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pigs for her business and also knitting yarn.

loans.name: Francisca Doris

texts.es:
La señora Francisca Doris M. C., tiene 49 años y pertenece al Banco Comunal Jesús Nazareno del distrito de Agallpampa en la provincia de Otuzco en el departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió primaria completa, no continuó estudiando porque no tuvo apoyo familiar. Se casó de 20 años  y tiene 7 hijos de los cuales 4 dependen de ella.
Su negocio consiste en la compra venta de ganado lanar.
Con su primer crédito de 300 soles cancelado en 4 cuotas compro dos carneros que los engordó y vendió en carne.
Con este crédito de 300 soles que será cancelado en 4 cuotas invertirá en compra de animales pequeños que engordará y venderá en carne porque es la mejor forma de conseguir más ganancias.
texts.en:
Mrs. Francisca Doris M. C. is 49 years old and a member of the community bank Jesus Nazareno of the district of Agallpampa, in the Otuzco province in the department of La Libertad Peru. She finished elementary school, and did not continue studying because she did not have support from her family. She got married at 20 years of age and has 7 children, 4 of whom depend on her. Her business is the buying and selling of sheep. Her first loan of 300 soles, repaid in 4 installments, went towards the purchase of two sheep, which she fattened up and sold as meat. With this loan of 300 soles, which will be repaid in 4 installments, she will purchase small animals, which she will fatten up and sell as meat because this is the best way to obtain more income.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase small animals, which she will fatten up and sell as meat because this is the best way to obtain more income.

loans.name: Leónidas Verónica

texts.es:
La señora Leónidas Verónica B. R., pertenece al Banco Comunal Jesús Nazareno  del distrito de Agallpampa, provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió hasta tercer año de primaria y no continuó estudiando debido a la falta de apoyo familiar.
Se casó a los 17 años  y tiene 3 hijos de los cuales 2 dependen de ella.
Su negocio consiste en venta de harina, azúcar, levadura, es decir todo lo que hace falta para la elaboración de pan.
Su primer crédito fue de 300 soles cancelado en 4 cuotas y lo invirtió en harina, manteca y azúcar.
Con este crédito de 200 soles que cancelará en 4 cuotas comprará harina y  levadura.
Leónidas desearía tener un negocio más grande y amplio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Leonidas Veronica Bazan Rodriguez is a member of the community bank Jesus Nazareno, of the district of Agallpampa, Otuzco province, department of La Libertad Peru. She attended through the third year of primary school and did not continue her studies because of the lack of family support. She got married at 17 years of age and has 3 children, of which 2 depend on her. Her business consists of selling flour, sugar, yeast, that is, all that is necessary for the making of bread. Her first loan was for 300 soles, repaid in 4 installments, and she invested it in the purchase of flour, butter and yeast. This loan of 200 soles, which will be repaid in 4 installments, she will use in the purchase of flour and yeast. Leonidas wishes to have a bigger and more spacious business.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more flour and yeast for her business.

loans.name: María Del Pilar

texts.es:
Banco Comunal Jesús Nazareno del distrito de Agallpampa provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudio secundaria completa, pero ya no continuó estudiando debido a que se casó y actualmente tiene dos hijos y espera un tercer bebé.
Su negocio consiste en una bodega donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, también productos de belleza y compra y vende animales menores.
Con su primer crédito de 300 soles que canceló en 4 cuotas, lo invirtió en comprar artículos para su bodega.
Con este crédito de 500 soles que será cancelado en 4 cuotas invertirá en comprar animales menores.
El sueño de María es que su negocio crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
Community bank Jesús Nazareno of the district of Agallpampa in the province of Otuzco, department of La Libertad, Peru. She graduated from high school but did not continue her studies because she got married; she has two children and is expecting a third. Her business is a store where she sells basic goods as well as beauty products. She also buys and sells small livestock. She invested her first loan of 300 soles, repaid over four months, in goods to sell in her store. She will use this 500 soles loan, to be repaid over four months, to buy small animals. María's dream is to see her business grow day by day.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy small animals for her business

loans.name: Alexei

texts.en: Alexei is a young person, he is 28 years old and lives in Leova district, Cupcui village. He is on track to start a family so his plan is to gain more profits by expanding his business. His business consists of growing grapes, something he has done for more than 5 years. He plans to produce wine in the future, but now he wants to increase the amount of grapes he grows. Alexei wants to buy a device to strip the grapevines and fuel for irrigating the land. MicroInvest is helping Alex with a loan to give him the opportunity in the future to become a very qualified specialist in wine production.

loans.use: To buy a device to strip the grapevines.

loans.name: Martha Sonia

texts.es:
La señora Martha Sonia V. H. tiene 36 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal Jesús Nazareno del distrito de Agallpampa situado en la provincia de Otuzco en el departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudio hasta segundo grado de secundaria y no continuó estudiando debido a la falta de recursos económicos. Se unió a su pareja a los 23 años y tienen un hijo de 14 años.
Su negocio consiste en la compra venta de animales menores como ovejas y cerdos, los que compra en carne y lleva a la provincia de Trujillo a vender.
Con su primer crédito de 300 soles cancelado en 4 cuotas compró carne más cereal que volvió a vender en Trujillo.
Con este crédito de 800 soles que será cancelado en 6 cuotas invertirá en compra de carne.
Martha sueña con tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Martha Sonia V. H. is 36 years old and belongs to the Jesús Nazareno Communal Bank of the Agallpampa district located in the Otuzco province in the department of La Libertad, Perú. She studied until the second year of secondary school and did not continue studying due to the lack of economic resources. She joined with her partner when she was 23 and they have a son who is 14 years old. Her business consists of the purchase and sale of small animals like sheep and pigs, which she buys their meat and takes them to the province of Trujillo to sell. With her first loan of 300 soles repaid in 4 installments she bought meat plus cereal that she returned to sell in Trujillo. With this loan of 800 soles which will be repaid in 6 installments she will invest in the purchase of meat. Martha dreams of having her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of meat for her business.

loans.name: Narcisa Idelsa

texts.es:
La señora Narcisa Idelsa M. D. O., pertenece al Banco comunal Mujeres con Futuro, del distrito D. Mache provincia D. Otuzco, departamento D. La Libertad Perú.
La señora Narcisa tiene una bodega pero se dedica más que todo  a la compra venta D. quesillo  y a la compra D. ganado porcino para venderlo en carne, los animales y el quesillo los consigue en el mismo distrito D. Mache. Embala los quesillos y la carne y los envía para ser  vendidos en los mercados D. Trujillo, debido a que así conseguirá mejores precios.
Otra forma que ella usa para mejorar su negocio es comprando los cerdos pequeños, los cría hasta lograr un tamaño considerable y un peso razonable como para poder ser vendidos en carne. 
Narcisa Idelsa tiene 5 hijos que siempre le ayudaron en su negocio  pero actualmente ya los cinco tienen sus propios compromisos, solamente viven ella y su esposo.
 Con su primer crédito  D. 300 soles que canceló en cuatro cuotas,  implementó su bodega con artículos D. librería.
texts.en:
Narcisa Idelsa M. D. O. belongs to the "Mujeres con Futuro" Communal Bank of the Mache district, province of Otuzco in the department of La Libertad, Perú. Narcisa has a small store but she works more than anything in the buying and selling of cheese and the purchase of pigs to sell their meat. She gets the animals and the cheese in the same district of Mache. She packages the cheeses and the meat and she sends them to be sold in the markets of Trujillo due to the fact that she will obtain better prices. Another thing that she uses to improve her business is buying small pigs and raising them until they achieve a considerable size and a reasonable weight to be able to be sold for their meat. Narcisa Idelsa has 5 children who always help her in her business. But currently the five already have their own commitments and only she and her husband live together. With her first loan of 300 soles that she repaid in four installments she added stationary items to her small store.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of more animals to fatten and their sale

loans.name: Beatrice Magaala

texts.en:
Born on the 9th of February, 1970, Beatrice was married to the late Pa C. Thomas. As a widow, Beatrice has four children, two of whom need to be cared for as they are below the age of fifteen. Life was very not easy for her when her husband died, and her child was involved in an accident. In the year 2003, Beatrice came to know of GHAPE and enrolled herself, so that she could obtain a loan and continue with her business, from which she raises money to pay school fees and provide food for her children.

Given a loan, she plans to buy corn for “corn beer” production (“corn beer” is one of the most common drinks in the NW region of Cameroon). It is produced from ground corn, palm wine, and palm oil. She is very convinced the business will progress, because she has been doing the same business for a very long time, has a good business site and many customers. Furthermore, she was trained in business management, marketing techniques, and credit discipline and has showed commitment in investing and repaying her loans. She promises to make her repayments on time. These activities of Beatrice will help her community by providing them with food and drink for their social activities, at a moderate cost. She plans to raise money to invest in an additional line of business, buy food, and pay school fees for her children from the proceeds of the business.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase corn for corn beer, as well as palm oil and palm wine.

loans.name: Disso Group

texts.fr: Depuis 1987, les femmes du groupement sont enregistrées à la Chambre de compétences de Mekhé. Elles ont acquis de réelles capacités dans le domaine du commerce. Déjà, deux femmes du groupement disposent de leur propre boutique et comptent ainsi avec le projet de microcrédit renforcer les produits d’alimentation, une autre dispose d’un étal de friperie. Les autres membres utiliseront leur part pour faire du commerce ambulant avec la vente de divers produits (alimentation, produits artisanaux).
texts.en:
Since 1987, the women of this group have been registered with the Chamber of Competence in Mekhé. They have acquired real capabilities in the domain of commerce. Two of the women in the group already have their own shops and are counting on this micro-loan to bolster their inventory of foodstuffs. Another woman has a stall where she sells used clothing. The other members will use their share as ambulant saleswomen selling various products (foodstuffs, hand-crafted objects).

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: bolstering their little businesses

loans.name: Nelly Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Nelly Rosa A. Z. tiene 51 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal Jesús Nazareno del distrito de Agallpampa perteneciente a la provincia de Otuzco en el departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Nelly estudió primaria completa, no continuó sus estudios debido a la falta de apoyo económico. Se casó de 18 años y tuvo 4 hijos, de los cuales viven 3, uno de ellos tiene vida independiente en cambio los otros dos todavía son estudiantes.
Se dedica a la compra venta de ganado lanar, como tiene terrenos agrícolas, los aprovecha para sembrar y vender papa y maíz y otras especies según la estación.
Con su primer crédito de 300 soles cancelado en 4 cuotas compró ganado lanar.
Con este crédito de S/.1000  que será cancelado en  6  cuotas, lo invertirá en ganado para carne.
Su mayor anhelo es llegar a vender a los camales grandes de Trujillo.
texts.en:
Nelly Rosa A. Z. is 51 years old and belongs to the Jesús Nazareno Communal Bank of the Agallpampa district, which is in the Otuzco province in the department of La Libertad, Perú. Nelly completed primary school but did not continue her studies due to the lack of economic support. She married at 18 years old and had 4 children, 3 of whom are living. One of them lives independently and the other two are still students. She works in the purchase and sale of cattle and as she has agricultural land she takes advantage of this to grow and sell potatoes, corn and other varieties according to the season. With her first loan of 300 soles repaid in 4 installments she bought cattle. With this loan of S/.1000, which will be paid back in 6 installments, she will invest it in cattle for meat production. Her greatest wish is to be able to sell to Trujillo's large slaughterhouses.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cattle for meat production

loans.name: Nila Violeta

texts.es:
La señora Nila Violeta Z. C. tiene 49 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal Jesús Nazareno  del distrito de Agallpampa en la provincia de Otuzco en el departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Cursó hasta el cuarto grado de educación primaria y por falta de apoyo familiar no continuó estudiando. 
Se casó de 22 años y tiene 4 hijos de los cuales dependen de ella solamente 2.
Nila tiene una bodega donde vende artículos de primera necesidad y carne de pollo que adquiere en los mercados de Trujillo.
Con su primer crédito de 300 soles cancelado en 4 cuotas, lo invirtió en compra de artículos para volver a vender.
Con este crédito de 1500 que será cancelado en 6 cuotas invertirá en viveres y en pollo.
Nila sueña con tener un negocio muy grande.
texts.en:
Nila Violeta Z. C. is 49 years old and belongs to the Jesús Nazareno Communal Bank of the Agallpampa district in the Otuzco province in the department of La Libertad, Perú. She attended school until the fourth grade and because of the lack of family support she did not continue studying. She got married about 22 years of age and has 4 children of which only 2 are dependent upon her. Nila has a small store where she sells essential household items and chicken meat that she acquires at the Trujillo markets. With her first loan of 300 soles, which was paid back in 4 installments, she invested it in the purchase of articles to resell. With this loan of 1500 that will be repaid in 6 installments she will invest in groceries and in chicken. Nila dreams of having a very big business.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries and chicken for her store.

loans.name: Paula Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Paula Antonia C. C. tiene 53 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal Jesús María y vive en el sector de Cochaya en el caserío de Salpo en la provincia de Otuzco en el departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió hasta segundo de secundaria y ya no continuó estudiando debido a que solamente vivía con su madre y esta tenía la idea de que las mujeres no deben recibir educación.  Se casó a los 16 años y tuvo 10 hijos siete de los cuales dependen de ella.
La actividad económica que realiza es la venta de queso, carne, jamón, además tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes.
El primer crédito fue de 300 soles cancelado en cuatro cuotas y lo invirtió en comprar queso.
Con este crédito de 100 soles que será cancelado en 4 cuotas invertirá en compra de zapatos escolares.
Paula desea tener una casa en Trujillo.
texts.en:
Paula Antonia C. C. is 53 years old, belongs to the Jesús María Communal Bank and lives in the Cochaya sector in the Salpo neighborhood in the Otuzco province of the department of La Libertad, Perú. She studied until the second year of secondary school and did not continue because she only lived with her mother who had the idea that women should not receive an education. She married when she was 16 years old and had 10 children, seven of which are her dependents. The economic activity that she carries out is the sale of cheese, meat, and ham in addition to having a small grocery store. The first loan for 300 soles was re-paid in four installments and she invested it in the purchase of cheese. With this loan of 100 soles that will be paid back in 4 installments she will invest in the purchase of school shoes. Paula wishes to have a house in Trujillo.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of school shoes that she wants to sell in her store.

loans.name: Rocío Del Pilar

texts.es:
La señora Rocío del Pilar A. S. tiene 38 años y pertenece al Banco Comunal Jesús Nazareno del distrito de Agallpampa en la provincia de Otuzco departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió primaria completa y no continuo estudiando porque quería trabajar y ver surgir a su familia.
Se casó a los 16 años y tiene 4 hijos los cuales son aun estudiantes.
Su negocio consiste en la compra venta de animales los que vuelve a vender en pie.
Su primer crédito fue de 300 soles que canceló en 4 cuotas y lo invirtió en compra de animales.
Con este crédito de 500 soles que será cancelado en 4 cuotas invertirá en la compra de animales.
Rocío sueña con ver a sus hijos profesionales.
texts.en:
Rocío del Pilar A. S. is 38 years old and belongs to the Jesús Nazareno Communal Bank of the Agallpampa district in the province of the Otuzco, department of La Libertad, Perú. She completed primary school and did not continue studying because she wanted to work to help her family. She got married at 16 years of age and has 4 children who are still students. Her business consists of the purchase and sale of animals which she returns to sell in an ambulatory way. Her first loan of 300 soles was paid back in 4 installments and she invested it in the purchase of animals. With this loan of 500 soles that will be re-paid in 4 installments she will invest in the purchase of animals. Rocio dreams of seeing her children as professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of more animals for her business.

loans.name: Founke

texts.fr: O. A. Founke a 29 ans. Elle s'est marie avec MADINNE Narcisse, et ils ont deux enfants, Donald et Davy dont 1 est scolarise.  Elle a commence de vendre les biscuits, les bons bons, et le chewing-gum il y a 10 ans. Le crédit lui a permis de changer a la vente des produits du portable et des objets de décoration. Founke achete ses produits a Lomé, Togo et dans les boutiques. Elle voudrait également exposer sa marchandise hors du Benin.
texts.en:
Founke A. O., 29, is married to Narcisse Madinne and they have two children, Donald and Davy. One of the children is in school. Founke A. began selling cookies, candy, and chewing-gum 10 years ago. A loan permitted her to change over to selling phone accessories and decorative objects. Founke buys her products in Lomé, Togo, and in the shops. She would also like to be able to display her merchandise outside of Benin.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cell phone accessories by GSM

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa V. D. C., pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres con Futuro, del distrito D. Mache provincia D. Otuzco departamento D. La Libertad Perú, tiene 70 años y trabaja en panadería más D. 40 años, tiene un hijo y tres nietos. 
Ella trabaja en un horno D. leña el horno es D. barro revertido, la leña la consigue en Mache.
La señora Rosa, no tiene máquinas, trabaja D. manera artesanal con bateas, latas, mesa, rodillo, palas y rastrillos.
Rosa venD. en su panadería sin ayuda nada más que la D. su esposo.
Su primer crédito fue D. 300 soles cancelado en 4 cuotas con el que compró, manteca, harina, levadura y otros.
Con este crédito D. 3,000 soles que cancelara en 4 cuotas, volverá a comprar insumos para su panadería ya que dejo D. trabajar por motivos D. salud.     
Rosa manifiesta nunca haber abandonado a su familia por su negocio pues ella siempre trabajó en su casa y el pan también le sirvió para alimentar a su familia. Ahora es conocida como la mejor panadera D. la zona, por lo que su deseo es continuar con el mismo prestigio.
texts.en:
Rosa V. D. C. belongs to the Community Bank for Women with a Future in the Mache district, Otuzco Province, La Libertad State, Peru. She is 70 years old and has worked in a bakery for more than 40 years. She has one son and three grandchildren. She works with a firewood oven maD. from recycled items and she attains the wood from Marche. Rosa does not have machines and she works in an traditional way with pans, cans, a table, a roller, blades, and razors. She sells her items at the bakery without any help except for that of her husband. Her first loan of 300 soles was paid off in 4 payments with which she bought butter, flour, yeast, and more. With this loan of 3,000 soles to be paid in 4 payments, she will buy packaged snacks to sell in her bakery because she cannot do much manual labor anymore due to her health. Rosa says that she has never abandoned her family for her business yet she has always worked in her house and sold bread to support her family. She is known as the best baker in the neighborhood and she would like to maintain this prestige.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase snacks to sell in her bakery because of reasons due to health

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
Luz Maria es socia del Bancomunal Maria Milagrosa.
Luz Maria es conviviente, tiene cuatro hijos de 26, 17, 16 y 9 años,  los menores estudian en  colegio estatal.

La familia de Luz Maria tuvo un negocio, una polleria, ella de niña trabajaba allí con su papá, es donde le fue naciendo el gusto por el  negocio. Cuando su papá muere se reparten la herencia, cerrando la polleria. A la edad de 17  años tiene su primer hijo  y se va a vivir con su esposo, pero la necesidad económica era fuerte   y se dedico a trabajar en la venta de  sandwich  con su hermano, ellos venden  semanal mas de 280 sandwich de martes a domingo, los lunes descansan. Por las mañanas ella  se dedica a tejer en su casa chompas  a croché y  a palito, para una empresa que lo exporta a otro país.  
Desde que comenzó en Finca, ha sido una ayuda para surgir en su negocio, ahora tiene un carrito especial para los sandwich. Le gusta las reuniones, el compañerismo que hay entre las socias del Bancomunal.    
Luz María necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para invertirlos en  compra de panes, papa, aceite, para la preparación de los sandwich.
El sueño de Luz Maria es tener un restaurante, y una tienda bazar.
texts.en:
Luz Maria is a member of Bancomunal Maria Milagrosa. Luz Maria is a partner and has four children of 26, 17, 16, and 9 years. The younger children are studying in state school. Luz Maria's family had a business, a poultry shop. Since she was a girl, she has worked there with her father, and it was here that her taste for business was born. When her father died, the real estate was divided, closing the poultry shop. At the age of 17 years, she had her first son and went to live with her husband. However, the economic pressure was strong, and she worked to sell sandwiches with her brother. They now sell more than 280 sandwiches weekly from Tuesday to Sunday, resting on Mondays. In the mornings, she knits and crochets sweaters in her home for a business than exports them to another country. Since she started with Finca, she has received help to succeed in her business. Now, she has a special cart for the sandwiches. She likes meetings because of the fellowship that exists between the members of Bancomunal. Luz Maria needs a loan of $375 USD to invest in the purchase of bread, potatoes, oil to prepare sandwiches. Luz Maria’s dream is to have a restaurant and a bazaar.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase bread, potatoes and oil to prepare sandwiches

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Fifty-nine year old Alice is married to Michael Anyeh and they have eight children all older than fifteen. Alice decided to work extra hard to assist her husband in bringing up these children, but along the way she encountered some challenges such as death and ill health. She saw GHAPE as an opportunity to assist her in improving her livelihood. She was trained and given a loan in 2004.
 
This will be Alice's fourth loan from GHAPE; she became a member in 2004. She has been quite successful in the past with her business due to her location (right on the main road), the quality of her products, and her reasonable prices. She buys in bulk which causes the price to be minimal and her children help her in caring for the pigs. She has a strong customer base and is confident that she will be able to increase her sales.

She plans to use the loan to buy tomatoes, spices, palm oil, piglets, and repair her old pig stye. She plans to use the profit from the loan to further her children's education in higher institutions of learning. This business of Alice's will help her community by supplying food to them and will also help those in her community to reduce their distance to the market to buy the type of goods she is selling.

Alice prefers to receive a loan from GHAPE because the method of repayment is comfortable and convenient, and because of the social services and training GHAPE also offers.  

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, spices, palm oil and piglets.

loans.name: Mavis

texts.en: Mavis G. is 28 years old. She is single and financially independent. Mavis lives alone in a rented apartment in the Bawalashie community near Accra. Most of the inhabitants of Bawalashie are either farmers or earn income trading  farm products. Very few people run other types of businesses. Mavis herself earns a living selling food products and other goods, such as cassava, charcoal, and maize, at the local market of Bawalashie. She has been in this business for the past six years, and has acquired a lot of experience that has helped her increase the number of customers. Mavis hopes to save enough money to be able to expand her sales business. She is therefore asking for a loan to increase the stock of cassava, plantain, maize, and other goods. She is a member of the community Trust Group called ‘To God Be the Glory,’ whose members provide support to one another in handling repayment. Mavis is greatful for everyone's support.

loans.use: Purchase of food products for sale

loans.name: Juana Rina

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Bancomunal Maria Milagrosa.
Juana es conviviente, tiene 51 años, tiene cuatro hijos de 28,27,24 y 10 años, los mayores trabajan y él último esta en la escuela.  

Juana llega del Cuzco a los 17 años, con su hermano,  entró a la preparatoria para ingresar a la universidad, para educación inicial, pero su esposo no la dejó estudiar, ni trabajar por que decía que las mujeres tienen que  estar en su casa dedicadas  a cuidar hijos.  Es así como ella pasó su vida, hasta que su esposo le permitió trabajar pero en la puerta de su casa, tiene un negocio de venta de picarones desde hace siete años, pero también aprovecha para vender   entradas como  papa rellena y  causa. 

Desde que esta en Finca recibe  préstamos los cuales  han ayudado mucho para surgir en su negocio, en el Bancomunal pasa tiempos bonitos, sé desestreza.
Juana necesita un crédito de 1000 soles, para la compra de descartables, harina, saco de papas.
El sueño de Juana es abrir un restaurante. En su casa, sus vecinos le dicen que tiene buena sazón.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of Bancomunal Maria Milagrosa. Juana has a life partner and is 51 years old. She has four sons of 28, 27, 24, and 10 years. The older sons work, and the youngest is in school. Juana arrived in Cuzco when she was 17 years old with her brother. She entered school to enroll in the university for education, but her husband did not permit her to study or work because he said that women should be in the house to care for children. This is how she spent her life until her husband allowed her to work from home. For seven years, she has had a business that sells fritters and also starters, such as stuffed potato and causa. Since she has been with Fina, she has received loans that have helped her greatly to succeed in her business. With Bancomunal, the time that passes is beautiful, and she relaxes. Juana needs a loan of $325 to purchase perishables, flour, and a sack of potatoes. Juana’s dream is to open a restaurant. In her home, her neighbors say that she has a good flavor.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase perishables, flour, and a sack of potatoes.

loans.name: San Expedito Group

texts.es: l grupo " San Expedito" esta representado por la señora Sandra Luz y  cuenta con algunas socias que han trabajado en anteriores grupos con la fundación agrocapital  y se unieron para integrar uno nuevo Banco conformado D. gente responsable y cumplida. En general las socias se dedican al comercio D. productos como comida, cosméticos, pan, ropa y actividades como, servicio domestico D. limpieza, confección D. ropa tejida, servicio D. transporte,  construcción y a la elaboración D. artesanías. La competencia en el ámbito comercial es fuerte por la oferta y la demanda D. productos pero la experiencia y la capacidad D. superación D. los socios vence cualquier contingencia. El financiamiento esta destinado a la compra D. insumos y materiales así como para la reparación D. sus herramientas D. trabajo para brindar un mejor servicio. Los miembros del grupo conocen la forma D. trabajo con grupos solidarios por lo que saben administrar bien los fondos otorgados y responder con sus obligaciones con responsabilidad.
texts.en:
The 'San Expedito' group is represented by Sandra Luz, and includes a number of members who have worked in previous groups with Fundacion Agrocapital. They united to form a new community bank maD. up of responsible and committed people. In general the members work selling products including food, cosmetics, bread and clothing, and in activities including domestic cleaning services, clothing textile manufacturing, transport services, construction and the elaboration of handicrafts. There is strong competition in the commercial sphere driven by the supply and demand for products, but the members' experience and capacity to overcome challenges triumphs over any obstacle. The loan will be used to buy basic supplies and materials, as well as to repair work tools in order to offer better service. The group members are familiar with how to work in solidarity groups, and know how to manage funds well and responsibly fulfil their obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Magna Fredesminda

texts.es:
Primer Préstamo:
http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=53261

Magna es socia del Bancomunal Maria Milagrosa.
Magna es  casada, tiene un hijo de 15 años estudia en colegio particular.
Ella empezó trabajando para una señora, vendiendo caramelos y  periódicos, por las calles, así fue aprendiendo dónde se compraba. Hasta que se decidió independizarse, y dedicarse a la venta de periódicos, se levanta a las tres y media de la mañana para ir a comprar periódicos hasta San Juan, reparte a domicilio tiene un ayudante, vende de 300 a 400 periódicos diarios; tiene once años en el negocio.

Desde que esta en Finca es una ayuda por que ha podido invertir, ella empezó vendiendo en una mesita, ahora tiene un kiosco. 
Magna necesita un crédito de 2600 soles para invertirlos en la compra de periódicos.
Magna sueña con que su hija sea una profesional, tener personal que trabaje para ella, y ella dedicarse a su casa.
texts.en:
First Loan: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=53261 Magna is a partner of Bancomunal Maria Milagrosa. Magna is married with one child of 15 years who is studying at school. She started working for a lady, selling sweets and newspapers on the streets, learning where purchases were made. She then decided to be independent and sell newspapers on her own. She wakes up at half past three in the morning to purchase newspapers until San Juan. She delivers the newspapers to homes with an assistant, selling 300 to 400 newspapers daily. She has been in the business for 11 years. Since she has been with Finca, she has received help to invest. She began selling at a small table; now she has a kiosk. Magna needs a credit of $825 to invest in the purchase of newspapers. She dreams that her daughter will be a professional, to have staff working for her, and that she can be devoted to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase newspapers

loans.name: Ermida

texts.es:
La señora Ermida  L. S. tiene 40 años y pertenece al Banco Comunal Jesús Nazareno del distrito de Agallpampa de la provincia de Otuzco en el departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió secundaria completa, pero no continuó estudiando debido a la falta de apoyo económico de su familia.
A los 25 años se casó y tiene 2 hijos a quienes educa con mucha ilusión.
Su negocio consiste en compra de reses en la provincia de Julcán y las vuelve a vender en pie.
Con su primer crédito de 300 soles cancelado en 4 cuotas, invirtió en una res.
Con este crédito de 1000 soles que será cancelado en 6 cuotas invertirá en una res.
Su máximo sueño es tener un capital propio para trabajar sola.
texts.en:
Ermida L. S. is 40 years old and belongs to the Community Bank of Jesus of Nazareth in the Agallpampa district, Otuzco province, La Libertad state, Peru. She completed a high school education but did not continue her studies to due a lack of financial support from her family. At 25 years old, she married and then had 2 chidren who were brought up with a lot of hope. Her business puchases beef from the Julcan province and then she travels around selling it. With her first loan of 300 soles, paid in 4 payments, she invested in a cow. With this loan of 1000 soles, to be paid in 6 payments, she will invest in another cow. Her highest dream is to have enough capital of her own to work alone.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cattle for her business

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Primer préstamo:
http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=53262
Carmen es socia del Bancomunal Maria Milagrosa.
Carmen tiene 27 años, es conviviente, tiene una hija de 10 años, que estudia en el colegio de Tablada de Lurin.

Los padres de Carmen son cocineros, ellos le enseñaron muchos secretos de cocina,  a ella le gusta la cocina. Empezó trabajando como ayudante de cocina en un restaurante por cuatro años,  decidió independizarse  y poner su negocio de restaurante en su casa, ella empezó con cuatro sillas y dos mesas, ahora tiene un ayudante de cocina, una azafata, y una lava platos, y ella es la que cobra. Todos los días da desayuno y menú tiene 80 comensales.     
Desde que esta en Finca, ve cómo su negocio ha crecido, antes su hijo estudiaba en una escuela del estado, ahora está en una escuela privada, le gustan las reuniones del Bancomunal.   
Carmen necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para la compra de gaseosa, arroz, azúcar para surtir su restaurante.
El sueño que tiene Carmen es poner una polleria en su casa.
texts.en:
First loan: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=53262 Carmen is a member of Bancomunal Maria Milagrosa. Carmen is 27 years old and has a life partner. She has a ten year old daughter who is studying at the college of Tablada de Lurin. Carmen's parents are chefs. They taught her many of the secrets of cooking, and Carmen loves to cook. She worked for four years as an assistant chef in a restaurant. She has decided to become independent and make her restaurant business in her home. She started with fuar chairs and two tables. Now she has an assistant chef, a hostess, a dish washer, and she is charged. They serve breakfast every day for 80 diners. Since she has been with Finca, she has seen how her business has grown. Before, her son was studying in a state school; now he is in a private school. She enjoys the meetings of Bancomunal. Carmen needs a loan of $375 to purchase gas, rice, and sugar to supply her restaurant. Carmen’s dream is to put a poultry shop in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase gas, rice, and sugar for her restaurant

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen Rosa  es socia del Bancomunal Maria Milagrosa.
Carmen Rosa es  conviviente, tiene 36 años tiene dos hijas de 13 y 4 años estudian en escuela privada.

Carmen Rosa fue promotora de ventas de pinturas de arte, su trabajo consistía en viajar,  constantemente y dejaba sola a sus hijas. Por tal motivo tuvo que renunciar a su trabajo y se dedicó a las  ventas empezó en  el colegio de su hija, vendiendo  medias, chompas, le fue tan bien  que puso un bazar en su casa. Ella viaja a Trujillo y trae novedades que no hay en el mercado peruano, y por intermedio de amigos  y familiares en el  extranjero trae cosas novedosas.  
Carmen Rosa necesita un crédito de 1800 soles, para la compra de ropa, calzado, y cosas novedosas. 
El sueño de Carmen Rosa es crear su propia marca de  prendas de vestir, y poner una tienda en Trujillo.
texts.en:
Carmen Rosa is a member of Bancomunal Maria Milagrosa. Carmen Rosa has a life partner and is 36 years old. She has two daughters who are 13 and 4 years old, studying in private school. Carmen Rosa was a promoter of art paintings. Her job consisted in traveling constantly, and she left her daughters home alone. For this reason, she quit her job and devoted herself to sales when her daughter started school. She sells socks, sweaters, and business is so good that she has now put a store in her own home. She travels to Trujillo and brings novelties that they do not carry in the Peruvian market. Friends and relatives abroad also bring her new items. Carmen Rosa needs a loan of $575 USD to buy clothes, shoes, and new items. Carmen Rosa's dream is to create her own brand of clothing and to own a store in Trujillo.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing and shoes

loans.name: Mbagye

texts.en:
C. is a single mother with four children; she lives in Mile 19 Mbengwi, just outside of Bamenda (about one hour drive during the dry season), in Cameroon. Being the bread winner of her home, C. has been a very hard working woman her whole life just to sustain herself and her children (one son suffers from sickle cell). With this loan, C. plans to invest in her buyam–sellam business, piggery and farming. More specifically, she will purchase egusi (a type of seed), palm oil, piglets and crop seeds.  
 
This is C.'s second loan; she has been a member of GHAPE since 2005.  She has a great deal of experience in her buyam–sellam business. Over the years, her customers have become regular as they build a trusting relationship and use her catering services for social gatherings. She also feels that she has an excellent site for her business. 
 
The profit from this loan will be used to pay her children's school fees. She will also invest most of her profits into her business. The rest will be used to clothe her children well, provide medical assistance to her family, and feed her family.
 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and the community.

loans.use: To buy egusi, palm oil, piglets, and crop seeds.

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia A. started her fish sales business 40 years ago in Koforidua, a suburb of Offinso in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She is 64 years old, married, and has six children, four of whom are fully independent, while the other two are still in school. Additionally, Afia also takes care of her three grandchildren who live with her. 

Afia earns income preparing and selling very tasty and good quality fish to her many customers. She is very energetic and has plans for further expanding her business. She is therefore asking for a loan to be able to buy a larger quantity of fish to increase her sales and, consequently, income. Afia hopes to thereby be able to better support her children in obtaining education. Afia belongs to a village bank called ‘Fawohobo Nyame’ which means 'Be friends with Jesus.'

loans.use: Purchase of smoked and dried fish

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
El señor Miguel Ángel M. es padre de familia, tiene dos hijos adolescentes que actualmente estudian.
Con 4 créditos anteriores de FVP ha construido gran partes de su vivienda y en dos cuartos le esta haciendo falta colocarles el techo. Tiene el proyecto de construir una losa de concreto para que la casa sea más segura y duradera.
El esta solicitando un préstamo para realizar la mejora y planea pagarlo con sus ingresos como jefe del aria de tráfico en una compañía de trasportes.
 Su deseo es que sus hijos tengan su propio espacio y vivan mejor.
texts.en:
Señor Miguel Angel Martinez is a parent, with two teenage children who are currently studying. With four previous loans with FVP he has constructed much of his housing. In two rooms, he is putting in a roof where it is missing. He is planning to build a concrete slab so that the home will be more secure and durable. He is requesting a loan to make additional home improvements and plans to pay it back with income as the head of air traffic for a transportation company. He dreams that his sons will have their own space and live a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Concrete slab

loans.name: Crecer Group

texts.es: El grupo "Crecer" esta representado por la señora Rossy y conformado por 17 miembros los cuales vienen cursando su primer ciclo dentro D. la fundación agrocapital. Los socios (as) se dedican a actividades D. índole comercial vendiendo productos como el pan, la comida y ofreciendo cosméticos por catalogo, otros se dedican a la prestación se servicios como el trasporte, la agricultura y el servicio domestico. Siempre existe la competencia D. productos por la oferta y la demanda pero los integrantes del grupo saben como salir adelante para poder llevar el pan D. cada día a sus hogares. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra D. productos, insumos y materiales para poder brindar un mejor servido y mejor sus ingresos para dar a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida. Las socias cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios debido a que ya trabajaron con instituciones similares a la fundación agrocapital, por lo tanto responderán con responsabilidad y cumplimiento con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
The 'Crecer' group is represented by Rossy and is maD. up of 17 members who are entering into their first loan cycle with Fundacion Agrocapital. The members work in a range of commercial activities including selling bread, food, and cosmetics by catalogue. Others work in the service sector including transport, farming and domestic services. There is always competition in the supply and demand for products, but the group members know how to move forward and meet the daily needs of their households. The loan will be used to buy products, basic supplies and materials, in order to offer better service and increase their incomes, and in such a way offer their families a better quality of life. The members have experience in solidarity groups as they have previously worked with organizations similar to Fundacion Agrocapital. For this reason they will respond responsibly and fulfil their obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Basilidesa Hidelisa

texts.es:
Primer Préstamo:
http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=53415
Basilidesa es socia del Bancomunal Medalla Milagrosa. 
Basilidesa es casada, tiene 54 años,  tres hijos 34, 33, 32 años, todos profesionales.

Empezó en el mundo D. las ventas por necesidad, para dar D. comer  a sus hijos y darles estudios,  fue al  mercado central para  comprar servicios D. cocina, y los ofrecía D. casa en casa, a sus vecinas, quienes le fueron pidiendo varias cosas. También  hace  pasteles, los venD. D. casa en casa, ella vive en una zona D. mucho cuidado, por esa razón le robaron todo lo que tenia en su casa, siendo para su familia una perdida económica.

DesD. que esta en Finca ha sido D. ayuda en los gastos D. la universidad D. sus hijos, aprendió a ahorrar, a ser más perseverante en las ventas para llegar a su meta.  
Basilidesa necesita un crédito D. 1000 soles, para  compra D. sabanas D. algodón.   
El sueño D. Basilidesa es tener un negocio estable, como un bazar o un restaurante.
texts.en:
Fist loan: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=53415 Basilidesa is a member of the Miraculous Medal Community Bank. Basilidesa is married, 54 years old, and has three children of ages 34, 33, and 32, all of whom are professionals. She started in the sales world out of necessity in order to feed her children and proviD. them education. She went to the central market to cook and offered this service by going door to door, during which her neighbors requested various items. She also makes pastries that she sells door to door. She lives in an area where you have to be very careful. Her house was robbed of everything she owned, which was a financial loss for her family. Since she has been on the farm, she has helped with the cost of univeristy for her children. She learned to save and persevere as a saleswoman in order to meet her goal. Basilidesa needs a loan of 1,000 soles in order to buy cotton sheets. Her dream is to have a stable business, like a store or a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchse cotton sheets

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia S. is 48 years old. She is divorced and has four children, two of whom are in school, while the other two are learning a trade. Afia and her children live in Koforidua in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

Afia earns income selling fresh fish (tilapia and red fish) and dried fish. She has been in this business for 35 years and has obtained a lot of useful experience. She buys the fish from farmers and fish mongers living in sea shore communities. This way, she avoids the extra expenses she would incur if buying from middlemen. Afia currently needs a loan to be able to buy an additional quantity of fresh and dried fish to meet the growing daily demand from her customers. She hopes to thereby increase her profit and use part of it to support her children in school. Afia belongs to a village bank called ‘Dea Nyame Beka’ which means 'What God will say.'

loans.use: Purchase of fresh and dried fish

loans.name: Hilda Lucila

texts.es:
Primer préstamo:
http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=53417
Hilda es socia del Bancomunal Medalla Milagrosa.
Hilda tiene 32 años, es conviviente, tiene dos hijos de 10 y 4 años están en la escuela privada, con su hijo mayor tuvo  problemas de aprendizaje,  es hiperactivo, repitió en la escuela estatal dos años. Por esa razón tuvo que ponerlo a estudiar en una escuela privada. 

Hilda es de Huanuco, a los quince años se escapo de su casa y se vino a trabajar  a Lima, como empleada en una casa, así estuvo por un buen tiempo. Consiguió un trabajo, vendiendo caldo de gallina, en el puesto de una señora, ella era ayudante, pero junto suficiente dinero para poner su propio puesto de venta de  caldo gallina,  hace cinco años, ahora tiene dos personas que la ayudan. Su hijo en tiempos de vacaciones le ayuda vendiendo chicha, su esposo es albañil. 
Desde que esta en Finca su negocio ha levantado compro una cocina a gas, por que antes cocinaba con kerosene.
Hilda necesita un crédito de 2600 soles, para comprar un carrito para vender salchi -papas, también fideos y huevos.
El sueño de Hilda es poner un restauran chifa y tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
For information on Hilda’s first loan please check: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=53417

Hilda is a member of the Bancomunial Medalla Milagrosa Society. Hilda is 32-years old and lives with her two children who are 10 and 4 years old respectively. They are in private school and her oldest son has a learning disability. He is hyperactive and was left back in the state schools; it’s for this reason that she has placed him in private school.

Hilda is from Huanuco and about 15-years ago she escaped from her house to go work in Lima, where she is employed as a maid; it has been good for awhile. She continued to work, selling chicken broth as an assistant to her boss, but felt she could make more money selling chicken broth on her own. It has been five years in the making and now she needs two people to help her. Her kids help out during their vacation time and her husband is a mason

With this loan she would like to raise a kitchen to sell salchi, fries, and also noodles and eggs. Hilda’s dream is to start a restaurant and have a proper house.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase food supplies

loans.name: Blanca Flor

texts.es:
Blanca es socia del Bancomunal Medalla Milagrosa.
Blanca es casada, tiene 61 años, cuatro hijos mayores que están casados.  
Blanca es del departamento D.  Lambayeque, Motupe, solo estudió hasta segundo D. primaria por que su papá no quiso estudie, desD. niña se puso a trabajar con su mama vendiendo comida, con el tiempo se caso, se vino a vivir a  Lima,  trabajando en casas por ocho años. Su esposo tiene una carpintería, ella decidió trabajar con su esposo en su carpintería aprendió a Lijar, laquear barnizar. 
DesD. que esta en Finca tiene capital para poder comprar material y atender pedidos, le gusta las reuniones del Bancomunal por que ha hecho buenas amigas.   
Blanca necesita un crédito D. 1000 soles, para la compra D. madera, laca, clavos, para la carpintería.
El sueño D. Blanca es que su negocio crezca, tener más ahorros para viajar a ver a sus hijos que están en otro país.
texts.en:
Blanca is a member of the Bancomunal Medalla Milagrosa. Blanca is married and is 61-years old. She has four children who are also married. Blanca is from the Lambayeque township in Motupe. She has only a second graD. education as her father did not want her to study. As a child she worked with her mother selling meals. Over some time she eventually lived in Lima working in houses for 8-years.

Her husband is a carpenter and Blanca decided to join her husband’s business of carpentry to learn how to sand, lacquer and coat. With this loan, she will be able to purchase materials and fill orders. She likes meeting with other members of Bancomunal as she has maD. great friendships. Blanca requests 1000 soles, to buy wood and nails for carpentry. Her dream is to have her own business that will allow her to travel more to see her children in other countries.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials for carpentry.

loans.name: Las Divinas Group

texts.es: El grupo "Las Divinas" esta representado por la señora Mary Evelin e integrada por 15 miembros los cuales residen en el mismo barrio donD. todos los socios se conocen D. varios años, por lo que gozan D. confianza y unión. En general los socios (as) se dedican a actividades como la panadería, trasporte público, confección D. prendas D. vestir, empleadas del hogar, venta D. comida, bebida y a la construcción D. viviendas. La competencia en el rubro comercial y D. servicios es granD. pero los socios (as) saben como superarlo para seguir trabajando y poder tener mejores ingresos. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra D. productos, materiales, insumos y herramientas para incrementar sus ingresos y así  poder mejorar su calidad D. vida y la D. sus familias. Los socios (as) son gente trabajadora y honesta como lo  han demostrado en anteriores ciclos, por lo que cuentan con experiencia en el manejo D. fondos y en grupos solidarios.
texts.en:
The 'Las Divinas' group is represented by Mary Evelin and is maD. up of 15 members who live in the same neighbourhood, who have known each other for a number of years, and who enjoy trust and solidarity as a result. The members work in activities including baking and selling bread, public transport, clothing manufacturing, domestic services, the sale of food and drinks, and housing construction. There is strong competition in the field of goods and services, but the members know how to overcome this to continue working and increasing their income. The loan will be used to buy products, materials, basic supplies and tools to increase their income and improve the quality of life for themselves and their families. The members are hard-working and honest people, as they have demonstrated in previous loan cycles. They have experience in managing funds and in working in solidarity groups.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Bertha Eulalia

texts.es:
Bertha es socia del Bancomunal Medalla Milagrosa.
Bertha es de Satipo departamento de Junín, conviviente, tiene 46 años, tienen seis hijos  de 30,25,23,21,19 ellos trabajan y el de 15 años estudia por las noches, en la escuela por que de día trabaja vendiendo chupetes.

Bertha siempre ha trabajado en la calle “rutiando” se dedica a la venta de golosinas, con su trabajo sus hijos pudieron asistir a la escuela estatal, pero educación superior no han querido estudiar. En el verano por las mañanas vende helados y por las noches vende golosinas y maní; trabaja de lunes a domingo hasta las 10 de la noche. Las dificultades que ha presentado en este negocio son cuando los municipales le quitan su mercadería, ya no se la devuelven, tienen que comprar todo de nuevo. 
Desde que Bertha esta en Finca, puede invertir su dinero, comprar mas mercadería de helados ahora en el verano.  
Ella  necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, para comprar golosinas, chocolates, cigarros y chicles. 
Bertha tiene un sueño que es comprar una moto-taxi o un carro para hacerlo trabajar y ella dedicarse a su casa.
texts.en:
Bertha is a member of Bancomunal Medalla Milagrosa. Bertha is from the Satipo township in Junin. She is 46-years old and has 6 children who are 30, 25, 23, 21, 19 and the 15-year old takes night classes because he is working during the day selling pacifiers.

Bertha always works her area routinely and is dedicated to selling sweets. With her job she was able to put her children through state school, but could not consider paying for higher education. In the summer mornings she sells ice cream and in the evenings she sells sweets and peanuts. She works from Monday to Sunday until 10 in the evening. It is difficult to have a business when the city collects on your merchandise and does not offer to replace it. Everything must be purchased brand new.

With this loan, Bertha would like to invest her money to purchase an ice cream shop to run this upcoming summer. She will need 2000 soles to purchase sweets, chocolate, cigarettes and gum. Bertha’s dream is to either one day own her own taxi, or have her own car to do her job. She would also like to one day own her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sweets, chocolate, cigarettes and gum for her store.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce A. is 35 year old, married and has four children. All her children are in school. She lives with her husband in the house they were married in, at Koforidua, a suburb of Offinso, in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She is an achiever and a resourceful young woman. She loves selling goods, the business through which she makes her living. 

Joyce has been trading in oranges, bananas, and food stuffs like plantain at the road side of Koforidua for eight years now. She treks to surrounding villages in the Central part of Ghana to purchase bulk supplies of oranges, bananas and plantains from the farmers and retails them to her customers. For lack of adequate working capital, she is not able to purchase enough supplies to make sufficient profit to support her family. She wants to use part of the profit to support her kid’s education.
  
With the loan, she would like to purchase bulk supplies of oranges, bananas and plantain to scale up her sales. She believes the loan would enable her to produce more income to support her business growth. Joyce belongs to a village bank called ‘Nyame Nti’ which means for Christ Sake. She hopes that a loan of GH¢1000 would make her business grow by restocking her inventory. This would enable her to save more and support her husband in taking care of the home.

loans.use: To buy fruits like oranges, bananas and plantain.

loans.name: Rosalía

texts.es:
Rosalía es socia del Bancomunal Medalla Milagrosa.
Rosalía es cuzqueña, conviviente, tiene 60 años, 5 hijos mayores, todos están casados.
En el Cuzco su mama vendía anticucho de carne y ella de pequeña cada día le acompañaba, así fue aprendiendo; cuando llego a Lima, se caso y empezó a vender en la puerta de su casa anticuchos, ahora tiene dos ayudantes su sobrina y su nieto, su esposo también trabaja es chofer en una empresa. 
Ella cuida a uno de sus nietos que tiene retardo leve, este tiene que aprender una actividad con las manos, y esta aprendiendo panificación. 
Desde que ella esta en Finca, agradece por que los créditos, que le han ayudado a surgir en su negocio, le gustan las reuniones del Bancomunal por que se distrae y  tiene amigas.  
Ella necesita 1000 soles, para comprar una maquina  surtidora de chicha, para vender junto con los anticuchos.     
El sueño de Rosalía es modificar su casa, por que esta mal construida, para que sus nietos  que están en un internado puedan vivir con ella.
texts.en:
Rosalia is a member of the Miraculous Medal Community Bank. Rosalia is cuzqueña, married, is 60 years old, and has 5 children who are all married. In Cuzco, her mother sold beef kabobs and little Rosalia always accompanied her and that is how she learned. When she came to Lima, she married and started to sell in kabobs out of her home. Now she has two helpers, her niece and grandson. Her husband works as a driver of a company. She takes care of one of her grandchildren who is disabled. She has had to learn to do something with her hands and now she is learning to make bread. She greatly appreciates the loans she has recieved because they have helped her build her business. She likes the community bank meetings because they distract her with friends. She needs 1,000 soles in order to purchase a condiment pump in order to accompany her kabobs. Rosalia's dream is to remodel her poorly built home for her grandchildren so that they could live there with her.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: 1,000 soles to puchase a condiment pump to accompany her kabobs

loans.name: Silvia  Rosario

texts.es:
Primer préstamo:
http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=70283
Silvia es conviviente, tiene 25 años, un hijo de 3 años que esta en el wawawasi.
Desde los 12 años empezó vendiendo chicha en botella, en el mercado, mientras que su mamá vendía verduras; después entro a trabajar como empleada en casas, no le gusto por que ganaba poco, y nuevamente empezó a vender en el  mercado, Ahora se dedica a la venta de limones, trae limones del norte del país, treinta sacos semanales, ella reparte con su esposo, en  los mercados. También por las  tardes vende jugo de naranja en la esquina de su casa.
Desde que esta en Finca tiene su propio negocio, aprendió a ahorrar, a ser responsable con los prestamos que solicita, y pagar puntual para no caer en mora. 
Silvia necesita un crédito de 2400 soles, para comprar sacos de limones del norte.
El sueño de Silvia, terminar de estudiar, en el colegio quinto de secundaria, y poner un restaurante o una jugueria.
texts.en:
First loan: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=70283 Silvia is married, 25 years old, has a 3 year old son who is in pre-school. When she was 12 years old, she started selling the bottled drink "chicha" in the market while her mother was selling vegetables. After she started working as a home employee, she did not like to earn such a low wage and so she started selling in the market again. Now she sells lemons from the North. She brings 30 sacks weekly. She distributes them in the markets with her husband. Also, she sells orange juice in the afternoons at the corner of her house. Since she has been with FINCA, she has had her own business, learned to save, and has been responsible with the loans that she has received by making her payment on time in order to avoid default. Silvia needs a loan of 2,400 soles to buy sacks of lemons from the North. Her dream is to finish high school and open a restaurant or juice bar.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: 2,400 soles to buy sacks of lemons from the north

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena S. is 40 years old. She is married with one child. At the moment, her son is in senior high school. She has been a local manufacturer of palm oil and also has been selling grocery products and fruit like bananas for the past twenty years in order to take care of her family. Palm oil is produced from palm fruits. The palm fruit is processed through various stages to obtain the palm oil. The palm oil produced is used to prepare many local dishes. Her production is on a small scale due to lacking the necessary capital to buy machines for the work of processing.

In addition to her palm oil business, she also operates a grocery shop and sells item like sugar, biscuits, evaporated milk, etc., and bananas in the community where she lives. She says this has also slowed down due to current food prices and the economic crunch in the world market. She wants to use the loan to buy more palm nuts to increase her capacity to produce in larger quantities. She plans to purchase rice, sugar, milk, biscuits, and other canned foods, etc. so that she can supply her customers on a regular basis.

Abena believes this will help expand her business to raise more income to help her husband provide food and finance her dear child's education. Abena belongs to a village bank called ‘Nyame Nti’ which means For Christ's Sake. She hopes to receive GHS 1000 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: to buy more palm fruits and grocery products to restock her inventory

loans.name: Yussy Luisa

texts.es:
Yussy es socia del Bancomunal Medalla Milagrosa.
Yussy  es madre soltera, tiene 26 años una hija de 4 años, esta en el jardín.  
Yussy no termino el colegio por que no le gustaba estudiar, quiso dedicarse a trabajar. 
Se dedico a vender en las calles desde los 18 años,, intento  trabajando en casa haciendo de todo pero lo dejo  por que ganaba poco, entonces volvió nuevamente a vender en las calles,  helados y habas. Mientras que ella trabaja en tiempos de verano deja a su hija en casa de una amiga, quien la cuida todo el día,  y a las siete de la noche Yussy  recoje a su hija.
Desde que esta en Finca, ha sido una ayuda, tiene capital para comprar mercadería.  
Necesita un crédito de 1200 soles, para comprar helados y habas. 
El sueño que tiene Yussy es tener un negocio de venta  caldo de gallina.
texts.en:
Yussy is a member of the Miraculous Medal Community Bank. Yussy is a single mother, 26 years old, has a 4 year old daughter who is in pre-school. Yussy did not finish high school because she did not like studying. She wanted to start working. Since she was 18 years old, she been a traveling street sales woman. She tries to work out of her home but she had to give it up because she did not make enough income. She then returned to selling goods throughout the streets, such as ice creams and beans. While she works in the summer time, she leaves her daughter at home with a friend who takes care of her all day. At seven at night, Yussy picks up her daughter. Since she has been with FINCA, she has had help and capital to purchase merchandise. She needs a loan of 1,200 soles to buy ice creams and beans. Her dream is to have her own business selling chicken soup.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: 1,200 soles to buy ice creams and beans

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La señora Gloria es socia del Banco Comunal “Las estrellitas Unidas del Titicaca” del centro poblado de Chipana, distrito de Pilcuyo, Provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno; tiene 29 años de edad, de estado civil casada y con 02 hijos a su cuidado, posee estudios de superior completa (enfermería técnica) 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 02  años, ella refiere que su negocio es la compra y venta de mallas para pesca; su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual pudo adquirir mas mallas para comercializarlos en las ferias de Pilcuyo 
Con este préstamo de S/ 1700.00 nuevos soles el mismo que se compromete a paga en 05 cuotas mensuales; dicho préstamo le servirá para poder adquirir hilo nylon y sogas para la confección de mallas de pesca de manera artesanal. Con las ganancias ella pretende construir su casa en el distrito de Ilave, asimismo apoyar la educación de sus hijos. 
Ella se muestra agradecida a Manuela Ramos y a su personal por todo lo que vienen haciendo en favor de las mujeres.
texts.en:
Gloria is a member of the “Las estrellitas Unidas del Titicaca” community bank of Chipana, in the district of Pilcuyo, Province of El Collao, in the Department of Puno. She is 29 years old, married and has two children in her care. She completed her Nursing degree. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for two years. Her business is buying and selling fishing nets. Her first loan was for S/ 300 soles which she used to buy more nets to sell in the markets of Pilcuyo. She will use this S/ 1,700 soles loan she will buy nylon string and rope to hand-make fishing nets. With the profits she intends to build a home in the district of Ilave as well as support her children's education. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos and its employees for all they have done to help women.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy nylon string and rope to make fishing nets by hand.

loans.name: Las Autonomicas Group

texts.es: El grupo " Las Autonómicas" esta representado por la señora Marcela y  cuenta con algunas socias que han trabajado en anteriores grupos con la fundación agrocapital  y se unieron para integrar uno nuevo conformado D. gente responsable y cumplida. En general las socias se dedican al comercio D. productos como comida, cosméticos, pan, ropa y actividades como el servicio militar, servicio domestico D. limpieza y otros son empleados D. empresas. La competencia en el ámbito laboral es difícil en estos días en que la mayoría ofrece sus servicios a más bajos precios, pero la experiencia y la calidad humana D. las socias las incita a seguir adelante sin importar la competencia. El financiamiento esta destinado a la compra D. insumos y materiales así como para la reparación D. sus herramientas D. trabajo para brindar un mejor servicio. Los miembros del grupo conocen la forma D. trabajo con grupos solidarios por lo que saben administrar bien los fondos otorgados y responder con sus obligaciones con responsabilidad.
texts.en:
The 'Las Autonómicas' group is represented by Marcela and includes a number of members who have worked in previous groups with Fundacion Agrocapital. They have gotten together to form a new group maD. up of responsible and dedicated people. The members work selling products including food, cosmetics, bread and clothing, and in other fields including military service and domestic cleaning services, while others are employed by private companies. The competition in the labour market is difficult these days, when the majority of the population offer their services at the lowest prices. However the experience and human qualities of the group members spurs them to continue on without worrying about the competition. The loan will be used to buy basic supplies and materials, and to repair work tools, in order to offer better service. The group members are familiar with working in solidarity groups, and know how to manage funds well and responsibly fulfil their obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Jackeline

texts.es:
Jackeline es socia del Bancomunal Medalla Milagrosa.
Jackeline es conviviente, tiene 21 años, dos hijos de 4 y 1 año ambos están en el jardín cuna. 
Jackeline es la menor de cuatro hermanos, pero  no vivió con ellos, por que sus padres se separaron, ella vivió con su abuela, quine la crió hasta los dieciocho años, que es cuando se enamora y se va a vivir con su esposo en casa de sus suegros. Sus hermanos están en el extranjero y le envían dinero, con el cual ella puso un negocio de cabinas de  Internet, tiene nueve maquinas en casa de sus suegros, su esposo trabaja arreglando computadoras.
Desde que esta en Finca, aprendió de las demás socias, como se esfuerzan para surgir en su negocio,  aprendió a ser responsable en sus pagos.  
Ella necesita un crédito de 1000 soles, para  poner una mini librería, en su negocio de Internet; necesita comprar una vitrina, hojas, fólder, lapiceros. 
El sueño que tiene Jackeline es estudiar diseño grafico, y tener un local propio.
texts.en:
Jackeline is a member of the "Medalla Milagrosa" community bank. Jackeline is married, 21 years old and has two children aged four and one who are both in nursery school. Jackeline is the youngest of four children but she never lived with her siblings because her parents separated and she lived with her grandmother who raised her until she was 18, at which time she fell in love and went to live with her husband at her in-laws. Her brothers live outside the country and send her money which she used to open an internet cafe. She has new computers at her in-laws and her husband's job is fixing computers. Since joining Finca she has learned from the other members how to make efforts to improve in business and how to be responsible with repayments. She needs a loan of 1,000 soles in order to open a mini-bookstore in her internet cafe: she needs to buy a display cabinet, paper, folders, pens. Jackeline's dream is to study graphic design and have her own place of business.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To open a mini-bookstore and to buy a display case, paper, folders and pens.

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua A., a 65-year-old farmer and merchant, is married with six kids. For lack of funds she could not help any of her children to attend senior high school. Akosua lives with her husband in a village called Koforidua in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She is farmer who farms food crops like yams, maize, plantains, and cassava and retails them at the community market during market days. For most of her life she has been selling bananas. She uses the proceeds from her crop to purchase a bulk supply of bananas for re-sale. Akosua has been farming for the past 45 years.

She is requesting a loan to enable her to buy increased stocks of bananas, agro-chemicals and fertilizer to grow her business and scale up sales. She says her major challenge has to do with the future. She hopes to increase her savings to help her children continue their education.

Akosua believes this will help expand her business to raise more income to help her husband provide food and finance her dear children's education. Akosua belongs to a village bank called ‘Awurade aye’ which means "God has done it". She hopes to receive GHS 500 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy increased supply of bananas, agro-chemicals and fertilizer

loans.name: Meyer Jhasmani

texts.es:
Primer préstamo:
http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=53417
Meyer es socio del Bancomunal Medalla Milagrosa.
Meyer es del departamento de San Martín, soltero, tiene 23 años; su mama lo trajo cuando tenia tres años a Lima, aquí estudio hasta terminar estudios secundarios en el colegio.   
Desde los quince años vende en las calles con su mamá; él trabaja de 9 a 4 pm, vendiendo helados, de 6 a10 pm, vende golosinas y  habas. 
Meyer presenta dificultades en su salud, a los doce años se disloco la rodilla jugando fútbol, por falta de dinero no se hizo atender, ahora se cansa rápido, tiene poca fuerza en la pierna, y cada día  llega de trabajar  adolorido a su casa.
Meyer necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para comprar golosinas,  habas y  helados.
Meyer tiene muchos sueños, quiere estudiar mecánica automotriz, comprar un moto-car y  alquilar una tienda para venta de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Summary of first loan: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=53417 Meyer is a member of the Medalla Milagrosa ('Miraculous Medal') community bank. He is from the department of San Martín, 23-years old and single. At the age of 3 his mother moved him to Lima, where he studied until finishing high school. Since he was 15 Meyer has worked with his mother as a street vendor, working from 9:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. selling ice cream, and from 6:00 to 10:00 p.m. selling candy and roasted bean snacks. Meyer suffers from health problems; when he was 12 he dislocated his knee playing soccer and didn't have the money to seek medical attention. As a result, he gets tired easily and doesn't have much strength in his leg. Every day he arrives home from work aching. Meyer needs a loan of 1,000 PEN to buy candy, beans, and ice cream. He has many goals and wants to study automechanics, buy a moto-car, and rent a store to sell groceries.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of candy, roasted beans, and ice cream.
